Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: jmdc1
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this hotel was a delight! Clean rooms with fast internet (for a charge), and a nice restaurant. It is convenient, too, only a few minutes walk to Vancouver Central station...Very easy access from the airport on the train! The only thing I could fault is perhaps the challenge of getting from the rooms to the spa/gym/pool. It is a rather long (and somewhat embarrassing) walk through the lobby to get to the other elevators in order to access these facilities. However, this is a small complaint compared with the excellent restaurants and room service, the lovely windows and the comfy beds in the rooms, and the virtually soundproof rooms. Overall this place is great, and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “4-star hotel for a 5-star price”
Reviews.Author: ogondai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place finding a decent price at a deep discount. I'm glad we did...one of the most off-putting places I've been. It's a large factory-style hotel, with concierges who can barely stand to look at you, and a gaudily gilded lobby. It's comfortable enough, and the room was adequate. Location was also adequate, as was the service. However, given the hotel's typical price and clear pretensions, it wasn't the right place. I'm in no hurry to return.

Reviews.Title: “great plush rooms...best afternoon tea in vancouver....ok spa...fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: foodtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: 6 day stay while husband on business...wonderful cozy room with good toiletries (big point for star rating)----LOVED complimentary use of umbrellas in room! comfy beds! why no free wifi? why spa services (massage and pedi) so blah? why no fridge (just mini bar)? why only ok dinner taste? BUT afternoon tea is best in city! (good food, value and service...i stayed at waterfront hotel in feb when i was back on business and went back to have sutton place tea!) great location to shop and eat nearby (thai, japadog, sutton market, sushi, coffee); desk service not quality for stars rating

Reviews.Title: “If not for corporate rate (discount), hotel would not be worth it”
Reviews.Author: JoshBillings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sutton Place for 6 days during a recent conference. I had stayed there in 2010 as well. The location is very good located on Burrard just a block from major shopping street and about 1/2 mile from convention center. There is also a great supermarket next door with quick breakfast and lunch. There is a movie theater across the street. It always struck me that the lobby and front of the hotel was much nicer than the rooms - that was certainly true in 2010 and unfortunately still is true. Lower rooms still have non-LCD TV's. Go to upper rooms to get LCD TVs. The hotel also needs a quick breakfast / lunch place within the hotel - there isn't one, but there are alternatives outside of the hotel. In my opinion, the Sutton Place is trying to be a Fairmont (which there are three within 6 blocks of Sutton Place by the way), but doesn't quite make it. Like the title of my post said - I was on a corporate rate; otherwise I would have stayed at a Fairmont in Vancouver for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BethFF
Reviews.Content: Was not a recommended conference hotel for meeting I was attending, but worked out great! Price was better, service excellent, & convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “"Best Place We have every been to"”
Reviews.Author: MVunituraga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to several hotel, but the treatment we receive at Sutton Place Vancouver is absolutely incredible. We went their for our 1 year anniversary. And We received chocolate covered strawberries and a cookie with "Happy 1 year Anniversary" on it. On top if that they made reservations for us at the Keg in Yaletown. They order an appetizer for us from the hotel, Wow.. how more special can it get. I always love the warm welcome we receive from everyone at the hotel. They are all friendly and nice. Love the rooms as well... Whoever says that this place isn't good or not worth it.. needs to open their eyes.. We visit Sutton Place Hotel 2-3 times a year.. and we live in the lower mainland... My husband and I find it as a vacation away from home. Great Service, Great Food, Great Rooms... Its a happy place to be. Whenever you need a time away.. Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver is the place to be. Just a pleasant place....and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alisontedford
Reviews.Content: Front desk area is cramped. Staff are snobby and unprofessional (discussing shift cancellations in front of us due to low reservation count). We got up to our room and my boyfriend asked if we were sleeping above a bar because it was so noisy below us. Soundproofing in all directions = fail. When you add to that all the sirens from the fire station sleep was not continuous. Bed was uncomfortable, room was small. The bathroom had the last guests garbage on the floor. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Tips_AB
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was great. My room was nice, clean and very spacious. Great bathroom with a separate shower and tub. The bed was really soft and comfortable. The TV was an old tube-style TV (not a flat screen) but that's not a big deal. I really appreciated the in-room DVD player! I found it odd that there wasn't an in-room coffee maker. You can order coffee via room service, but it's $8 plus a delivery charge! You're better off going to the Blenz coffee shop across the street. The service at the hotel was great - room service was very prompt and friendly. We asked the concierge to recommend a spot for dinner - he made a great recommendation (Joe Fortes) and made a reservation for us. When we arrived, we received a complementary appetizer from the hotel! That was a nice touch. The valet gave us cookies on our way out, which was another nice touch we all appreciated (I was there on business with a group of colleagues). The location at Burrard & Robson was great. One morning I walked down to Canada Place, it took about 10 minutes from the hotel. Lots of great shopping and restaurants on Robson. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Quiet”
Reviews.Author: dukehuh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the eighth floor located right next to the elevator. We got a good rate, but normally we would not stay in such a location. In the lobby, there were many younger people, so I was expecting it to be a loud night. As it was a suite, there was an additional doorway separating the entrance hall and the bedroom, so we decided to give it a try. The doors and walls we found were surprisingly thick, and we could not hear anyone. I don't know if that was because no was else was on our floor or if it was because of the construction of the room, but that was a pleasant surprise as we were able to rest and keep our Mountain Time Zone sleep schedule. The room itself was spartan and dated in the furnishings, but acceptable. The TV's were huge, so I was happy in that regard. I have heard there is a lot of history to the place. It's nice, but it looks like time has passed it by in terms of looks. But for us, we like a place where we can rest rather than how it looks, so in that regard we were really happy. The location is great for walking around that part of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday at the Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: lindasm
Reviews.Content: Thank-you for making my daughter's 19th Birthday such a special time for her and her friends! The giant Happy Birthday cookie and the chocolate dipped strawberries were a nice touch!!! Thanks sooo much Linda

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel. Excellent location for Robson Street shopping.”
Reviews.Author: runningm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Sutton Place after getting a good deal for a room online. The website we used classed it as a 5 star but it definitely fell short of 5 star standards in all ways. That said, it is still a good hotel. We were high up and had great city views. Rooms were attractive and had everything necessary, including a well stocked minibar. Beds were comfortable, although I've never had single beds at any other hotel in North America! Negatives were that there was more dust than I like, especially around the bathroom baseboard area. The quilts were in a shiny fabric which slipped off the bed easily! Also a lot of noise through the communicating door to the next room. Very little noise from outside though. We used the swimming pool, hot tub and steam room. All were ok for an older hotel and plenty of towels were available. The hotel is steps from Robson Street, so we could drop off purchases from our shopping trip at lunchtime. Also walking distance to Canada Place, Gastown and Yale Town. We had the buffet breakfast, which was good and afternoon tea, which was lovely. Staff were all polite, helpful and friendly and service was efficient. Definitely worth giving this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family.”
Reviews.Author: VictorianPoppet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their two bedroom suite in the Residences recently and overall, the stay impressed me. Service is good, the staff attentive and the location ideal. The room itself was large, very spacious with a good sized kitchen and so much storage space (they could probably add another room). It was clean but a bit outdated (although I understand they are upgrading some areas of the hotel. We ordered room service twice and it was great both times. Our evening meal was better than some of the restaurants close by which surprised me and the breakfast was big, tasty and filling. An area that needs attention is the amount of time guests have to wait to check-in or out. On both occasions there was only one person at the front desk and on check-out there was a queue snaking around the foyer (on a Sunday).

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs update to compete with the competition”
Reviews.Author: mauitennis
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Saturday night with my wife celebrating our anniversary. Enjoyed the property. They gave us free upgrade and surprised us with chocolate covered strawberries. Room was clean and nice. Great location. Had average breakfast in restaurant. Starting to see some wear and tear. With all of the new luxury competition, the hotel will definitely need an update soon to compete. Service was good. Wifi is not free, but many hotels are still charging for it.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: mmladventure
Reviews.Content: This place got a "moon" in Lonely Planet and other rave reviews. The review must've been old or the reviewer lucky. Nothing special here: small room, high price. Charged for internet. No view (even on top floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: malte83
Reviews.Content: Overall great experience. Friendly staff, decent rooms. There is little reason to complain. The hotel lacks a number of amenities to truly compete with luxury hotels such as the Four Seasons - I guess it especially lacks in original style. It all seems quite 'put together'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but unhelpful staff and no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: SkygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all about the room or the location of the hotel, which were both fantastic. The rooms were big and clean and we had a wonderful city view from the 16th floor. Unfortunately, the staff were extremely unhelpful and we must have found the one hotel in North America that doesn't have free WIFI, which was a huge drawback and something we had failed to research before we booked. The bar and restaurant were good with excellent service, as you would expect. I have mixed feelings about this hotel as there were some nice touches (free umbrellas, nice bar) but ultimately let down by rude staff and lack of WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eminemily
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place hotel was fabulous! The hotel is immaculate, the fuzzy robes in the closet are a nice touch as well as the umbrella in the closet, perfect for Vancouver! The beds are amazing, definitely the best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 and 1/2 star hotel - No way !”
Reviews.Author: DEL G
Reviews.Content: If you are a business traveller, avoid this place. No free WIFI unless you stay in their costlier rooms. The business centre had a machine to print boarding passes, but was out of order. The computers were only accessible by paying $6.50 for twenty minutes, and then the attached printers would not print. The concierge tolds us that the whole business centre was contacted out and that none of the stuff in it worked, and hadn't for some time. He suggested we ask for our $6.50 at the desk, but they blew us off. Never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Location & a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee-travels
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely two day stay here at the Sutton. Our king room was quiet, clean & very welcoming! The duvet that adorned the bed was lovely, not at all the average. The toiletries are Gilchrist & Soames & smell lovely. The staff make you feel at home and always greet you with a smile and a helping hand. I received an email a few days before our arrival welcoming us to the hotel and offering help with making reservations for activities, dining, spas etc.. It's a GREAT place with an AWESOME location. Close to theatres, restaurants, and shopping! A bit of a walk (couple blocks) if you are taking the Canada line in from the airport but definitely doable. Looking forward to more stays at the Sutton!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Paola C
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom suite at this hotel for just 1 night in mid-February, 2012 We were travelling back from Whistler going to Seattle and we wanted to spend a nice weekend in Vancouver, which is an amaizing city! Check-in: was quick! Concierge: extremely helpful and friendly. The suggested a very good Chinese restaurant at walking distance from the hotel. Hotel room had 1 bedroom with King size bed and a pull-out sofa in the living area. Pull out was big enough for my kids (7 and 11 years old) but it would not fit bigger kids. Location: unbeatable! 1/2 block from Robson Street where all the nice shops are. We left the car in the garage although it was quite expensive (if I'm not mistaken $34 per day)! Great pool + hot tub for the kids to play. We booked through the Tripadvisor website and received a special offer with free internet access otherwise they would charge for that! We did not try the onsite restaurant but their brunch menu looked very interesting. We will go back! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The Little Extras Make the Difference”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgirrl
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Sutton Place Hotel and I was very pleased. My husband and I booked the room with a discount from a Tripadvisor promo code. We are locals and wanted to spend the evening downtown. Prior to the date we were to stay, the hotel emailed me a welcome with links to view local attractions and such. It is a nice service for those from out of town. We valeted my car which was pricey ($40 I think) but I think it's the standard for the area. The location in downtown Vancouver is excellent. Its at the corner of Burrard and Robson St which is known for its shopping. The lobby is lovely and check-in was quick and efficient. Up in our room we had a great view of Robson Street. There was the king bed, large flat screen tv, stocked mini-bar, various snacks ($), free inroom coffee/tea, desk etc. The linens were nice. In the bathroom there was the usual shampoo, conditioner, soaps, but also bath oil, shoe shine kit, a glass container with cotton balls, q-tips and in the shower was a new loofah sponge (sealed of course). These extras really make the room special. Room service is available at an extra charge. We did not use the pool. Our dinner was in Gastown so the valet hailed us a cab and it was only $7. We ate at Fleuri (their dining room) for breakfast in the morning with a group of friends. This left a little to be desired by way of service but all in all was good. Perhaps a smaller group (we were 6) would have been different. Check out was also quick and friendly. Very pleased over all.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays here - got engaged here lastyear!”
Reviews.Author: laura_w224
Reviews.Content: We have had 2 lovely stays here, the most recent in January 2012 and the last one April 2011 when my fiance proposed in our lovely room with help from the concierge. On that occasion we had booked on Hotwire looking for a 5 star hotel and got this one, the second time deliberately found it and booked through Kayak (which ended up being Orbitz I think). The parking is ridiculously expensive. Room service was amazing, we arrived late after a flight and we could't have found better food if we went out and looked for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: deserttacoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton just this past saturday. It's a beautiful Hotel right in a central location. Minutes to major bus stops. Parking costs are steep, I believe $40.00 per night , so if you are from the Island, take the ferry , pick up the #257 express city bus and it takes you within walking distance to the hotel.The room was clean and wow what a view! We got a special which included a $40.00 hotel voucher which we used in the hotel pub...the best fish and chips ever! A little pricey ($19.00 but so worth it. There is a nice wine shop attached to the hotel with a great selection. Fresh orchids displayed through-out the hotel that were just spectacular. Would for sure stay there again, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AbbotsfordSunflower
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel....service was excellent! My only complaint was $40.00 to park car for a day...way overpriced! Rooms were ok but definitely needed updating to match the rest of hotel. A bit disappointing after walking into lobby then seeing our room.Still have old fashioned tv in room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for.”
Reviews.Author: Wordfiend
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place Vancouver for a 4-night business trip. During my stay I, unfortunately, came down with a really bad cold, so I used Room Service, which was excellent. I also ate in the dining room (excellent service). The "gift shop" is really more of a convenience store than a gift shop, but there are plenty of other souvenir-type shops around. Convenient walk to shops, restaurants and the stunningly beautiful Vancouver Convention Centre. Very, very comfortable bed. (No back pain, yay!)

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Emilia Y
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel on Hotwire at their discounted rate, so it was a surprise which hotel we got until we handed over our credit card. I am very disappointed that this was the hotel we got. Before we even arrived, we called the hotel that morning to find out how many beds we had been given in our room, either 2 Queens or 1 King, as Hotwire makes no guarantees. The person who answered the phone was quite rude and said that because of how we booked, the options above were the 2 possibilities. We did not ask for any upgrades, we just wanted to know what kind of room it was. It was a king room. When we first arrived, the woman who checked us in just seemed like she was having a very bad day. She didn't smile, barely made eye contact and did not even say "Welcome" but the rest of the staff were quite friendly. The elevators up to our room were quite fast, I think one may have been programmed to return to the lobby so there was never really a wait for it to come. Our room was a decent size (we stayed on the 7th floor) but the bathroom seemed quite dark. The wall paper was slightly peeling through out the room and there appeared to several stains on the walls. The TV was a small tube style in the cabinet and only had basic cable. The TV "guide" that was posted beside it, my boyfriend said had the wrong information on it. It was placed to the left of the bed so it was difficult for us to watch comfortably together. The bed was quite hard for my liking, and having stayed in several 5 star hotels around Vancouver, I had expected a pillow top bed and this was a regular spring mattress. The pillows were large king sized pillows but my head sunk right to the bottom of them! I had a very difficult time getting comfortable. The one good thing about this hotel is the location! Very central, its a short walk to 2 Skytrain lines, shopping, good restaurants, the cinema is right across the street, and there are lots of buses around to take you around the city. Most of what you could want is in walking distance. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. It felt more like a 3 star hotel than a 5 star. We live in the lower mainland but we stayed in the city to have a nice hotel for our anniversary. I expected a lot better from Sutton Place after reading so many stellar reviews. Perhaps because we paid the discounted rate, we got a discounted room but we will not be returning to Sutton Place for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: PortMoodyGal2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Vancouver, but wanted to spend a special night out to celebrate our anniversary. They were so wonderful at Sutton place. We ended up getting an upgrade to a beautiful corner room (2010), and the service was super - especially from Tyler at the front desk. The proximity to Robson street and all its great shopping and restaurants was ideal - it took us less than 5 minutes to walk to Joe Fortes, where we had a terrific dinner. There are many other wonderful award-winning restaurants within a 5-15 minute radius of this hotel. We've had a few splurge weekends at other hotels in town but the service here has made it my new favourite...I was super-happy with the whole experience, from booking to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tod A
Reviews.Content: Our expectations are always met (without exception) with courteous and professional care. our family is always made to feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter13222
Reviews.Content: 5 star service as usual. This is a very special hotel which I consider as home away from home. I have been staying here whenever I am in vancouver alone for business or with my family for leisure. The rooms are weel equipped and comfortable. The staff are always very kind and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Charm”
Reviews.Author: WarmerTemps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, the hotel is comfortable and accommodating without being pretentious. Staff are very professional. The location is hard to beat if you want Downtown Vancouver. As stated by others the parking rates are quite staggering, however some room rates do include parking and in-room internet. Overall this is a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Well Run Property”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at Sutton Place in a while, and glad I returned. It is a warm, inviting, elegant hotel and has a highly professional staff as well. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious, bed very comfortable and frankly after staying in so many modern, more boutique style hotels in Vancouver, Sutton Place comes across as much more 'classic' comfort, which I found refreshing and genuine. Also very centrally located near shopping, dining, transport, etc. Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Room in a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skibug_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sutton three times in the past, but it had been about five years or so since our last visit. This time we booked two rooms, one double bed room for my parents and one what we thought would be a two double bed room for my family, which we had confirmed prior to arrival. Upon arrival the two doubles beds were actually two twins. After some discussion with the front desk we were able to get a cot to the room which was appreciated. We found our room to have fabulous view looking towards the northern mountains and city. The TV was not a flat screen one would expect in a Five Star, but instead it was a big tube TV one would expect to find in a basement rec room. Both rooms were clean and classically decorated but the bathroom tub and fixtures were out of date. In general, we felt like we had a 3 star room at a 5 star hotel as we have had nicer updated rooms 4 star hotels in the area. The little things we found missing this visit was no newspaper and the bed wasn’t turned down at night, which they did at our last visit which was a nice touch at a Five Star hotel. Maybe it happens elsewhere in the hotel but not on our floor and this room. We found most of the hotel staff very kind and helpful from the valet staff to the doorman and the reception staff (with the exception of one that made us feel like we arrived in a chuck wagon, which we didn’t by the way). If you like Robson, this hotel is right on its door step with easy walking to many restaurants in the area. Valet parking is 39.50 per day so that will rack up your bill in the end if you have wheels.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant and it's in a prime location. What puts this place in a league of its own is the service. The staff is friendly, accomodating, and they will go out of their way to make sure you have a delightful vacation. Sutton Place is the complete package.

Reviews.Title: “My go-to Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuck S
Reviews.Content: Every time I get back to Vancouver, the Sutton Place is my hotel choice. It's conveniently located to highway access, downtown, great restaurants and the staff has always been nothing short of excellent. Afternoon tea and the chocolate buffet are outstanding. Outstanding value and will continue to be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Girl's Getaway Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: zerrina
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Sutton Place and love staying here. Great location, clean rooms, comfortable beds, friendly/helpful staff. However, I don't recommend eating breakfast at the restaurant, pretty spendy for what you get. Maybe the buffet is the better way to go. Parking is spendy but hotel usually has a deal that helps cover the cost of parking. But this is my hotel of choice when I come to Vancouver!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the right touches.”
Reviews.Author: paradisodelmar
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and well appointed. Lovely lobby and forecourt. Reasonable food prices.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: Great location by Robson Street, walking distance to most downtown highlights! We had a 2 bedroom and had lots of room to stretch out with the kids

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: TheLeonard
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel to stay at in Vancouver. Just a half block to Robson Street for all its shopping, dining and people watching! Request a north facing room to overlook Robson, the water and mountains. The on-site bar has to be the classiest in town!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver mini break”
Reviews.Author: MMD94
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our two nights at the Sutton Place Hotel. It was a perfect location for our cultural activities, theatre, cinema, art gallery and food.

Reviews.Title: “My Wife Always Feels Safe”
Reviews.Author: MJBBigWhite
Reviews.Content: We live in Kelowna, British Columbia and when we travel to Vancouver we like to stay at the Sutton Place Hotel. The dog friendly rooms even have our golden retriever feeling special. I thiknk she'd rather lay at the front door and get the pets from guests going in and out then being upstairs with us. Interesting on our last trip, Super Bowl weekend was a comment my wife made getting into the elevator. Our 17 year old asked why she wasn't taking the stairs. Here comment, 'There's something about this place that just makes me feel safe'. It seems everything they turned their hand at is for guest comfort and satisfaction. Trust me my wife takes a lot of stairs. It's a good thing sometimes but not when you want t a view of the city. These guys do a good job. Michael J

Reviews.Title: “Four star for sure”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 30th January. Great location, friendly staff, nice bedroom. A few things that keep it in the realm of 4*. The bathroom was an refit i.e. the bath and plumbing were sub par. Keen to charge $14 for WiFi which seems cheap given the expense of the room. The t.v. was old so a small screen and poor quality image. All in all a good hotel with a few provisos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan C
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Sutton on Saturday January 21, 2012 with two girlfriends in a one bedroom suite. View was fantastic! Location was terrific! Robson St just around the corner, anything you could want or need at your fingertips. Service was great. Quick and easy with efficient staff everywhere. Room was nice. King bed, big bathroom with great tub and separate shower. Nice sized sitting room with couch and two chairs. Nice tv. Had champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries in suite waiting for us. Sunday brunch was the bomb! $42 pp but worth every penny. Buffet includes all sorts of breakfast choices, a huge seafood section with mussels, clams, prawns and salmon. A great salad bar, a beautiful piece of meat and even some japanese appies. Yum yum. Oh and the desserts were works of art that tasted delicious. There are lots of great places to stay in Vancouver but this hotel is definitely in my top 5.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Hawleydaze
Reviews.Content: If your passion is shopping, this is the hotel for you! Close to the shops on Robson St. and just a couple of blocks from Granville. Sutton Place Hotel is also an easy walk to Rogers Arena and B.C. Place Stadium. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. The T.V. needs to be updated to a flat screen. Parking is expensive like all downtown hotels. $39.50 per night but they do allow self parking, in and out privledges, and a stay until 4:00PM. Our room was on the seventh floor, the only view being other buildings and the back alley but nonetheless a most enjoyable visit. Scotiabank cineplex theatre is almost directly across the street should you wish to take in a movie.

Reviews.Title: “Get pampered in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gonegaiting
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place Hotel is lovely and the service is superb for a pretty big hotel. It isn't cheap but right at Burrard and Robson in the heart of downtown you pay for location. If you can't afford the hotel book William at Vida Spa in the hotel for a massage. Pure heaven. The only negative about the room was lighting which, as is the case in most hotels, was too dim. The restaurant is also surprisingly good with excellent fish and a very nice breakfast buffet including smoked fish and miso soup. There is also a really nice pool and gym area though I didn't have time to try either.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucas_W1
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. The hotel has all amenities & the service is top notch. Staff are friendly & helpful. Location is great - close to main shopping street & plenty of restaurants. All at a reasonable price. Next time I'm in Vancouver, there is no question - this is the hotel I will be staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NDThom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the rooms are a good size but what really made my stay in Sutton Palace so enjoyable was the excellent staff who were always friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is excellently situated in downtown Vancouver and I found it easy to walk everywhere from here. The bathroom in my room was in need of a few minor repairs and the swimming pool changing rooms were on a different floor to the pool, but these are only very minor faults in an otherwise beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, comfortable, quiet rooms, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Laura_in_Victoria
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver for business frequently, and often stay here. I have now stayed here on five separate occasions, and have consistently enjoyed my stays. The service is always excellent, while being unobtrusive. The location is very safe, and even though it is close to Robson street, the rooms themselves are quite quiet. Linens are all lovely. My only complaint (heard from others as well) relates to the parking and internet fees. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Loriian
Reviews.Content: Loved Vancouver,choice of hotel, and the lounge there was so much fun... Met very nice people there!!! Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful Lobby, Outdated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NathanSF12
Reviews.Content: I spent stayed at sutton place 1/21/12 through 1/24/12. The service was friendly and the staff was helpful. The hotel lobby is classic old style elegance and it is very beautiful. I was however quite disapointed with our room. We stayed in a small apartment suite. The carpets were stained, the furniture was dated, paint was chipped, the bathtub caulk was in need of repair, the bed was just okay, and our thermostat didn't work. The room also had a standup in room air conditioning unit which looked very akward. Maybe I just got a dud of a room but it certainly didn't feel 5 star. 5 star service, 4 star lobby, 3 and half star rooms, that could really use a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: daw45
Reviews.Content: I took my wife on a surprise birthday trip to Vancouver. I was undecided where to stay so I let Hotwire.com pick for me. I put in their search that I wanted a 5 star hotel downtown for $102/nt. I was given the Sutton Place hotel. I knew nothing about this place but soon found out that I got a great deal!! The hotel's location was perfect right on Burrard & Robson streets (the hub of Vancouver's nightlife). My reservation didn't specify what room type we had so i sent an e-mail to the hotel's reservation dept. asking for a king bed room with a view. I mentioned I was taking my wife on a surprise trip. When we pulled up to the hotel, We were impressed. Everyone from the doorman to the reception clerk were great. When we checked in, they said we had a king room on the top floor (21st) with a view of Burrard street. They guy who checked us in wished my wife a happy birthday and gave us our keys . When we opened the door to our room, I knew we scored! It looked brand new and the floor to ceiling window had an awesome view of the city. We went out for a bit and when we came back in, there was a tray with chocolate dipped strawberries and a "Happy Anniversary" message ( they got the wrong occasion, but it was the thought that counted) The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. We had a great 2 night stay. it made our Vancouver experience very special. I would definitley recommend the Sutton Place Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old world style hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: xsteves
Reviews.Content: On Burrard Street just off Robson, the Sutton Place has a great location for walking around Vancouver. The rooms are very nice and the staff excellent. They have good deals on line for rooms from time to time. We had bad experience in the restaurant. Only went there because we had a certificate that came with the room. The menu choices were sparse and unattractive and the portions miniscule.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: jfbibeau
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place hotel was a great stay! The location at Burrard and Robson makes it super convenient for shopping and eating - lots of great locations around. Service was spot-on from all the staff. The hotel is a bit old but everything was still clean and renovated. Rooms were roomy and beds really comfortable. I only have 2 complaints - the parking is outrageous (40$ per night), and the hotel charges for internet (20$ per day). I think the hotel would be much better value if they would eliminate or lower some of these charges! Can definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy King Bed”
Reviews.Author: Arcin B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sutton Place for 2 days. Our plan was to walk around downtown Vancouver and location of Sutton Place was very convenient. A block south of Robson and right on Burrand, it is perfect. We got a 'Premium Room'. Our room was on the 20th floor. It was very clean and had a very comfortable king size bed. I must say this was the most comfortable bed we slept in. They also have a turn down service which was a surprise for me. We had great help from the concierge service for a few restaurant ideas and where we should go and visit in the few days we had. He was very friendly and took his time to give details about his recommendations. We took advantage of a deal that was being offered at the time of our stay (40$ credit per day for food/beverage/wifi expenses) and used it for breakfast and dinner. Food was nice but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel, Better Location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLSUFan
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is in the heart of downtown Vancouver next to many good restaurants. The price is very reasonable and the rooms are very clean. It is an older hotel but it has had many upgrades so the hotel is very comfortable. The room sizes are quite nice for a downtown hotel and very comfortable. The service was outstanding. The hotel had very good restaurant tips and everyone we tried was spot on. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this location highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: laut0022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend before we departed to the family cabin in Northern BC. We ended up reserving this hotel through Hotewire.com and were impressed with our stay from check-in to check-out. Hotwire considers this to be a 5 star hotel, but I would say it is more like a 4-4.5 star hotel. During our stay, it was my birthday. The front desk took note of this when I gave them my passport at check-in and a tray of chocolate dipped strawberries was in our room when we returned after dinner. What a great surprise! Pros: -Great location -Spacious room and bathroom -Excellent view of downtown -Great toiletry items -In-room coffee maker (website failed to mention this) -Excellent staff Cons: -Tube TV (for a 5 star hotel, I would expect a flat screen tv) -The bed wasn't the most comfortable (again for a 5 star hotel, I would expect more comfort) -We were asked at check-in if we wanted a newspaper and we said yes. However, during our 4 night stay, we never received one, even after asking on the 2nd day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: SeaToSkyTraveller
Reviews.Content: I think we must have stayed in a different hotel to the previous poster. We arrived at Sutton Place at noon on 30th December intending to just drop our bags - but we were able to check in straight away. The room was a good size and was beautifully furnished with a spacious immaculately clean bathroom. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I have slept in and we had plump pillows with additional ones in the wardrobe if required. All of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. We will certainly stay again next time we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent High level of service”
Reviews.Author: ReneLes
Reviews.Content: WE can always count on Sutton Place providing us with excellent service, from check in to check out - its all good

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location..you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: swinslowvocalvision
Reviews.Content: This was a planned trip recommended by local vancouver friends.....It was a hotel that exuded Christmas everywhere, Check in was easy, Gerards was very pricey, the food is ok, drinks were very expensive, However our family experience was awesome, great place to invite friends and business partners. Rooms are small yet roomy. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: debathome
Reviews.Content: We love the Sutton hotel and have stayed there many times. It is a older classy hotel where the staff and service is second to none. I feel for a 5 star they do need to update their rooms a bit . There should be flat screens and iPod docks and the bathrooms could use an update also. The location is amazing for all the shopping and restaurants. Ask for a corner room looking towards the water.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kele T
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks in 2 bedroom apartment. Kitchen equipment was not on the same level as we have used to in European ski cottages. It was very simple and basic stuff like scissors and proper knife was missing. Standard internet connection was lousy, unable to do work online meetings with it. Parking was so expensive that we parked across the street. However anything else was great, so I'd most likely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, despite "system being down"”
Reviews.Author: DMTM
Reviews.Content: Lovely corner room, great view. Check in was handled reasonably efficiently, despite computer failure due to server upgrade. Very well equipped gym and good sized pool, all well maintained. Restaurant also up to the job. Checkout marred by continued computer issues but after a little time everything was handled very graciously Nana Kin, Asst Front office mgr.

Reviews.Title: “We Have a New Favourite Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Andy R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Vancouver from Monday, November 14, 2011 to Thursday, November 17, 2011. OUTSTANDING! For only another $20, we got a premium room on the 19th floor. It was classy, but cozy. It was facing south down Burrard Street, but was about 4 rooms in from the street, kind of like on the inside of the left arm of a "U". The view was incredible and there were no noise problems. It seemed that the room had good, modern windows that insulated sound well, and if you really wanted fresh air you could open one of them. The pool and hot tub were also nice. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It's steps away from Robson Street, a couple of blocks from Granville, across the street from the Scotiabank film theatre, across the street from a supermarket and across the street from Salathai, an excellent thai restaurant. Kudos to the guys at the concierge desk. There was Miguel who heard we were on our way to Mexico and just spontaneously came up with some great insider tips for the location we were going to. His colleague at the concierge desk (sorry, I forgot your name!) did a great job getting us Vancouver Canucks tickets for a reasonable price. These guys were like the rest of the hotel - classy, but homey and not snobby.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip November 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jimb011
Reviews.Content: Excellent service provided again by all the Sutton Place employees. truly a pleasure to stay there. Just like home even while on Business.

Reviews.Title: “Almost too nice!”
Reviews.Author: screenname00000
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a shuttle from Amtrak. You will not get better staff attention anywhere else in the world. Drinks and food are overpriced. That must be how they pay for thier amazing staff. The hotel is beautiful all around. Our room was HUGE! We had two bedrooms, full kitchen, deck and living room/dining room. It is nicer then most appartments. No TV in one bedroom, and a REALLY tiny TV in bedroom #2. Close to everything I wanted to do. The negatives we petty. Near perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Classy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorTD1958
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Well located in the downtown business core. Excellent Service.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bruce W
Reviews.Content: A place I could permanently call home, it is comfortable to the emotion, senses and body. Close to everything in Vancouver, think walking distance. Especially enjoy the bar after a long day before retiring, the staff is knowledgable and freindly as are the rest of the staff who greet you with a smile from the time you first walk in the lobby door to the time you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Dated.....”
Reviews.Author: Canadian Steve-O
Reviews.Content: ......my wife and I attended a banquet and stayed over night at this apparent 5 star hotel in downtown Vancouver Dec 2011. We were some what disappointed with our room. The furnishings, bed, pictures, TV (old style, not flat screen) and bathroom we felt were out dated. Lots of brass and gold. I did not get a very good nights sleep because the pillows provided were as flat as pancakes. However the service through out the hotel and the food at the banquet were outstanding!!

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: MarkOliverCanada
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sutton Place in Vancouver Bc we 've had several amazing stays at the SP in Toronto. This one is even better. Extremely sincere and friendly staff. Super clean and upscale rooms. Amazing views. Great restaurant. Quiet. All good. The toilet did run on but we closed the door and we couldn't hear it. The coffee maker wasn't on the table but a quick call to the service desk and we learned it was in the drawer by the mini bar. Many deluxe features including luxury bathroom soaps and conditioners and two terry cloth robes. Watch out for the $7 orange juice at breakfast. Everything else fairly priced

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup Week at The Sutton”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: Good location, walking distance to shopping, sporting events, and the harbor. The staff are very professional, the rooms are a good size....I also stayed here during the 2005 Grey Cup!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gotravel60
Reviews.Content: If you want to see Vancouver and be right downtown, this is the hotel for you. Staff is attentive, the rooms are old style elegant and the beds are comfortable. Service is great and there is always a buzz in the lobby. Try the evening chocolate buffet if you like chocolate. Or the Brunch on the weekend-excellent! You are a block from Robson Square and walking distance to the water front. We live in the surroundings of Vancouver and love to take a retreat in our own city and always stay at the Sutton Place Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place: a better home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: WBeaupre
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver regularly on business and always stay at the Sutton Place Hotel. It is truly a top end hotel from the well appointed lobby, excellent restaurant, beautiful guest suites and most important of all 5 star pulse customer service. Every staff member greets you with a pleasant smile and no request is considered too small. I stay in La Grande Residence where the one and two bedroom fully equipped suites make your stay, wether it is only a few days or a couple of weeks, relaxed and stress-free. The staff are so customer oriented that they always greet yu by name when you call the front desk and make you feel welcome on arrival by saying "Welcome back to the Sutton Place". The beds are very comfortable, you get an excellent sleep. The hotel is the preferred location for many Hollywood actors and crew shooting in Vancouver but the hotel staff treat every guest just as if they were an Oscar winner!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Vancouver, stay at the Sutton Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michel F
Reviews.Content: For those of you who prefer the downtown hotel stay, the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver is an excellent option. Good value for the price and the service is top notch. Walking distance from the high end shopping district on Robson Street and many great restaurants including the famous steat house Joe Fortes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: CameronsloveEurope
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of Vancouver Hotels lately, we really enjoyed not only the beautiful hotel but the incredible location of the Sutton Place. It was in close walking distance to all of the things we wanted to do in the city. The rooms were lovely, beds comfortable and restaurants convenient. The only minor complaint would be that the bathroom shower tiles and tub could use some updating. Sutton Place also has great street appeal. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word 'Excellence'”
Reviews.Author: deboraUSA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a good location to walk to most of the sights.Excellent facilities with the bed very comfortable,luxurious and well equipped with pillows,flat TV in each room and the staff were really helpful.Very affordable and great value.Perfect place to stay you won't be disappointed in this hotel.I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and centrally location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Eseter
Reviews.Content: Having used this hotel for business trips for years, I may say I am well satisfied with the good location rooms, service and dining at Sutton. Meeting rooms are Ok and our company uses this hotel a lot. If you need a god place to stay centrally in Vancouver for business or holiday, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A five star not really worth it”
Reviews.Author: Matthew F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located downtown Vancouver. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The decoration of the room is nice, needs some refreshing though. The shower almost fell at me and the TV is more than outdated. In my opinion the wi-fi should be free for clients of a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway-sans kids”
Reviews.Author: paul w
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently flew to Vancouver and stayed in the Sutton Place for our first trip away without the kids. Objectives; comfort, sleep, dining, geting spoiled, shopping, walking. I have always been a fan of Sutton Place hotels, mostly because this chain seems to have it's own quietly luxurious personality. Our stay in Vancouver was no different from my previous stays. The staff is great. The room was perfect and the king sized bed particularly comfortable. The breakfasts were excellent. We dined one night in the bar, the food is very good and the atmosphere is warm and lively, but not too lively. They also make a fine martini. The hotel is situated perfectly for walking and shopping. We walked to the water and grabbed a water taxi to the market. We also walked to Stanley Park. Restaurants and night clubs are all around the hotel. The hotel has a pretty good fintess centre as well. Great value, great sleeps, great food. Maybe too much shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A shopping weekend!”
Reviews.Author: BCSurreyChick
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money. Valet price was sticker shock at $40/day and had I known the price I would have looked for alternative parking and had I been thinking fast enough I would have asked for alternative parking. (Maybe they should have offered the parking lot across the street if there was overnight parking allowed). For the price of parking we could have enjoyed breakfast buffer for two hotel restaurant. Instead we had to upgrade the cost of the room in order to receive a partial credit for parking, and I was not impressed! Close to all shopping, Robson Street and the huge mall as well as within walking distance to Yaletown. All staff was friendly and helpful. Not much information in the room in regards to tourist information but the concierge had everything we asked for. Very nice spa where we enjoyed facials by Alla. Nice pool and gym but we didn't have time to actually use them. Room decor nicely done but bathroom was tired/dated looking. We liked having robes in the room and we phoned to request slippers and they were delivered to our room no extra charge. We used the cups, glasses, paper cups and purchased items from the honor bar: nothing was replaced for use/purchase the next day. Lovely Boulangerie outside the hotel with very reasonably priced baked goods that are very good! And, they only charge a buck for a bottle of water! Sutton Place was close to everything we needed which was primarily shopping and dining and we have the Visa bill to prove it! We would definitely stay here again and possibly try their properties in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Cory K
Reviews.Content: Nice place, everything was just as it should be. We had no complaints, except for the valet parking - they dont advise you what the fee is when they offer it, and you can't see what the per diem is unless you go looking for a small sign posted out front. Wasn't to nice to find an extra 80 bucks tacked on to our bill when we left. If we had known, we would have parked on the street. Hotel is in a good location though, there are pleanty of shops, food stores and pubs nearby, and it's a quick drive to Stanley Park, or a nice walk to Granvill Island, which we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth of July Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TJBII
Reviews.Content: We booked the junior suite and were very pleased with our room. The kitchenette was clean and modern. It had a dining table and living room area. The bedroom was clean, comfortable and spacious. The staff was very knowledgeable and very willing to help. The pool and spa were clean and well maintained. The hotel is centrally located near restaurants, shopping, groceries, wine shops and all major attractions are within walking distance. A very good value for downtown Vancouver. We will stay here again when we return to Vancouver. Only con, the bathroom was a bit small and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CherryGrower1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed multiple tomes at the Sutton and have been happy about our choice each time. We spent an extended period in their residences and were thrilled to have what is virtually a 5 star apartment in downtown Vancouver for a week. Staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: j0d0nn
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from my hotel room. It's a gorgeous building, and the wi-fi, though pricey (I think it was about 8 CAD / night) works like a champ. Parking is really expensive, but that might be par for Vancouver; I don't know. It's $40 / night. The location is great, smack dab in the middle of downtown. Beds are comfortable, and the desk staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Vancouver to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all the great amenities and the staff are very friendly. We really like sitting in Gerard's Lounge with the Day Bartender as he is an enjoyable individual who always remembers his repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “likeylike”
Reviews.Author: bcarter62
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnite in the hotel room side, with views on and up Burrard Street. Nice to be able to put up your feet, open the curtains and enjoy a glass of Chardonney with a city view as the sun sets in early November. Surprise phone call from personnel asking if everything was A ok. However, the usual wet tissue wipedown over the mirrors and lamps holds back the 5 star rating. Watch those rusty hinges on the doors and dont forget to silicone the bathroom marble joints when necessary. Otherwise, bed is excellent as is the quiet factor. Also, the room temp guage was probably the easiest and most efficient I have ever come across. For 150 plus hotel tax, good value for the $$. Staff, from front desk to concierge to doorman go out of their way to make your stay welcome. Location for Vancouver is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and concierge staff!”
Reviews.Author: KaitlinHalifax
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing. The best concierge staff we have ever encountered. These were honestly the best staff I have ever stayed with at a hotel. The restaurant was also extremely accommodating with allergies and the hotel itself was beautiful. Great location right near Robson street and Pacific centre mall for shopping and within walking distances to many tourist attractions (Stanley park, Vancouver art gallery, trolley tours etc.). An IGA is conveniently located nearby. This trip was half business and half recreational. We missed the hotel when we left it was so great. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “classy.”
Reviews.Author: Anjiggy
Reviews.Content: the hotel's exterior architecture is very plain and maybe outdated?, but the rooms and lobby are very nice. the rooms are clean and comfy. the bathroom is marble and very spacious. the views are very nice from the huge wall of windows. the location is right in the heart of vancouver's downtown area, so you can walk to a lot of places and neighborhoods. a grocery store is very close by, if you need any snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sheri777
Reviews.Content: My husband had to entertain some clients at a Canucks game so we decided to tag along and booked a 1brd. suite. and we're pleasantly surprised with the size -over 700sq ft. with a full kitchen. There is also, very conveniantly, a Marketplace IGA right outside the hotel, were we could grab milk, cereal, fruit and snacks for the kids. The parking $ is a bit steep, as well as the charge -per person? for room service- not just one delivery charge. However the pool and jacuzzi and weight room, as well as the comfiness of the bed (not so much the pull out couch- but it is -what it is) were all great! Location good, though we were on the 15th floor and a little noisy, but it was Halloween weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Another great getaway at "The Sutton"”
Reviews.Author: m m
Reviews.Content: Had the fortunate opportunity to stay at The Sutton for a belated anniversary getaway this weekend. We've stayed at The Sutton before, and this experience was no different than the others. The staff there - although always extremely professional - have to be the friendliest and most welcoming staff I've ever dealt with at a hotel. We're not regular guests or staying in the most expensive room there, but we're always treated the same by the staff. Awesome job of making us feel welcome - again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best from all angles”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent with a very helpful and supportive attitude from all staff. It is a pleasant feeling to arrive and feel you are home. Facilities are all you would want

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: xympx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and well maintained, the staff are friendly, and the apartment we booked had everything we needed to feel like home. The Sutton Place is very central to everything and we hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: 21Lulu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel in downtown Vancouver and found the following helped make our stay a pleasant experience: - the location is ideal / very close to center core and great shopping on Robson Street - the amenities are good (indoor pool,hot tub and steam room) - the noon check-out is great - the only negative was the parking fee ($40/night), but that is the going rate in hotels downtown Vancouver. We would gladly return (p.s. we did get a $139/night rate) and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Patrick K
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place hotel is always an excellent travel experience!! It's like a home away from home. Staff are very professional, welcoming and when they get to know you, they treat you like family. The facilities are excellent including the pool, hot tub, steam room, spa, restaurant and bar. It's central to downtown Vancouver with lots of shopping, restaurants and entertainment within walking distance. I highly recommend the Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler752
Reviews.Content: The hotel is traditional and elegant style, very clean, with excellent quality and value. The service is great, and the staff is friendly, courteous and professional. The rooms are well appointed, as is the rest of this cozy, elegant hotel. Location is great for both business and tourist travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service alive and well in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: vanna1956
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate hotel - beautiful, clean, staff friendly, comfortable rooms and lots of amenities. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an experience in what a hotel should be. If I ever return to Vancouver, this is definately the hotel I will choose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....that's about it!?”
Reviews.Author: AVIDEATER
Reviews.Content: I can't really say much about this hotel. Check-in was very business-like. The room was clean. It is in a good location. Both my wife and I woke up with pain in our lower backs from the bed. That's about it! Nothing to get excited about. Nothing to get upset about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfortable hotel in great area of town”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful traditional luxury hotel -- comfy King size bed, luxury amenities in the bathrooms, and lovely chocolates at turndown service. I would recommend asking for a room away from the elevator. Quick walking distance to Robson/Alberni (fancy upscale shops), Vancouver Art Gallery, and Pacific Mall. A bit further (but still easily done) to Gastown (best for souvenir shopping) and Canada Place. Nice wine store in complex (just to the right of hotel). Great street food (Japadog) in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with good size room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Stm_eternity
Reviews.Content: Only half a block from Robson. What more to ask for?! A 15 mins walk to hornby seabus. Theres an IGA half a block away. I go there to pick up water and snack, as the water in the hotel room is $6/bottle. The room is good size, the air conditioning is adequate. The bathroom is good size also, good shower and hair dryer. The other review is right about these expensive extras, eg $40/day parking. I don't even bother $15/day wifi as u can walk down to Starbuck on Robson for free wifi. The room is a bit dated, bed is not comfy, but other than that, I have no other complains. Would come back!

Reviews.Title: “It's Just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: conniestinople
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite extensively, and while we aren't high rollers, when we travel we like to stay somewhere nice. We have stayed at both the Pan Pacific and the Hyatt, and thought we'd try out one of the downtown 5 star hotels. We thought we'd use to Hotwire to book it, because with 5 stars you can't go wrong right? That was our first mistake. Don't use Hotwire, we could have found a better deal if we had booked directly though the hotel website. Anyway, the Sutton Place is fine. But it's just fine. The lobby is nice, staff friendly and helpful, but the rooms are merely adequate-not at all what we were expecting from a 5 star, considering both the Pan and Hyatt (4 stars) were much, much nicer. The Sutton is run down, in need of a remodel, in my opinion. We also tried out the pool facilities. What a joke! I've seen airport hotel pools and jacuzzis that are nicer! Anyway, the location can't be beat for sure, 1 block to Robson, but the Hyatt in my opinion is equally convienent. Don't stay here. You can do better for cheaper in the area. We won't make this mistake again. Pan or Hyatt for sure next time.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: SuperXIX
Reviews.Content: As the very first hotel during our 2 weeks trip on the West Coast, The Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver was our home for 4 great nights (Aug 12 – 15, 2011). We went a bit over the top with the rate of $160 +tax/night, but that was after a 40% off deal on Expedia, so we definitely took advantage of this classy hotel. GOOD: Everything exudes class. Huge room with a superbly comfortable bed and amazing downtown location. The perfect place to come back and fall asleep after our very long day trips to Stanley Park, Victoria and Whistler! BAD: Just like every other high end hotel encountered, this hotel loves to charge a ridiculous additional price for a WI-FI connection when it clearly should be included in the room rate. Thankfully, I still had my 3G data plan available on my phone. Highly recommended whether you have the money to splurge or you get a ridiculous deal on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noise travels too easily.”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: I found the room noisy and it was difficult to sleep. It was way too easy to hear pretty much everything from the attached room and in the hallway. Tough to sleep through incoming phone calls throughout the night and hallway conversations. It's unfortunate because I really like the Sutton otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “2 star service in a 5 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: kiki_caprice
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here and it was more than enough. The pros: location, location, location (close to everything), the lobby - gorgeous, the view from the window of the city, amazing! The cons: The room decor was not for me, it looks grand-ish at first glance, but upon closer inspection the place, or at least my room was falling apart. The TV didn't work, I called the front desk, they said they would send someone, but never did. The outlet looked like it could electrocute you if you aren't careful. The bed was super uncomfortable. I don't like sleep number beds, which it wasn't, but it was super lumpy and felt like it was probably over 20 years old. Sad to have this place pretend to be 5 stars. I'd give it 3.5 stars at best, and mostly b/c the lobby is gorgeous. Next time I book a 4 star hotel, I'd rather save some cash and have better sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Fantastic Deal”
Reviews.Author: WestLAFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Sutton Place in August and could not have been happier. We are a family of five, with three kids ranging in age from 5 to 11. We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom suites, which also had a living room, kitchen, small dining area, two bathrooms, storage room and a balcony. The suite was spacious, clean and altogether terrific. This is not a Four Seasons, so if you are looking for marble and general 5-star luxury, this should not be your choice. If you are looking for killer views of the water and cruise ships, this is also not your choice. But if you are looking, on the other hand, for a very nicely appointed (i.e., flat screen TVs in the living room and bedrooms), well laid out apartment-style lodging at an unbeatable price, this most definitely is a great option. We paid in the low 300s per night for the suite, which was at least 200 less per night than a comparable suite would have been at the competition. For what you are getting at the Sutton, the price is truly terrific. The hotel has great staff, a nice restaurant, a good business center, and an indoor pool/spa that connects to an outdoor terrace, with tables, chaizes and a table tennis table. The hotel is very well and centrally situated on Burrard, near Robson - and best of all, there is a Japadog stand right outside the hotel! All in all, this is a great hotel to use as a base for exploring Vancouver that affords lots of space, with a degree of luxury, but without breaking your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: Spent a nite there in October, and while it is a nice place, and the service good, I wouldn't place it in the same category as The Pacific Rim or other 5 Star hotels in Vancouver. Bit old, tired, and is trying hard, but the real stars are working so much harder. Couple of things that really shocked me, old 25 inch tube TV that showed every year of its age, poor picture quality and faded colours. Top Hotels should absolutely have flat panel TV's and HD, it"s what is expected. bathrooms were very dated, and ohhhhhhh the $40 parking is outrageous. Got a deal on Hotwire, but would not experiment again. Please take me back Pacific Rim!

Reviews.Title: “Great place from which to explore Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeinBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in early October, 2011. ...got a deal thru Hotwire. We loved the place, rooms were clean and high quality, jacuzzi and pool were spotless, check in and out were the fastest ever. A wine store is part of the hotel and so is a French bakery... and was it good ! Robson street shopping is less than half a block away. Five blocks on our bikes and we were on the Coal Harbour causeway all the way to Stanley Park. Parking was an issue for us; their valet parking, $40 per day was too expensive for me, as was their $16/day wireless. We parked on the street and had no issues at all. Great hotel and a fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Islanders022
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel close to 40 nights this year and as usal everything was perfect.From being greeted with a big smile from the door man to the amazing staff at the front desk.Gerards staff is over and above Walter,Dave,Mike,Nasreen,Susan,John,Sony,Danielle,and Debra you are all amazing and we love the excellent service we recieve.Try the food you will not be dissipointed.We cant forget Randy the valet you are over the top, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: cutabove154943
Reviews.Content: A delightful one night stay as a birthday treat . The service was impressive . The whole atmosphere of the hotel was welcoming and pleasant also v. interesting since the VIFF had just started and lots of interesting' film people 'around . Dining room and dinner were lovely . We did not need ' exras ' and so our bill was exactly as expected . Good location near shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Love this smaller safe and quiet haven in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: valbritishcolumbia
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Sutton every time we go to Vancouver - atleast a dozen times a year and we are always impressed by the service, friendliness and cleanliness of this hotel. It is very comfortable and quiet and it is one of the best locations in the city - right down town and within walking distance of all the best restaurants, hockey, football and concert venues. I think maybe some of the rooms are starting to show the very earliest signs of aging but this hotel is such amazing value that I certainly am not complaining! The only downside is the cost of room service and extras, like a previous review said - bottled water, mini bar, internet - is all very expensive. Since you do not need to use any of the above, again - I can't complain about it when I do! (And room service always arrives quickly, with the most professional servers and it's hot, delicious and presented beautifully!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: stanwoodgirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now. I would not hesitate to stay here every time I visit Vancouver. The hotel is located next to Robson Street and is with in walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The staff at the hotel are great. They really make you feel at home and comfortable. The rooms are clean and beautiful. We have stayed in the one and two bedroom suites. Both were fully equiped with kitchens and a balcony. Gerrad lounge has excellent Fish & Chips. Room service was great. As far as I am concerned if you are making a trip to Vancouver, this Hotel is the only one I would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “I like nice hotels”
Reviews.Author: saphire45
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at The Sutton Place Hotel, we only stayed one night before a cruise and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking Vancouver, the room was gorgeous and the staff delightful and the dining 1st class, it was within 2 blocks of the best shopping in Vancouver and I would recomment this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “most helpful staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: The sutton place was the destination for our trip back to Australia by ship. We found the hotel great in every sense, from the staff especially the front desk through to the cleaners. Central to everything, quite, clean and well priced for Vancouver. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!”
Reviews.Author: apickytraveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience at the Sutton as always. Hands down my favourite 5 star hotel in Vancouver. Location: Excellent. Robson street and Alberni within a 3-5 minute walk. ots of shopping, great restaurants and things to do. Check out Alberni for some of the best restaurants in the city. Room: I stayed in a suite with a kitchen, living room and dining area. Very roomy, witha large balcony. A little dated, but more dated in a 5 star hotel kind of way than Hilton dated. Very comfy bed and lots of closet space. Service: Amazing service, particularly from Miguel at the conceirge, who I am certain is the happiest person I have ever met in my life. Very responsive and helpful. The dedicated conceirge makes great reccomendations about bars, restaurants, art exhibits and general things to do. Made reservations and got us into a very difficult club to get into with a VIP pass. Was there for two weeks and never once did I have a complaint. Room service cleaned my room multiple times a day if I required. Food: Great lounge, the Gerrard. Excellent wine and scotch list. Not a huge fan of chocolate, but if you are the buffet is worth the trip. Fabulous room service. Breakfast was great (buffet). Really no complaints here. Amenities: Hot tub and pool area was generally very quiet and clean, albeit a little dated. Nice cabana area outside. Only complaint would be was that it was noisy due to the proximity of the road. Very private. The stairwelll on the way to the pool is a little inconveinient and in need to rennovations. Spa: Outsourced, but decent. Vancouver in general lacks in this area. Guests: Yes, there are a lot of celebs here. If you are the type to get star struck, please don't stay here as they need to be left alone! Met a number of A & B listers. Very nice and enjoyed the discretion and quiet of the hotel. Overall: Highly reccomend. Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: NicollFamily
Reviews.Content: On the whole, an average luxury hotel experience. Nothing to set it apart from the crowd. My wife and I stayed here September 30, 2011 for 1 night. We live locally, and stay downtown occasionally just to get away from our teenagers for the night. This was our first time trying the Sutton Place. In my opinion, and even after considering the excellent location close to Robson Street, you can do better for the price at the Fairmont's or Hyatt or Pan Pacific (when you can get a deal at the Pan Pacific). You can do much better, but for more money, at the Four Seasons. We booked a Premium 1 bedroom suite online. When we checked in, our suite was in the long-term residence tower. These rooms are renovated older apartments, with full kitchens, etc. When we called to see if this was really the Premium 1 bedroom suite, the Front Desk advised us that it was the residence tower, intended to be more "practical" than luxurious (you can tell they get that question a lot). To you and me it means that the finishing and decor is notably less luxurious than the hotel tower, which is where we ended up after asking to be moved. Of course, the 1 bedroom suite we thought we had booked was no longer available now, so we had a Premium King room instead. The room was nice enough and had a nice view down Burrard Street. Something little is that the remote would not operate the TV from the bed (had to stand about 3 ft away directly in front of the TV). And one wall in the room angled into the room at about a 30 degree angle. Not a big deal at all, but still a little strange. Apart from not advising us about the lower quality of the room we were initially put in, the Front Desk service was very professional, especially when we asked to be moved. The Turn Down Service was friendly and Room service the next morning was quick and friendly as well. So too the valet. Service in the lounge, however, was indifferent, uninterested and rushed. In short, you can do better elsewhere in town for the money.

Reviews.Title: “First timer”
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: Got off cruise ship to visit in Vancouver for 3 days and we stayed here. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was great. There is a hop-on hop-off trolley stop right across the street. Easy to get to shopping and waterfront. Rooms were a little expensive but what isn't in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Doug W
Reviews.Content: Most recent stay excellent, as always. Great staff, always helpful. One of the great hotels worldwide for service, always a pleasure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: BcSpringbreaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night but it was enough to see that this is a very nice hotel. The staff are very polite and courteous. The parking is ridiculous at $39.50 per night. I've stayed 2 blocks away and paid half that. The rooms are nice, you can tell it is an older place but in very good shape and the views are awesome. Very comfortable beds, nice pillows, quiet. My friend and I had pedicures at the spa and it was comparable to others I've had. The estheticians were very nice and chatted with us, they were adorable. The spa itself is nice but I expected spa chairs and more luxury in general from a place that charges $90 for a pedicure. I would stay there again, we got the room for a discounted price online but by the time you pay for parking you may as well stay at a 3.5-4 star and get a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay....”
Reviews.Author: bucnbee
Reviews.Content: Was going on a cruise and decided to stay at the Sutton Place Hotel in one of their apartment suites. The carpet was really dirty and the entire atmosphere seemed dated- not vintagte, but dated. The hotel staff was really nice and the hotel is situated in a great part of town. I don't think I will stay here again for the price. In my opinion, Fairmont Vancouver was much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Got hotel for first time visitors to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chris d
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were apprehensive on where to stay on our first trip to Vancouver. Would definately suggest to others staying at Sutton Place.
