So centrally located--you can walk everywhere...shopping ..you over look Robson St. where all the action seems to be..also within in easy walking to West End(Davies St.)--more slanted to the Gay scene BUT a very MILD gay scene--also close to Yaletown-fun and good restaurants..we felt safe and the Hotel is very friendly and has nice amenities...I too agree that the $14.00 a DAY for WiFi or internet use is insane..I complained but they just nodded and said they have heard it before..I just went across street to a Starbucks or Blenz coffee and used theirs for the price of a muffin. That said a very nice Hotel ..Great staff

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: JudyWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel before and after an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was lovely and the service couldn't have been better; the staff is helpful, knowledgeable, friendly, and accomodating. And the location is great to enjoy Vancouver by foot or public transportation. We hope to return and if so, will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Somehow modern yet vintage character. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: cosmos292
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business early August for a week or so, actually I booked in here out of chance as we could only get a few days availability at the nearby Marriott. However I'm glad I made the switch, because this hotel has real character - a vintage, elegant feel but without pretention and without making the place look dated. If you want to stay on business with a bit of a luxury twist - at roughly the same rate as your usual characterless chain hotel, then I recommend it! The room size is very generous - clean, faultless, etc. I was initially a bit concerned with the internal door from my room into the adjacent room (!) but reassured when I realised both sides had to unbolt it for the door to open! I guess a new one for me in the hotel room experience. The hotel bar is particularly good with an open fire and kind of 'gentleman's club' feel and actually quite reasonable bar prices for a hotel. There is a shop to buy bits like toothpaste etc. though opening hours are a bit sporadic. Plentiful taxis outside will take you anywhere and the location in the centre of downtown is excellent too... quite near the nightlife and restaurants. The only downside is the extorionate wifi prices and lack of free wifi even in the lobby... apart from that I strongly recommend it as a break from the norm staying on business. No doubt it would be great for tourism too, not so convinced about value for money in that context.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-city elegance”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1504
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended a two week tour of the pacific north west in Vancouver and stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and found the hotel to be small enough for personal service (which was excellent) and yet large enough to offer all modern conveniences. Our room had a lovely view across the city and the hotel's location meant that we could easily walk to all places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - and I'm picky”
Reviews.Author: ItsEmSLC
Reviews.Content: Only negative was the price for parking. The location, views, room was perfect. Fast elevator, attentive concierge, everything you could ask for really. Room 2010 has 2 large bay windows. A corner room, so very quiet. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: siyul
Reviews.Content: It is what you will expect from a European style boutique hotel. They pay attention to fine details, good-quality material, nice/clean room, and convenient downtown location. However, they offer almost nothing for free, from parking, breakfast to internet. So it feels so much like hotel, not feel at home. That alone, i will choose a different place next time. Also view is just ok. One tip: instead of valet parking @ $40 a night, parking on the street is not too difficult. Most spots in the neighboring area (2-3 minutes walking distance) parking is free from 6-7pm to 8-9am. each spot is different, just read the sign before you park.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: p0rt0bell0
Reviews.Content: We came for a weekend visit and stay two nights and had a comfortable stay. Our room was on the l9th floor and had an enormous window that allowed lots of daylight in so that was nice. There was lots of counter space in the bathroom. The furnishings was nice but typical hotel decor. The lobby was grand but somewhat small. It seemed that every seat was taken by guests whenever we were coming and going from the hotel. There were a couple of big groups and a wedding party staying here so lobby was always busy. The best reason for staying here was it's across the street from our favorite French restaurant "Le Crocodile". This review is tough because I'm comparing our room with last year stay at another boutique hotel where I thought the room was much more cozier and had modern comfortable furniture. Originally, we had plans to stay at this hotel but at the last minute we had to change our dates and they did not have rooms available so chose Sutton Place for our backup plan. We did not go through a second party booking agency so paid the full room rate of $300 (including taxes) per day. Additional $80 for the parking garage fee for two nights. Although, the staff was very nice, I would say that next time we come for a visit we will return to our favorite hotel from last year.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't know”
Reviews.Author: Busman1025
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights on a bargain deal so I think it was good for the money I spent. If you are into the historic and elegant type of hotels then this is for you. Its located in a good location, walking distance to a lot of the downtown area. I paid the extra $$ for valet parking and I thought they provided us with excellent service with the in and out use. The pipe for the shower head that extends from the wall was loose and I could move the shower head all around. I would think that housekeeping would catch this and have it fixed. If I return to Vancouver, I think I will try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid to long term downtown Vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: RandallSRogers
Reviews.Content: We have been using the Sutton for fIve years now and still keep coming back. Great service from arrival to checkout. Business center is a little small and charges for internet quite steep. Le Grande Residence is the condo unit tower and while very convenient for longer stays the rooms and halls are getting a little worn and need fresh paint and furnishings. Well equipped full size kitchen and separate bedroom makes this ideal for a business trip with a couple or even one road warrior. Some traffic noise from the firehall across the street. Great restaurants nearby, and wine store on ground level of hotel. Grocery store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Pricey?”
Reviews.Author: parislover_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate but nothing special. My confirmation said I could upgrade my room upon arrival but I was told that wasn't an option on "my plan". Also was told that I would have to pay for wireless access which also was not previously mentioned. The pool is located in the next, contiguous building but was rather small and full of children when I wanted to use it. The room was fine but there may be better valued options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MrsGreen79
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a good deal. The hotel is conveniently located close to most things in downtown Vancouver, especially Robson St and not too far from the SkyTrain. The hotel itself needs a facelift but all in all it was a nice stay. Concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Suites”
Reviews.Author: Esthersnippe
Reviews.Content: I have a suite for a week here in Vancouver, and the location of this hotel is so perfect! Minutes away from the sky train, Robson street, and a little grocery store, it is ideal. There is even a little grocery store right across the street, which is ideal since I have a little suite, and can do my own cooking. It is quite for being right in the center of the city. The only qualm is the hosts at the front desk are quite cold (however, polite) Other wise, what a lovely place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: comonaut2
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little dated, but clean and comfortable. Hotel facilities were very good--especially the bar "snacks", which far exceeded our expectations--good food served in very hospitable sorroundings. We walked everywhere. Very reliable--would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tesstamonial
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. All the hotel staff were personable and helpful. We enjoyed Gerards Restaurant for an early evening glass of wine and snacks. The hotel is close to many restaurants and cafes, not to mention shopping. The hop on/hop off trolley red line stops directly across the street and takes you all over Vancouver and to Stanley Island. Room was very clean, the only negative was no free WiFi. The Vida Spa was wonderful! A very nice four day vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DoDowin
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in the heart of everything. The room we stayed in was nice and clean. You can walk to many attractions and close to good food on Denman street. It is just 10 mins walk to the cruise terminal if it is your next destination. We also got a good deal through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: ReneLes
Reviews.Content: We have been in and out of Vancouver a lot this summer, Sutton Place has become a home away from home. Great rooms, great service ... wish we could stay there all the time when we come into Vancouver, but if your dont book far enough a head - all the rooms might be gone - the place is not a well kept secret ! Definitely our first choice for a Vancouver hotel

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and professional”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTuna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work, clean, nicely appointed rooms, free internet, professional staff. I was in Vancouver for a conference, but it was close to everything- shopping, the museum- so I could take advantage in my few hours off. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the most livable city!!”
Reviews.Author: Stay-Exceptional
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed the service a the Sutton Place - plenty of helpful hands and careing people in this city ceenter oasis. The cleanliness was exceptional and the bed was awesome - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “two different hotels”
Reviews.Author: Rita N
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed because clearly this hotel has a split-personality. It seems as though half the hotel is a luxury hotel and the other half is a renovated apartment building. If you are looking for a place with a kitchen etc. this is fine. But that is not what I expected. I was under the impression that I was staying at a luxuryish hotel. WRong!! My husband kept joking that we were at the "ghetto side" of the hotel and therefore did not have the same clout that the other guests had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent accommodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: davex25
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night before the Gran Fondo and had several requests including storing our bikes in our room and storing a bag for 24 hours after our stay. The Sutton staff were more than accommodating including putting on a very early pre-ride oatmeal breakfast for those desiring it! Comfortable room and well maintained. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Balmoral99
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the best location in Vancouver downtown, one block to Robson street, alot of restaurants and cafe's around. Recomended - Sala Thai Thai restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fully worth when booking on hotwire”
Reviews.Author: ontheedge1
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed the night at the sutton place. Hotel has a great location for finding food and shops in walking distance. Staff are kind and helpful. There is really nothing spectacular about the rooms or decor for the regular price. I have stayed here several times when booking online with hotwire and never paid more than $79 per night. Knowing it is the only 5 star in Vancouver you know what hotel you are getting. This makes it a perfect place since now you have money to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: MarkSumner
Reviews.Content: First the service at Sutton Place was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is also great. Unfortunately the hotel itself is outdated and the rooms are in need of an upgrade. The price was very reasonable, but it would be nice to see this hotel receive a much needed makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as Usual:”
Reviews.Author: timbenner
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place is a great base to explore Vancouver. It has a great location that is close enough that you can walk to many things but just enough out of the way to be easy to drive to and quiet. The service is always good and I have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Respite”
Reviews.Author: deb1981
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Sutton Place. It was very centrally located and either walking distance or a bus ride away from everything we wanted. Had a sumptuous Continental buffet breakfast as well as a full buffet. Our Continental was included in our room rate. It kept us satisfied until a late afternoon break before dinner. Room was large and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family”
Reviews.Author: Islander321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children in a 1 bedroom suite. It was a great size with a full kitchen and spacious living room/dining room area. This is the only way to go with a family, as the kids can sleep in the bedroom, and the adults can stay up and not worry about waking the children. The staff were accomodating, they were able to have us near our friends room and promptly brought 2 cribs and highchairs. There was a great promo on for the 1 bedroom suite. Will stay here again. Their loyay program is also apreciated...almost enough points now for a free stay....much better than some other points programs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Convenient Downtown location”
Reviews.Author: 25dreamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sutton Place hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. We arrived early and to our surprise, a room was available and we were able to check in. We had a great room, with a great view of downtown. The hotel staff was wonderful. Everything from Stanley Park to Chinatown is within walking distance, and about two blocks from the famous Robson Street. Also, the hotel is about three blocks from the Canada Line SkyTrain station, which is less than a 30 minute ride to the YVR airport. We highly recommend the hotel for its staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: golfinref
Reviews.Content: The hotel, room, staff were all excellent!!. The location is within walking distance to most areas in the downtown, great food available in the area and the hotel conceirge staff was the most helpful I have dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-week get away to be a visitor in your own town.”
Reviews.Author: Juhwawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a hotwire deal as a midweek treat to be in our own city. Best is location, which is right beside Robson St, a popular shopping strip. We walked along there and nibbled at various places for drinks, and appy's and generally enjoyed the shopping and people watching. We were happy to stay here and it's good quality, especially for the rate we got. Service is solid and rooms well-appointed with higher quality shampoo, soaps etc. Like others, we noticed the age of the room, with things generally showing some wear and tear. The bed was super comfy tho! As we had booked with hotwire, wifi was an additional charge. The view of vancouver was great. As I said, we were being tourists in our own town, and so we had a room on the 10th floor facing north. We enjoyed the people watching and the view of Robson street. We did notice the slamming of doors nearby, might be because we were relatively (2 rooms) close to an exit. Not sure, but I had earplugs so didn't bother me. Amenities were fine. Beautiful lobby. Pool was very far away (in another building) and you have to cross the lobby so bring flip-flops. Good thing they provide robes as otherwise would have to change at pool. Odd is hot tub jet button, which is located OUTSIDE the pool, so a bit of a hoof to restart the jets. The Gerard lounge is comfy and old school, which we enjoyed. Room service was astronomical, but we did it anyway just to have the treat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: family_travel66
Reviews.Content: For a business trip to Toronto this hotel was a very good choice, based on its appearance, and its central location. The room was very clean, and spacious, but the view was not great. For such a nice hotel, the selection of breakfast items was a bit disappointing in terms of variety, and quality; slightly better than a Comfort Inn, but in retrospect it is probably OK, since this is only a 3 1/2 star hotel. The other somewhat disappointing experience was when we discovered that the "free local calls" did not include the toll free numbers nor the numbers in Toronto with different area code. Finally, make sure that when you leave for the airport you get the taxi you asked. We asked for a yellow cab, and they put us in a limo with a "fixed price" $55 as the hotel staff said. However, the taxi driver asked for the full meter price (some $13 more) to recover the tip he gave to the hotel staff when they called him. (the tip was indeed given; we saw it) So, either insist that they call a yellow cab, or talk to the limo driver about the price before you enter the cab.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: DebbieFromToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, and while it was in a good location, it was a very dated hotel and the rooms looked like they hadn't been redecorated for 30+ years. It was fine for the one night and comfortable enough, but it would have been better to have stayed in a more updated room with a more modern bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, and accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: finnsdo
Reviews.Content: One bderoom suite booked for three nights, great for family of 4 using pull out couch. Full kitchen, two TV's Very clean and very professional staff . good pool and spa. Great location in Vancouver. Will stay again next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: jeff k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago for business. The entire staff were exceptional, from the bellhop to the front desk staff. They were able to check me in early. The room was nice and clean, with a big king size bed and brand new plasma TV. Bathroom was clean and there were plenty of towels and soap. They also have a cab stand on site 24/7. Only negative about the hotel was the "free" continental breakfast. I was on a very tight schedule in the morning and went down for breakfast, but there was a lineup of about 30 people waiting to get in. Apparently a cruise ship group had just arrived, something they failed to mention. I ordered the room service, which was free, but the only thing they provided for the continental breakfast was toast. Did not fill me up. Other than that the stay was amazing and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Classy Hotel, Sensational Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: PhilandBrooke
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. First Class Staff! When we booked and made an off-hand comment about it being honeymoon, they gave us the Royal Treatment. I could gush for hours about the two-room suite, turn down service, central location and heart-of-the-city view, but you get the idea. The valet parking is a little pricey, but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a movie star!”
Reviews.Author: rubyrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway! It was lovely, we had a quiet corner room on the 18th floor with corner windows with a view of downtown and the harbor. The bed was REALLY comfy, and waking up in the morning to such an amazing view was brilliant! Worth asking for a corner room on a high floor! Also, we never heard a peep, our room was very peaceful, didn’t hear a single other guest! We had got a deal where breakfast was included, and the breakfast buffet was really good! Worth getting up early for! The pool and Jacuzzi were nice, a little far from the room, but still nice. Parking was expensive, weather you self-park or valet, its $39 CD a night, if you don’t have much luggage, may be worth checking out public parking! The hotel is right downtown, just a few blocks from Rosbon and Granville. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “We always love it,like going home”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: We are never dissappointed, from the minute we go up to the front desk and check in until we drive out on departure.The staff is always very curtious,helpful and very pleasant.We have stayed at the Sutton for several years and will keep going.Our only complaint is that the parking is getting a bit expensive and perhaps Wi-Fi could be free in a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robbbie007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, ideally located and very plush and posh inside.Stayed for 5 days in August 2011, reasonably priced for Vancouver! Good, central location 50 yards from the centre of Robson Street, the main shopping area. Waterfront was a 10 minute walk down the hill and an excellent cinema just across the road. Bedroom was a good size with comfortable huge bed and fresh clean sheets! Bathroom was roomy with all the usual condiments supplied. Didn't have meals so can't comment. Disappointed that the pool was closed for refurbishment but we were offered an alternative at an adjacent hotel. Didn't think the bus tours were as good as those in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, close”
Reviews.Author: Crowncitycat
Reviews.Content: Lovely property; the stay was a pleasure. Located in downtown Vancouver, one is able to walk to a lot of attractions, including restaurants, theatres, shopping, and Gastown. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The quality of the beds and linens were excellent, as well as the service. I was in a two-room suite, with bedroom, sitting room, and a large bath with separate tub and shower. Used room service once, and the food came hot and in good time. Overall, a very satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: tomhopkins
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Sutton Place is a good quality hotel but our trip was full of niggles, such as the sudden closure of the pool and numerous small problems in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Torontonian54
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Sutton Place exceeded my expectations. The central location, attentiveness of the staff, oversized room with a great bed and bathroom plus the excellent breakfast buffet gave a considerable boost the many delights of visiting a sunny Vancouver. A little caveat though: the concierges should be a little more careful when providing information concerning opening hours at various sights.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: virginia732
Reviews.Content: It is central to all downtown activities and the staff are friendly,and helpful. The restaurant is great with always a little chef's surprise. We also enjoy the pool which has good hours for use. I have stayed with friends and family and for business and never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location, Superb Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Grace G
Reviews.Content: Stay right in the middle of EVERYTHING!!!!! Yet, you feel like at home. Cozy and Comfy!!! We were getting tips from their concierge Miguel, weeks before our trip and he hooked us up with Fabulous Ideas!!!! If it weren't for him, we would have not had time for everything we did. Miguel is the BEST!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great locaiton”
Reviews.Author: DavidatTarget
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Vancouver's business & retail core, the Sutton Place is well-situated to take advantage of downtown Vancouver. Starting with the large parking pull-in area (amazing despite the building density) to a warm welcoming desk staff, this hotel was a really nice find and a reasonable vaule given what some other downtown hotels charge in the summer. My room was spacious and comfortable, although the decor was a bit dated (as with other Canadian Sutton Place). I did not use the fitness center, and the business center felt a bit squirreled away, but I very much enjoyed my stay. There are plenty of restaurants & retail options in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with just enough snobbyness”
Reviews.Author: littlesmitty45
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were going to vancouver to visit a girl that moved out to B.C a few year ago. We decided we wanted to stay somewhere with a kitchen as we didn't want to eat out every night so this was one of our few options but glad we chose it. We chose a package that included breakfast in the morning and free parking as it was the same price as just getting parking added on. We arrived early but they had a room for us on the top floor which gave us a nice view of the area around (other buildings). We then started to unpack and try out the kitchen in the room. These weren't top of the line appliances but good enough for the basic cooking we were doing. There is also a grocery store across the street and a wine store attached to the hotel which made it simple to grab things for the room. It is also in the heart of the main shopping area downtown so it made it simple to do some shopping. Our first morning we were woken up by probably the friendliest staff member I have ever had at a hotel. He came in and brought us our breakfast which I might add was probably the best breakfast I have ever had in a hotel and I have stayed in every nice hotel in the U.S and europe by now. It was a treat to have and was very pleased we had chosen that option as I can't imagine the trip without his smiling face every morning and the great breakfast to start my day. We enjoyed the tv in the room and the balcony as it gave us a nice spot to sit out during the nice weather. The only thing we didn't like as much was the pool which was just ok but not really the standard of a upscale hotel. This has nothing to do with the hotel itself but this hotel has many celebs stay there and while printing out my boarding pass I ran into James Van derbeek (dawson from dawsons creek) and chatted with him for a few mins but had to cut it short to get some sleep before my flight which I regret to this day as he seems like a pretty awesome guy. We also saw many of the cast members from twilight milling about the hotel which had my friends almost passing out. All and all a very nice option in vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annemvb
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The first night our room was on a very loud street and we got no sleep. I called in the morning and or room was immediately changed. The hotel was very accommodating. Nice location, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Angharad L
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Staff were very friendly and always helpful. Breakfast buffet was great and chocolate buffet definately catered for my sweet tooth! Rooms were spacious and contained everything needed for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: Hdavey
Reviews.Content: check was a breeze with very helpful and friendly staff. clean comfortable one bedroom apartment. we were amazed at the size of the apartment we had but unfortunately it was only for one night. very centeral to most things, resturants, shops, etc. we caught the train from the airport and then walked to the hotel. simple. the only thing we missed was fresh milk for the tea and coffee but it the same in all the canadian and usa hotels we have stayed. creamer and or small uht milk. if that is the only problem then there really is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Vancouver "go to" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodtwosome
Reviews.Content: Weekend escapes to Vancouver will now take us to Sutton Place. Prime location. Nice rooms -- we opted for one of the small suites. Good staff. Attractive public areas, including sun patio and adjacent indoor pool. Next time will try spa facilities. High parking fees are a bit of a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: freshmonkey
Reviews.Content: We booked here through a third-party site (Hotwire). Upon arrival we were greeted by a rude and unwelcoming staff and were then shown to a small, dingy and outdated room. When we called to complain, we were told we could upgrade (which took the overall cost of the room to over $200). Our second room was perfectly adequate, but for the cost I would recommend the Westin (we stayed there last time we visited Vancouver, also booked through Hotwire, now that's a beautiful hotel with great service!).

Reviews.Title: “Always the best!! Never stay elsewhere when in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Carol F
Reviews.Content: We fly to Vancouver and stay at the Sutton every year to celebrate our Anniversary. We have stayed in other luxury hotels; but the Sutton's atmosphere, customer service, and all of the prime amenities (right down to underground parking), is second to none. Any contact with the staff is also far superior to anything else we have experienced. Everyone is smiling, friendly and there is always someone available!! We see mostly the same faces every year too, which says a lot for great management when the staff is consistent and happy. The hotel has an extremely friendly and knowledgeable doorman, great guys running the valet service, experienced and very accommodating concierge, and the front desk staff, bell-boys(?), room service, housekeeping, turn-down service, even the guy that re-stocks the mini-bars, are all extremely efficient. We are always pleasantly amazed at the very high standards that remain consistent!! We stay in a premium room; which has everything you could possibly want..... and if it doesn't, all you have to do is ask. If it is at all possible, ask and ye shall receive. The hotel is located right near the famous Robson Street downtown. Any restaurants or shopping you can think of is within walking distance. And, if you don't want to walk, there is always taxis available and waiting in their driveway or the public Sky-Train is only about 3 blocks away. All of the above are the best things about the Sutton and I haven't yet come across anything that I don't like. I would, and do, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very pleasant feel to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robyn596
Reviews.Content: We had 2 different stays here on our recent trip to the west coast of Canada. It was a very friendly welcoming hotel in a central location. Burrard street is one of the main streets in downtown Vancouver and the next cross street, a mere 50m away is Robson st, the high end shopping area of the city. We were able to walk to a lot of the main attractions. The sky train station was also handy. Our first room was at the front of the hotel, with a view down over Burrard st. This was great. The room was comfortable.the staff we are most obliging.... We llike a cup of tea and a electric kettle was delivered to us within 10 mins of our request. Our package included breakfast downstairs in the dining room...it was excellent. Probably the single best aspect of this hotel was the friendly, helpful, informative staff on the Concierge desk. As tourists wishing to experience/visit as much of the city as possible in our 4 days I was given a lot of information and advice by these staff. They organized tickets, gave personal tips and couldn't have gone out of there way more for us.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: suerob48
Reviews.Content: Came across an ad for this hotel and stayed for one night after an Alaska cruise. What a pleasant surprise!--very nice and comfortable room, wonderful location; friendly staff; reasonable price. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maureen4H
Reviews.Content: Booked the pre-cruise package - it was amazing. We stayed for two nights pre-cruise, and one night after. Lovely lobby and sitting area. Room - we were upgraded to a suite for booking early. The suite was spacious and comfortable. The mattress was one of the most comfortable ones we have ever slept on. Very nice linens. The bathroom was beautiful with nice toiletries and decent water pressure. Good quality towels. Flat screen TV's in sitting area and in the bedroom. Breakfast - the package included a buffet breakfast, which is usually $25 per person. The food was excellent - eggs, bacon, waffles, toast, mushrooms/tomatoes, etc, great selection of fruit and cereal. Location was good. The hotel has a wine shop and bakery on premises. There were some designer shops, pharmacy, fast food, etc all close by. Burrard Street leads straight down to the water, by Canada Place. It was a short ride to the cruise terminal, and the package included the taxi fees. Front Desk and Concierge - wonderful! We arrived without luggage (lost by the airline), late in the evening, after a long day of travel and plane delays. The person at the front desk was courteous, kind, and helpful. It was wonderful to feel like someone wanted to help. He offered us supplies, left a message for the Concierge to contact the airline first thing in the morning for us, answered questions on where to obtain cruise-wear, etc. The Concierge kept in contact and was gracious and helpful. He provided complimentary web access so we could handle online issues related to the lost luggage. We were able to contact him throughout the day for updates and he let us know when our luggage arrived from the airline. We were so impressed with the customer service - even the hostess in the dining room was amazingly helpful. Staying at Sutton Place was a wonderful way to start and conclude our trip - a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: We were sent to the Sutton Place Hotel through our cruise line. We were a little disappointed to not get a waterfront hotel, but for one night we figured it would be okay and it was. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and efficient. The concierge recommended a trip around town on the Hop On/Hop Off Bus which stops right in front the hotel. He also got us a table at the Blue Water Cafe which was a short walk away. The room itself was nice, though I could hear street noise, which seemed weird since we were on the 14th floor. The complimentary breakfast buffet was great and there is a small coffee shop to get a premium coffee drink if you like. Because it was included with our cruise fare I can't complain, but the waterfront hotels sure have the views! We also walked through the old Fairmont lobby, which is about a block away and thought it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “location,facility,service-excellent”
Reviews.Author: pirupini
Reviews.Content: very expencive but safe parking car and no free internet the only down grade

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming....too much hype!”
Reviews.Author: holidayer80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton after going through hotwire. I ended up paying $200 per night. After reading the reviews, I was looking forward to staying at the hotel. However, I was a little leery after seeing some of the photos, as the rooms looked out-dated and small. I had a similar experience to another reviewer, who also used a third party booking service to book the room. The lady at the front desk was quite rude and I was put in a room next to the elevator and overlooking the apartments behind the hotel. I phoned the front desk immediately to be moved to a room away from the elevator, To the front staff's credit, this was done promptly. Just as I had expected, the rooms were outdated, old fashioned, pokey, and not that clean. Not really the five star experience I had hoped for. Yes, the location is good. That being said, there are several four stars (Sheraton, Hyatt, Westin) that are steps away from the Sutton. These hotels have updated, swanky rooms and better amenities. The Sutton doesn't even have an outdoor pool, which is a bit of a shocker. The Westin has a rooftop pool! We also had the pleasure of staying at the Pacific Rim, Fairmont on our way home. If it's a five star experience that you are looking for, stay there! It is the bomb. The rooms are amazing and from the moment you walk through the doors, you feel like a star. The Sutton is not good value for money, and even at the $200 I paid per night, I felt ripped off. Don't waste your cash.....If it's five star you are looking for stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. If it's location you want, stay at the Hyatt, Sheraton, or Westin. The Sutton is too much hype and is totally underwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SolonOhio
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver is a comfortable hotel in a great location with a fantastic staff! Comfortable Hotel: VERY comfy beds and nice linens. Nice toiletries (Gilchrist & Soames). Rooms were quiet. Great Location: There is an IGA marketplace next door. Canada Place is a 10-minute walk. JapaDog cart is right out front! Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Fantastic Staff: we used the concierge a lot for dining and touring suggestions. All of their suggestions were exactly what we were looking for. Plus, by the end of our stay, they all felt like friends :) The fitness center looked nice, but we did not use it. We did use the whirlpool, which is always wonderful after a long day of walking. We had the breakfast buffet one morning. It was good, but a little pricy to do every morning. The hotel also has a coffee shop, which was good. Cafe Artigiano is a few blocks away for another breakfast choice. We booked with a AAA rate, which made the Sutton Place the most affordable of the higher-end downtown Vancouver hotels. It was the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Beaton62
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Good location and conceirge was very helpful. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calderwood
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smaller, but comfortable. They could do with better showers. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: mshoo
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel was recommended by a neighbor - and we were thrilled. The location is very central but in this grande dame you feel away from the hustle bustle. The room was nicely furnished and very quiet. The staff was outstanding - in particular the concierge. Sometimes these classic hotels get overlooked and can be such gems - and this is one of them. Sutton Place is in the heart of downtown about 6 blocks from the waterfront. Walking distance to practically everything. We even walked back from the Granville Island Ferry landing. I would definitely stay again and would highly recommend it - beautiful hotel, beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: didiette
Reviews.Content: We loved our four night stay at the Suttong Place. My husband and I travelled there for our first anniversary and I'm so glad we ended up here. To start, the location is prime! We did not have a car and were able to walk everywhere we need or jump on a bus or train a few blocks away. That was my favorite part, knowing I was only a few blocks away from where I wanted or needed to be. The room was very nice as well. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which made our stay very comfortable. The bathroom was large with a separate standing shower and bath and the bed was extremely comfortable. The lobby is gorgeous, but other areas were showing signs of age. I had afternoon tea and it was very satisfying, although I was the only person having tea that day so it felt a little...quiet. I didn't mind, however, and enjoyed the time reading and doing a little people watching. The concierge was great and booked our reservations at a few busy restaurants without a long wait or hassle. It was our first time in Vancouver and I'm glad we stayed at this hotel. If we go back, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First class service always”
Reviews.Author: wc312
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in best location. Always greeted by friendly staff when I stay here. Very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Vancouver Option”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton for 3 nights in May 2011 on a business trip to Vancouver. In short, very good stay for business. PROS - The rooms were lovely. I stayed in a room with two large twin sized beds the first night and asked to be moved to a room with a queen for the next two nights. I was accommodated no problem. Both rooms were lovely, but the queen room was more comfortable for me. Everything was clean and orderly. - Room Service was prompt and what I expected for the first morning breakfast. - The restaurant was nice for breakfast for the next two mornings. The buffet came in two price types, which we did not realize initially. The cheaper version would have suited just fine for my taste. But overall, the food was very good. - The fitness centre was well appointed. A bit crowded, but more than adequate. - The location is great. Good for my business purposes, but also great access to all of commercial downtown Vancouver. Take transit or a cab to the Park though. CONS - The fitness centre was on the other side of the lobby, down a hall, down an elevator... It was not convenient for walking around in your workout clothes. I felt very conspicuous and uncomfortable. BOTTOM LINE - I would recommend the Sutton. I would stay elsewhere if there was availability, but if my favorites are booked I would come back to the Sutton.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: missusblackhart
Reviews.Content: For one of the swankiest hotels in Vancouver with a decent reputation my stay at the Sutton was rather dissapointing. My husband booked a room online (hotwire) hoping to get one of Vancouver's more interesting boutique hotels. When we got the Sutton, I was hopeful it would be ok, as I had been going to the hotel's gym for personal training sessions regularily and thought it was an ok hotel. From the moment I checked it at the front desk, I felt we were not treated like welcomed guests. The rather snooty front desk woman gave us a room with twin beds. Obviously, this was not ideal for my husband and I , and I said something immediatly. The receptionist made a rather passive aggressive comment about the site we used to book the room. She changed it reluctantly. After this unfriendly desk service, I was rather irritated. We went to our room on the 6th floor. It was a decent room. It was clean, spacious and basic. Our window looked right onto Nelson st behind the hotel on to some apartments and the fire hall. The room was adequete, but felt old and boring in decor. We had a decent sleep on the hard mattress. We woke to enjoy our breakkfast in bed. The man who served it was kind and curteous . The breakfast was delicious and beautifully presented. It cost something like $22 per person. It was delicious but felt it was also expensive for what you get. All in all, I have fond memories of my stay at the Sutton- but those memories are because of my husband! The hotel is overpriced, boring, dated, snobby without reason and had the most stomach churning elevators I have encountered. The Sutton really needs to update it's look and quality of service to compare any of the other fine hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond!!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynSmith7
Reviews.Content: I had booked an online reservation for an overnight stay at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver for our wedding anniversary. Imagine our surprise and dismay upon arrival to discover that I had booked the wrong date! We were initially told we could not get the online rate for the same room (was substantially more) so passed on the offer, but hotel staff were most gracious and accommodating and offered us an upgrade to a better room, as well as free parking and Chocoholic Buffet so in the end, our stay cost the same as we'd anticipated, with the added benefit of a beautiful, upgraded room. We also were not charged for our botched reservation/no show the weekend before! Kudos to the Sutton Place Hotel staff for making what could have been a regretful mistake into a wonderful hotel experience, from the valet who parked our vehicle to the front desk manager who resolved our issue and left a message on our hotel room phone to make sure we were happy. Quite simply, their service is exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JenB77
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly for our entire stay. The concierge service was also very helpful. The location on the hotel was great as we were within walking distance to all of the area attractions but didn't have to pay the prices of staying right near-by. There was also a grocery store one block up which was great to just grab a quick bite or beverage before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the center of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TriptheLifeFantastic
Reviews.Content: We liked our rooms, the dining room for both lunch and breakfast, and room service. The staff was friendly and efficient. This is a great hotel for a brief visit to Vancouver. You will feel in the middle of things here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: mariebird
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire.com. It was rated as a 5 star and we pretty much paid a 3 1/2 star hotel. Transportation from airport: We took a taxi and it was pretty quick and easy. Cost was about 35$ CAN. Lobby/Check-in: Nice, clean lobby. Check-in was super easy and staff was courteous. We arrived around 11am and we were lucky, our room was available and we had an early check-in at no extra cost. Very friendly concierge brought the luggage up to our room and gave us a ton of advice on things to do in the area. No pressure for us to give him tip, we actually had to chase him to give it to him! Room: Spacious. Not sure if it's really a 5* though (as said on Hotwire), I think I'd say a 4 1/2*. Very comfy king size bed with thick comforter and very comfortable pillows! Huge windows with a great view, I enjoyed sitting on the side on the window and just looking down in the city. Bathroom was clean and nice. Shower head was disappointing...the water came out in all directions! TV was also little disappointing, we were expecting a flat screen TV but it wasn't. Several channels to choose from though. Oh and the bathrobes...COMFY! Workout room: Disappointing. SO very small! I would expect something much bigger for a 4 1/2* hotel. The 3 treadmills were nice though, high quality. Disappointing spinning bike (only 1). Could of been better overall! District: PERFECT! SO close to so many stores and restaurants. 5 minute walk from Robson street. Japadog stand right next to the hotel. Designer stores, Lululemon, Little Burgundy, Nike store, etc etc...perfect when you want to take a break from crazy visiting and just want to walk around and enjoy the area. Many many restaurants to choose from. My favourite was Guu Original, you have to check it out! It's an izakaya, food was great and ambiance was amazing...a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Also go to Aki, it felt like we were eating in Japan. About a 25 minute walk to Stanley Park. I recommend this hotel to anyone, I would definitely go back (even though I didn't like the gym!)!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, not mind-blowing”
Reviews.Author: murphy713
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I had an enjoyable stay at the Sutton Place Hotel. The location is truly unbeatable. We found the staff to be pleasant, despite the hotel being very busy. A couple points to work on - we found that the bathrooms weren't super-clean upon arrival. They did improve the next day though. Also, the internet charge (I think $15/day) seemed to be a lot, considering it is somewhat of an upscale hotel. This is very clear upfront, but I heard several people complaining to the front desk staff about the cost. All in all it was a good visit and we would stay there again, mostly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant rooms and central location”
Reviews.Author: jenanne11
Reviews.Content: Very gracious service everywhere we went - from the valet to the conceirge to front desk. We were a little grubby after flying for 12 hours, and were so pleasantly surprised by the warm reception we received from everyone across the hotel. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raincheck10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business and was very pleased with this hotel. Check in was easy, staff was great and room very nice. I had a corner room on the 15th floor that offered some great views of Vancouver. Flat Panel TV offered all the channels, bed was comfortable, wifi decent and bathroom super nice. As other have mentioned, the location of the Sutton is excellent. On a small note, parking was very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “One of Vancouver's finet”
Reviews.Author: Albangsar
Reviews.Content: Location was everything, excellent service at such an affordable price!Dinners at Joe Fortes, Coast, Cactus Club were exceptional and all within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but didn't knock my socks off”
Reviews.Author: schneeballe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place in June 2011. We booked 2 rooms online as my brother was traveling with us. When we arrived, we were told that they were very busy and that they would like to give us a two-bedroom suite instead of two rooms and they would throw in free breakfast in the hotel restaurant. This was okay with us but this last minute change might be a hassle depending on who else was in your party and if you didn't want to be in the same room even if it was a suite. The two-bedroom suite felt like an apartment suite that was converted to a hotel room. The room felt quite dated; the carpet somewhat worn, old flat-panel doors and casings that had been painted over. It was clean enough but felt more like someone had let us stay in their apartment than a hotel room, especially one that is in a five-star hotel. The bed was fine but wasn't exceptionally comfortable unlike the Sheraton or Westin that promote and market their ultra-comfortable beds. There was a little galley-style kitchen that would have been okay if you wanted to cook something or store food. We didn't cook anything so I'm not sure how well-stocked it was. There was a little living room with flat-panel tv and a small, round table next to the kitchen. Overall, it was more than adequate and comfortable for what we paid but I would have been disappointed had I paid full price. The restaurant with the breakfast buffet was very nice and the breakfast was lovely. We ended up getting a great deal considering they threw in the buffet breakfast (approx $80 value based on three buffet breakfasts). I found the front desk staff to be friendly, helpful and accommodating. Overall it was a good stay, no major complaints or issues but I guess I just expected a little more opulence for a hotel that is considered a five-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Klug
Reviews.Content: SP is a classic hotel. It's rooms are a little odd and old but they keep it very nice. Its super clean And everything works well. I had an exec suite which is spacious but the bedroom is small and has no windows. First time Ive had that and I've stayed here many times. Despite that it's comfortable and nice. Bed is similar to a weston heavenly. V comfortable and high quality linens. Nice small touches too. iPod alarm clock, separate thermostat for bedroom. Ability to run fan on AC. Bathrooms are a strong point at sp too. I think they all have separate shower and tub. Very large with marble. Food in restaurant is above average and service is quick and super friendly. Only complaint here is the coffee! They really need to improve the coffee it's truly their achilles heel. I like the SP and def recommend. I'll be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Elegance throughout.”
Reviews.Author: leorespy97
Reviews.Content: Very classy, elegant and great location. Surrounded by great eats, shopping and nightlife within walking distance. Only draw back was the sirens in the middle of the night because of the hospital being two blocks down. No need for sirens at three o'clock in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest.”
Reviews.Author: BEHIKE56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was grand, classy, and in a great location. We were able to choose between every type of restaurant or store imaginable. Could not have picked a more perfect hotel, great room, great service, great restaurant, just a great place to stay. Super professional service, from the concierge to room service, I approached a member of the staff I was greeted with a pleasant smile and true hospitality. You can only expect these kinds of services in a five star hotels. Our room was comfortable and beautifully decorated. The room was spectacular with panoramic city views, bright and spacious, with the best bed and bedding ever. The suite was very well equipped with all mod-cons but maintained a luxurious, classical feel. I have had the opportunity of staying at hotels in Vancouver, but I have to honestly say that "The Sutton Place Hotel" is one of the finest.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Treat”
Reviews.Author: NotaHotelSnob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on July 18, 2011 to see the Katy Perry Concert. This hotel is never a disappointment and always a treat to look forward to. From the time you arrive, you are greeted by the valets, and inside the desk staff is very polite and friendly making sure you have everything you want. The lobby is just gorgeous and the smell of beautiful fresh cut flower arrangements fill the air. The rooms are not chrome and glass, but instead classic dark woods, silk bedspreads and comfort. Large bathrooms are all stone work. Very nice. Rooms are very quiet with very large windows. They provide in room robes and safes. I beieve this is also a non-smoking hotel. It is very close to everything you could want to shop for. Only steps from Robson Street shopping. Also within easy walking distance to alot of sights. I have stayed here many times, and will always come back to the Sutton.

Reviews.Title: “Post-cruise R&R”
Reviews.Author: bhaley3
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 room suite on line for one night following a cruise. We arrived at 10am, expecting to check our luggage until actual check-in time. To our delight, we were able to check into our room immediately. The suite was bright and spacious, with the best bed and bedding ever! As first time visitors to Vancouver, we were happy to find the hotel was located right in central downtown. The hop on/off trolley stopped right across the street, so we were able to tour Stanley Park and the city easily. By walking 2 blocks in any direction, we were able to choose between every type of restaurant or store imaginable. I've already told everyone I know how wonderful Vancouver and Sutton Place were!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Trip To Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Jimb011
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sutton Place Vancouver Hotel are Excellent in their Delivery of Service Excellence bar none! Enjoy all the immediate ammenities in the area including the Scotiabank Theater and the Wine Store next Store. Great selection of Wines from all over BC!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious with great staff and food.”
Reviews.Author: xdominogirlx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for my final night in Vancouver- I wanted a nice space to sleep, and the Sutton Place ticked my boxes and more! I booked a king room through bookings.com for an absolutely bargain price, and got far more than I could have hoped for. The hotel itself is grand in presentation, I looked completely out of place coming in looking messy after ten hours of travel, however the staff did everything they could to make me feel good. The hotel is in an excellent location, still centrally located but away from the party streets. It's popular with high flyers and celebrities, so you never know who you might run into! My room was spacious and very comfortable. It was well fitted out with all the important things and the bathroom was amazing. The bed was huge and I had the best sleep I had of my trip on it. I would strongly recommend the room service menu- I had both dinner and breakfast and was very surprised. I am so used to being let down by in room dining portion sizes, but in this hotel this was not the case. The breakfast smoothie of peanut butter, coconut and banana was astounding and the perfect complement to my banana bread. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomM013
Reviews.Content: Super professional service from the concierge to room service. The room was spectacular with panoramic city views (they upgraded our original reservation). The suite was very well equipped with all mod-cons but maintained a classic, historic feel. The extra strawberries and congratulations card were a nice touch too. The food was great, delivered hot and on time. Well recommended to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel in the Heart of Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jms1971
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at hotels around the world, but I have to honestly say that "The Sutton Place Hotel" is one of the finest. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown and is within walking distance to everything, but if you prefer public transportation that can also be found just a few blocks from the hotel. The staff was efficient, attentive and always pleasant. There was not a need of mine left unfulfilled, and whenever I approached a member of the staff I was greeted with a pleasant smile and true hospitality. My room was comfortable and beautifully appointed. The fitness center allows for a complete workout and is beyond anything that I've experienced in other hotels. There is no question that I'd stay at "The Stutton Place Hotel" again and I'd highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very good weekend in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: fawltytours
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Sutton Place via Hotwire but were dismayed when we saw some of the negative reviews posted here. Fortunately, none of our fears were realized, and our stay at the Sutton Place was very enjoyable. The room was nice, the hotel was quiet, service was prompt and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for downtown Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in most of the better hotels in Vancouver over the years, and the Sutton Place is definitely a new favorite. We booked a 1 bedroom suite in the residence tower, which tough not quite as luxurious as the regular hotel suites, was very nice, with large rooms, full kitchen, balcony and large screen TV. The price was amazing for Vancouver in July, and we were able to walk basically everywhere. The staff were beyond courteous, and though pricy as all downtrown Vancouver hotel restaurants, the Fleuri at the Sutton place was excellent. Topped off with the amazing chocolate buffet we went back to our rooms full, and satisfied. I highly recommend this property for business travelers, families and couples. There is something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: veredka
Reviews.Content: Price of parking in the hotel is high. If you leave early you can find street parking. Hotel dose not provide free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanberraAussie101
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we stayed in during a 6 week holiday, the staff are aleays ready to please with every request, it really made our holiday in Vancouver really enjoyable. The location is really central.

Reviews.Title: “"A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city"”
Reviews.Author: khicks06
Reviews.Content: We had 24 hours in Vancouver before departing on a cruise. What stands out the most about the Sutton Place is the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff, especially the concierge. His suggestions and knowledge allowed us a wonderful tour of the city in a short period of time. Exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton was Supreme”
Reviews.Author: larryjude
Reviews.Content: Great room, great service, great restaurant, just a great place to stay - we enjoyed our visit to Downtown Vancouver immensely and will be back and of course we will stay at the Sutton

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in the heart of lovely Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: MarkHazelbaker
Reviews.Content: We found the staff amiable and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the bed comfortable. The botel is a few decades old, built in an era when hotels were built as modern tall buildigs but decorated to look like classical lodges. It is tasteful. I don't think it is fair to charge for wireless interest, as they do.

Reviews.Title: “I know where we're staying next time we're in Vancouver!!!”
Reviews.Author: BCuttell
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff at check-in... to the bus boy... to the restaurant staff... to the staff who processed our check-out, they were all wonderful. The room was luxurious. If you like beds with some give - then this is the place for you. Our room was on the 17th floor (a corner room) so the views were fantastic. The hotel location is ideal (corner of Robson and Burrard). Walk 15 minutes in any direction and you'll be amazed at all the places to shop, to eat, to visit or to just take in the sights. The only way the experience could have been better is if we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: same93
Reviews.Content: When I visit Vancouver I don't even look at staying anywhere else. Location service accommodations restaurant spa pool conceirge workout room have been & continue to be top notch every time I visit...

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Lkoranda
Reviews.Content: Nice pool. Could have been cleaner. Very friendly bell/valet parking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated.”
Reviews.Author: PaulV39
Reviews.Content: With a similar rating, I expected similar experience as the Fairmont. I was very disappointed; I would rate this hotel at 3.5 stars. Great location if you don't mind the outdated, dirty rooms

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Downtown Business Trips”
Reviews.Author: staffordb
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located right downtown in Vancouver, is a traveler's delight. It has all the amenities you would expect from a class hotel plus the staff are awesome. Whether you stay for only a night or several nights, everything you need is here. Theaters, restaurants and shops are only steps away as well as a full service grocery store on the corner and a well stocked cold wine and beer store. Convenient to all of downtown with all the perks, I would highly recommend this hotel to business and holiday travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless luxury”
Reviews.Author: Eversonice
Reviews.Content: The entire staff from housekeeping to management gets a gold star for their genuine, friendly service. Nothing was too much trouble, and we were made to feel special. Our upgraded suite with floor to ceiling windows showcasing the city skyline and mountains was simply spectacular. We opted for room service breakfast and dinner to take advantage of the view. We will return; Sutton Place is fantastic value v Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “If its Vancouver it must be the Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: TerryBradshaw20
Reviews.Content: I've been a client of this hotel now for over 25 years. I used to stay at the Four Seasons until I showed up once at midnight and they told me they had "lost" my confirmed reservation. Ever since then its been the Sutton. Why? First, the location adjacent to the Robson Street district is the best in the city. Second, its a true 5 star hotel. That shows up in the details and the staff training: the doorman knows my name and when you enter the lobby even I notice the flower displays; the level of staffing is noticeable; security, bellhops and front desk. Everyone makes contact. That sets the tone immediately. Check-in is under 60 seconds. The beds are as good as home as is the shower head. Starbucks is right across the street. There has never been an issue with safety or security; I've noticed some subtle changes in that regard over the years as Vancouver has become less inviting. The bar is cosy; a fireplace and a few quite alcoves: great martinis. The restaurant serves one of the best breakfasts in the city. When I travel I like to be comfortable and taken care of. Thats why I have been a Sutton client for 25 years. When you find something that works; why change?

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Islanders022
Reviews.Content: Once again the hotel and staff were above and beyond,we wanted for nothing.Cocktail time in Gerards lounge is an experence not to be missed,say hi to Walter the bartender in the afternoon a wonderful person.Dinner at the Fleuri restraunt was amazing and we will be back, AMAZING! You will not be dissipointed.The front desk staff are efficent and friendly and always greet you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff, expensive rack rate”
Reviews.Author: houstonturtle
Reviews.Content: The location of Sutton Place can't be beat - the corner of Burrard and Robson in downtown Vancouver. 2.5 blocks from the Burrard train station, 2 blocks from the art museum, 6 blocks from Queen Elizabeth Theater, everything is within walking distance. The room had classic furnishing (a bit dated, but tasteful), and was nice and clean. I got the hotel through a blind Hotwire booking (they classify it as a 5-star hotel) for $139/night for 2 double beds. Given that rate, it was a great deal and excellent value. Contrary to some other reviews I'd seen, the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly even though they knew I had paid a Hotwire deal price. I have to agree with the reviewer that said the TV was as deep as it was wide; definitely not state of the art! The most irritating part of my stay was the fact that the hotel charges $15/day for internet. There's no way around it, even if you pay the rack rate. Since this was just a short weekend trip, the lack of amenities didn't really bother me. But if I had been there on business, I would have preferred a more modern (i.e. efficient) decor and amenities. I would also not pay the published rack rate. Positives: Location, Staff Negatives: No free internet, Dated furnishing.

Reviews.Title: “This place is not five stars”
Reviews.Author: c4delta
Reviews.Content: I got a room from Hotwire for supposedly a five star hotel. We got a really tired...well worse. It could have been some room at a two star motel. Paint was peeling off the wall, the carpet was worn and terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Bernie1976
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5 star in Vancouver on hotwire and once I got the hotel name I have to admit I had a bad feeling about it. This is most definetly not a 5 star hotel and it is in serious need of updating. The windows in this place are tiny and as a result the whole hotel has a musty, stuffy kind of smell and I woke up the next morning with a headache due to the lack of fresh air. Thankfully we were only here for 1 night. Almost forgot to say that there was so much noise it felt like there was a hurricane outside even though there wasn't. There are better hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like stars, helped make our trip the huge success it was”
Reviews.Author: ErinGaster
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sutton Place in Vancouver on a regular basis for business travel. This trip was different, it was my Bachelorette Party, and 12 of my closest girlfriends from near and far were staying with me at the hotel. We arrived and asked to be upgraded to suites as it was a very special occasion, which the manager did with a smile and excitement for us about our evening. We arrived to our room to some special goodies, and were very impressed with the service of the poor bellman carring 12 ladies luggage, coolers, libations and other whatnots to 3 different rooms on two floors. The hotel met our every need, answered every phonecall and delivery (snacks, ice etc) with a smile and a twinkle in their eye. It felt like they wanted us tehre as much as we wanted to be there. Great job again Sutton Place, I will be back in a couple of weeks for business and look forward to the same friendly service as I always get.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Orcaffan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very comfortable and roomy suite for six nights. The staff of the hotel was sincerely friendly & helpful in assisting us with all of our requests for information, booking us at restaurants, and assisting us in gaining access to a physician for a medical problem. The restaurant personnel were very attentive and friendly. Most of our meals in the hotel were the breakfast buffet. It was outstanding in terms of selection of items including more European-style offerings. The only "downside" if you will is that wifi was not free to hotel guests. Hopefully this can be remedied in the future. Suggest that at the very least wifi be available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: dancingrhino
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Sutton Place. We have visited Vancouver many times. We think we have found the perfect hotel. The location of Sutton Place on Burrard, is right next to one of our favorite markets. An extensive wine shop on premises, Le Chateau is also right next door on your way to the heart of Robson, less than a block away. There is a multiplex movie theater kitty corner away. One of the busiest and most aromatic hot dog stands sits on the corner. Granville and Davies are three blocks away. Stanley Park is just a bit of a walk or a short taxi away. We love to walk in Vancouver. One of our favorites is the rectangle formed by Granville, Davie, Stanley Park and Robson. From the Sutton Place location we can chop that rectangle into a decent walk to the biz district, Gastown. China Town, etc. If you enjoy the fireworks exhibition, this hotel is perfectly placed for taking the backstreets to and from the event, on another one of our favorite walks through the neighborhoods. The restaurant choices are epic. We enjoy strolling, stopping for a drink and appetizers periodically, all day long. This hotel makes it a significant choice whether we will venture more than a block away. The restaurant and bar in the hotel are excellent. The service was impeccable. We checked in early and then didn't leave. I have absolutely no criticism for the service. The young woman at the front desk that I dealt with from the beginning to end was as professional and accommodating as I have ever witnessed. Every employee was courteous and seemed to genuinely like where they work. The valet service was excellent, the room service was excellent, the food and service at the restaurant and bar were excellent. Everything was extremely clean, and beautiful. This is the kind of place where I would consider holding a small conference or wedding. These people get it.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of good service”
Reviews.Author: GourmetloverKula
Reviews.Content: A very nice location, a spacious room, a comfortable bed. That's expected, especially when you get an upgrade. What goes beyond expectation is the friendly attitude of the staff. They make you feel like an old regular patron and it was the very first time we walked thru that door. Thanks. Two remarks: First: time to get flat screen TVs in the rooms. The old ones are becoming a curiosity. Second: bartenders in the lounge should relax with portion control. At these prices for a Martini, a generous pour of vodka is norm.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of luxury in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in June, 2011 and am very glad I did. The hotel as a very good location in downtown Vancouver, close to practically everything in the downtown core. Only a few blocks away from the nearest SkyTrain (Canada Place) station. Check in was very smooth - just a slight wait. The hotel is very busy with cruise passengers and groups, although you still feel like you are treated individually. My room (on the 14th floor) was very nice. Conservatively decorated, but not staid or tired. The bathroom was relatively spacious with good amenities. Shower was nice as well. Had a floor to ceiling window with a very nice view of the downtown area facing out towards the Waterfront. The catering staff for our meetings were superb - so friendly and so helpful. They were great. The food here is probably the best hotel food I have seen catered for business functions ever. Wonderful. Highligh recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel rooms I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dovebvi
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent five days in Vancouver at the end of last August. We have a lot of family there and visit frequently. We have stayed at lots of nice hotels there; our favorite is Opus. It was a last minute trip and we needed to book the hotel quite last minute. We ended up going through Hotwire, having just had great Hotwire experiences in San Francisco & Boston. What a mistake. When we arrived we were absolutely shocked to see our room. It must have been an old converted closet- no exaggeration. You entered through the door, made a sharp left -hand turn (there was a desk pushed against one side of what seemed like a narrow hallway) and then a tiny little room with two twin beds crammed in. It was smaller than most walk in closets I have seen. We went back downstairs where we were treated extremely rudely. I asked if there was any way that we could at least get a queen bed, as this was meant to be a romantic escape with my husband. They refused to move us. Not only was the room tiny but I don't think it has been redecorated since the 80's. The bathroom was also extremely outdated. I would never stay at this hotel again and I was sure to tell all of our family and friends about what an awful experience it was.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: leertopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and duaghter were very pleased we chose the La Grande Residence for our week long stay in vancouver. Choosing a suite upper level with balcony proved to be well worth the excitement as the city was buzzing after the Canucks win. The service was excellent and I was pleased with the cleaning of our room it was spotless each day when we returned. The oversized flatscreen and quality 6 speaker surround sound was nice for movie night as well. The location we thought was perfect as just steps away was a IGA grocery store with the freshest fruits and products in whcih we made several meals in the well furnished kitchen in our suite. Across the street is a movie theatre wich we enjoyed. Robson street was on the corner and we enjoyed all the many shops there. The easy walk to the mall and skytrain allowed us to hit all the places we planned to visit with a good central location of the city. This was the first time I did not become homesick of living out of a suitcase for 2 weeks. We felt more than at home with every comfort we imagined and more and will be more than happy to stay at the sutton place again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance”
Reviews.Author: GoodPlanet
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly a fine hotel. Given the central location, excellent service and a sweet Hotwire deal, I felt I got more than my money's worth. My perception was that the room itself was dowdy and dated. If booking a five star hotel, I expect modern facilities like a flat panel TV, an iPhone/iPod charger, and quality bedding. This room contained a vintage tv set, deeper than it was wide, a cheap and cheesy old alarm clock with no iPhone/iPod charging facilities, and (shock/horror!) 50/50 blend bedsheets. Although well maintained, clean and reasonably well furnished, the room was on par with a mid-range motel chain at four times the basic rack rate. If this room is representative of the rest of the hotel, then it's time Sutton Place dragged itself into the 21st century. And for goodness sake, upgrade the bedding! There's no excuse for polyester in a five star hotel. Conclusion: Five star prestige, location and service, but a three star room at most.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place knows what customer service is”
Reviews.Author: LCGoertzen
Reviews.Content: I began staying at Sutton Place 2 years ago for business and after the first stay I have never left! I now stay for both business and pleasure and happily refer all my friends and family to Sutton Place. I first chose the hotel because it had competitive rates for the area and a great location in Downtown Vancouver. I stayed because of the service excellence and the attention to detail. I can over look little things like not getting my newspaper in the morning (this only happened once) or an accidental charge on my account because as soon as you ask for something or mention something they go out of their way to make it happen for you or make things better. There is no question that all the staff have customer service and experience as their top priority. A clean and very friendly hotel that I would absolutely recommend for both business and personal travel!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Rixtrip
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Sutton was great. We had a room on the 18th floor our own downtown apartment. You are surrounded by great restaurants and shopping. My only complaint was the fourty dollars a day for parking after paying for a suite you would think they could look after that fee in there own building. R&M

Reviews.Title: “Wow... what a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carla181724
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a much needed break from life and spend a night downtown in a nice hotel. We had a hankering for chocolate and noticed that the Sutton Place had a promo on that with a one night stay, they gave us a $50 credit for their restaurant, including their famous Chocolate Buffet (so good!). Check-in was a breeze, everyone was extremely polite and friendly. We got a pleasant surprise when the concierge upgraded us to a delux room on the 19th floor. It was fabulous!
