The bed was absolutely amazing. Honestly the nicest one I have ever slept in. The worlds fluffiest duvet just added to the cloud-like slumber. Our few was fabulous and the location was perfect. Just off Robson so it was close to the hub-bub but away from the noise. We'll definitely be back for our next date night. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: P'line
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the location of this Hotel as it is only a 10 minute downhill walk from Canada Place from where the Cruise Ships depart. Our room was clean and comfortable. The Hotel is very close to the main shopping area and across the road we were able to catch the Hop-on Hop-off Trolley Tour.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect ending to our first fabulous cruise!”
Reviews.Author: diva090
Reviews.Content: The Residences at Sutton Place in Vancouver was awesome. After spending 8 days in an 'inside' stateroom (that we jokingly referred to as 'the cave'), the condo like accommodations at Sutton were a fabulous and welcomed change. We loved the room(s), we loved Vancouver and we loved the people. We visited at a most exciting time during playoffs for the Canucks we hope will be taking the Stanley Cup. The only thing better would be to be there when they take Boston! GO CANUCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not What it's Cracked Up To Be!”
Reviews.Author: kimmicoe
Reviews.Content: Me and hubby stayed at The Sutton Place Hotel for 1 night post Alaska cruise. The outside of the hotel looks absolutely beautiful. Once you get in things change a little. This hotel is very old which is not bad as long as it is occasionally renovated. Hotwire rates this hotel as a 5 star but I think they need to take another look. It would definitely qualify as 4 but 5 is a bit of a strech. I believe it is rated 5 star due to the amnities such as spa and such. We had a room with a view overlooking the tops of dirty, grimy buildings, gross. I opted to just keep the drapes pulled closed which was a bummer because Vancouver is so GORGEOUS Booked hotel using hotwire and got a steal of a deal. Paid about 40% rack rate and only stayed one night so I couldn't complain that much. Hotel is located in a great location. Easy walking distance from a the stores, restaurants and great public transportaion. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel stay for your trip I would strongly suggest you using hotwire or priceline. You will save a tremendous amount of money and have the choice of staying at some fairly nice hotels. You have to bid on a price using priceline but this is where you are going to get the biggest savings. It's not hard and you chose your exact location. Hotwire also offers pretty good savings. Check out this link for more info on how you can cut your hotel cost in half. www.kimstraveltidbits.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, pity about the noise from emergency vehicles”
Reviews.Author: CocoTampa123
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights, great service, in fact service is as good as there could be. only detrimental point was the regular noise during the we small hours was from the emergency vehicles, which occured a number of times each night. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: PhGGW
Reviews.Content: Well located, easy access, lots of options in walking distance. Very convenient for business purposes. Cordial, helpful, polite and friendly staff, usual Canadian hospitality. Quiet and comfortable rooms, not over-spacy, but one finds everything one needs for a business stay. Not overly cheap. Bar needs some upgrading, a bit dark and old fashioned. Good conference rooms. Unable to opine on restaurant and other facilities like gym and pool as those were not used.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: beesquare53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after an Alaskan cruise. The location is ideal,walking distance to everything. Spotlessly clean & beautifully appointed,courteous staff.comfortable beds with duvets and down pillows. What more can you ask for. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay at any of the other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Helps turn a business trip into a vacation”
Reviews.Author: LaurenWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sutton Place hotel are amazing. From the time the doorman greets you to the time they say thank-you for staying with us , you are made to feel special and appreciated. The facilities are great and housekeeping topnotch. Central location in the heart of downtown Vancouver , great shopping and lots of dining choices , the best being the hotel restaurant. I never think twice about where to stay when visiting this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “going above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: everydayeden
Reviews.Content: Always a treat to stay at the Sutton Place in Vancouver. The team has mastered that fine balance between providing high-end service without the place feeling overly fussy. They also have a knack of making you feel special, regardless of how you've booked, how many times you've stayed or how savvy you are at hospitality culture. On a recent visit we were running late for an interview and wanted to check/powder up prior. For some reason, at first, the desk could not find our reservation and I was worried as I had booked on Hotwire and thought perhaps I had made a mistake, etc. It was a long weekend too so finding another room anywhere would be tight and expensive... eeps! The desk clerk was calm the whole time and said they would get us a room, no problem, regardless... and perhaps sensing my thrifty budget, quoted a reasonable price. Finally, I found the confirmation on my blackberry, so all was solved. Whew! What a relief. We had not made any kind of a fuss about this minor glitch, but even still the desk clerk upgraded us to a top floor suite. Not necessary, but totally appreciated. Sutton Place Vancouver, you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I wouldn't call it a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kandjvdberg
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel. Our room was clean and the staff were friendly. Great location and we had a corner room with a decent view. We found the bed VERY uncomfortable - but we are spoiled at home with an awesome pillowtop...We thought parking was expensive at 40$ per day. Also the pool was difficult to find..unless we were just given the worst directions to get here....to sum it up we've stayed at nicer hotels for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Luxury”
Reviews.Author: RulesLawyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a Friday night in early May 2011. It was quite pricy (parking was $39.50 per day), but comparable to other nearby hotels. Check-in was fast, in-room wireless internet was free and speedy, and the room was spotless, elegant, and,although a little small, quite comfortable. It's located within short walking distance of the business district and the Pacific Centre mall. It was drizzling most of the time I was there, and as I headed out for a stroll in the rain, the doorman -- without prompting -- offered me an umbrella to borrow for my walk. Very thoughtful!

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Vancover, the is the Hotel to stay at!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roseanno
Reviews.Content: Everything is in walking distanct. We've never been to Vancover so we weren't sure what hotels were nice. We choose this hotel and we were very pleased. Very elegant!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Feel rejuvenated now....”
Reviews.Author: CathT1
Reviews.Content: I am a Mom who has a busy 3 1/2 yr old PLUS a mother who has some health issues. I have been care giving for them for past two years and really needed a few days off for a break. Staying at Sutton Place was just what the doctor ordered. The room was beautiful, and all services were prompt, and conducted in an unhurried and relaxed fashion. All staff encountered were warm and attentive. It really felt like a home away from home and I was able to walk everywhere in the west end. Thank you Sutton Place for making me feel rejuvenated now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mungvary
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Sutton Place en route to Whistler. A great stay. From greeting and assistance upon arrival after a long travel day with 3 children, to check out and departure - an incredibly friendly, accommodating and responsive staff. Concierge staff is the best - recommended great restaurants (and proactively changed our reservation when they discovered first reservation would not allow our kids to watch the Canucks game!) to helpful hints/recommendations for a family that had only 36 hours to explore Vancouver. Accommodations were great - 2 bedroom suite with kitchen and living room in the residences section. Ample room for family of 5. Kudos and thanks to the staff at Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it”
Reviews.Author: Dallasite1
Reviews.Content: Saw the reviews from people who had booked on Hotwire and felt rudely treated. I didn't experience that at all-all of the staff from front desk, concierge, housekeeping, bar staff- all friendly, professional. The rooms are a little dated, and the maids, while nice, didn't always do a thorough job of repleshing toiletries etc. But this is nit picking compared to the ideal location and the general pleasantness of the staff. Would be hard to find better price/value accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, quaint, a little uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCAtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far too dated to be considered a four star hotel. Examples: The furniture looks, smells 30 years old. The TV is not plasma. The bathroom is uncomfortably old fashioned. Ventilation ducts in the room were so noisy I actually found it difficult to sleep! On the plus side, the concierge was quite helpful and the Hotel is in a good location. The Hotel really slaps you in the wallet with internet and parking charges, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great city! Great hotel! Awesome staff!!”
Reviews.Author: frananddave
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to spend a few days in Vancouver, and loved the Sutton- the location was perfect for us and our room was one of the "residences" with two bedrooms, kitchen, family room- room for the whole family!! But, the absolute best part was the staff- in particular the concierge staff!! They were SO friendly ( always remembered my kids' names), gave great recommendations and really made the difference in the quality of our stay. We showed up without any confirmed plans, and left with a whole batch of wonderful memories! thanks to the awesome concierge staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: hollyboily
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Hotel in the Vancouver area. They are miles ahead in service and the elegance of their rooms without over charging their guests. For elegance, service, reliability & value there is no other Hotel in Vancouver that can even compete. This is the only place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway - be a tourist in your own city”
Reviews.Author: khvancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place Vancouver on the weekend. We decided on last minute to escape our daily routine to be tourists in our own city. We chose Sutton Place because it was elegant and not overpriced. It was an excellent place to stay, they treated us like gold. Our rooms were clean and quiet, we slept great. The breakfast at Fleuri's in the morning was even better. Great service! The concierge called three restaurants before being able to find us a table at the Sand Bar on Granville Island. Asking for reservations at 6:45pm on a Friday night to a nice restaurant is challenging at the best of times. But Christopher made it happen! When we arrived 15 minutes later they had the nicest table waiting. I would give the Sutton Place Vancouver a 9.9. It's not just about the hotel but the overall experience they provide. We will come back in the next few months and hope for something similar.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: this is my second time staying here, also from a hotwire pick, for a girls getaway over valentines weekend. stayed for 2 nights -Beautiful rooms, got a chance to make use of the hot tub on one night (it had just been reopened after renos), DEFINITELY try out the chocolate buffet - you wont be sorry! we had the best serving staff for that, such a nice guy who pointed out the best things to try - crepes, sorbets, puddings, creme brulee, fruit covered chocolate, the list is endless! beds were comfy, the bathroom was decently maintained, view was good, rooms were quiet and hotel really close to Robson. (and JapaDog cart!) the only downside was walking through the lobby to get to the pool - but that's what hotel bathrobes are for i guess!

Reviews.Title: “true definition of luxury treatment”
Reviews.Author: reza154943
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed for 2 nights in Sutton place. All I can say is that the staff and management totally pampered us and gave us the best treatment. From the pool to Spa to their Chocolat buffet and Sunday brunch everything was fabulous. We travel a lot and stay in different hotels, but as per my daughter this is like a true 5 and above star hotel ,and is fun for all age group, family and individuals. It is also next to Robson street which is the center for Shops and Restaurant and right opposit from Scotia Theater . All and all it was such a memorable vaccation to us. I'm sure my daughter has a lot to say about it to her freinds so as I. we are strongly recommend the hotel and thanks to management and staff to make our stay such a pleausre.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best......”
Reviews.Author: travellingmum68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom residences unit and found the room extremely clean with great service by staff. Every staff member we came across was professional and accommodating.Location is ideal being near major shopping street (Robson), there is a very good cinema complex right across the street and a very good supermarket right next door.My husband I also had a chance to enjoy a drink in the hotel bar, the service there was also exceptional with friendly service. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Canucks Won and I won!”
Reviews.Author: MJBBigWhite
Reviews.Content: Downtown Vancouver in the sunshine. Play-off hockey with clients. We met in the bar and the service was exceptional. The old grand leather and wood type service you would expect from a five star hotel. Everything about pre-game drinks was class, right down to the nuts. Upon returning from a winning Vancouver-Chicago playoff game it was deliscious red wine and a few appetizers. Upstairs to floor to ceiling windows looking over the city and the North shore mountains. King size bed, great turn down service, HD TV's to watch the highlights and relive the experience. Would love to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: deppypung
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sutton Place and had a great experience. We had a two bedroom suite, which was a great choice as it gave us a living room, dining room and full kitchen. The room was clean, had everything we needed and was quiet- we never heard one noise outside our room for the whole 5 days we were there. The only downside for us was that there was only one tub/shower, which means some negotiating between 4 people. There is a half bath off the master room, but a shower would have been nice. The staff, and especially the valet and doormen, were exceptional. They were friendly, always smiling, helpful and really pleasant. I have nothing but good things to say about everyone we encountered in the hotel- the staff are something the hotel should be very proud of! All in all the stay was great- I look forward to staying at the Sutton Place again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: dcrose
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very average and with so many great hotels in Vancouver there is no need to settle for average. The positives were: - early check in was available - great location for shopping and restaurants - indoor pool which is nice the time of year we were there The negatives were: - the room decor is dated and the hotel is showing its age - the room safe was already locked when we got to the room - the tv remote control did not work (maintenance fixed quickly) - the desk lamp and outlets did not work (didn't bother calling maintenance again) - the clothes closet is very small Overall no huge complaints but there are better high end choices in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stimpson
Reviews.Content: Summary of everything you want to know: - Rate- seems to be a lot of deals on this hotel all the time, keep your eyes open, I got a great deal - Facilities- Gym is one of the best Ive seen, free weights and commercial treadmills. Pool is heated and there is a jacuzzi. You also have access to the spa steam room which is great as they mix eucalyptus in with the steam - Rooms- thought the room was kind of small, very nice though, beds are new and high quality, TV is about 34", great view - Service- standard, concierge is very helpful -Parking- don't rent a car in Vancouver, especially not at this great location downtown. Coming from the airport take the Canada Line get off at city centre ( you will be 5 blocks from hotel) - Location- 10min walk to sky train, 15 min to gas town, Robson and Burrard is heart of shopping district, you can't really do much better in Vancouver. Lots of bars and restaurants in walking distance - Laundry- in house do your own if you want - Other- Grocery Store and Starbucks within 100m of entrance

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rossco10
Reviews.Content: Great location, shopping, restuarants only minutes away. Staff were friendly and accomodating. Room was fine with descent bathroom. Gym facilities were fine. Hotel has a guest laundry which was perfect. On arrival we were given two high tea vouchers which was superb. Overall a very hastle free hotel with staff only too willing to assist particularly the conceirge.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade?! Not!”
Reviews.Author: dishndiva
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire and checkin staff mentioned "how we booked" right at the beginning! Red Flag, right! We travel a lot and book through Hotwire a lot and we have NEVER had any checkin staff mention how we booked the room. No king beds available and we were given a 2 twin bed room....BUT for an upgrade(?) of $40 we could have 2 Queens. An upgrade to me, is for a better room and NOT for bed type. We expressed our disappointment at both checkin and checkout as we felt we were treated like 2nd class citizens because we booked on hotwire. We were enroute to Hawaii and booked a gorgeous 5star hotel, through Hotwire, and were treated like royalty, for our entire stay! Can't say the same for the Sutton Place Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “smoker beware”
Reviews.Author: travelcroll
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good hotel. A non-smoking environment, except for designated areas outside. However, the smoking area is poorly lit and standing room only, so forget about enjoying a coffe and smoke while reading the morning paper

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Kira97
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver with my mom and we decided to try a five star hotel in downtown Vancouver (as we always do the four stars). We booked over hotwire and got this hotel. We were excited because the location of it is fabulous, and the staff was very friendly. However, when we got to the room we were very disappointed. The bed was hard as a rock, the TV was old, there was a used bar of soap in the bathroom (ew) and the worst part was there was HAIR ALL OVER THE BATHROOM! It looked like pubic hair, I almost vomited. I've never been so disgusted with a hotel in my life. I was also disappointed that you're pretty much forced into valet parking, and it was $45 for the one night we were there (which we didn't know until until check-out) . I could deal with the extra costs if the hotel wasn't completely disgusting, but it was just another upset.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel convenient lOCATION”
Reviews.Author: fabmarte
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, convenient location, bright and clean rooms, very friendly staff. Enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: rainbwblu
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after staying here for 2 nights, I had a hard time reading many of the other reviews on this website. Those people couldn't have possibly stayed at the same Sutton Place that I just stayed at. Check in was a breeze. The valet and bell staff were amazing. The bellman made sure that we were comfortable in our room, pointed out many of the amenities, as well as telling us of some great restaurants and attractions just right out our door. Yes, the valet is expensive, but the service and convenience of having someone else pull up your car was great. They were always polite and so willing to help out with anything. Our room was amazing. We had a corner room on the 19th floor. The views both during the day and the night were amazing! We just sat there and stared for hours it seemed. The room was incredibly clean and updated. Great flat screen TV with DVD player and sound system to watch movies. A fully stocked wet bar (which was overly priced so we didn't use = but aren't all wet bars that way). The closet was big enough to store our luggage to keep our room neat looking. We never heard a peep from our neighbors. Almost seemed like we didn't have any. We used our white robes that were provided. The bellman told us we could call for slippers if we wanted them as well. The bed was amazingly soft. Every night they offered the turn-down service. If the 'do not disturb sign' was up, they would slide a note under your door with the weather forecast for the next day. We missed our turn-down service both nights but called them later when we were stepping out for a walk. They promptly turned down our bed with chocolates on our pillow, closed our curtains, and left the lamps on ready for us to head to bed when we came back. Every call to the front desk or housekeeping was greeted with great service and questions promptly answered. Our room service we ordered on our first night was spendy but amazingly good. The hotel itself was very classy. To be honest, I sometimes felt like I was dressed-down as I wandered up and down the hallway, past the restaurant, etc. It seemed like such a high class hotel. A true treat on our vacation. But yes, there were a couple small down sides. First of all, the pool, fitness room, and spa were a ride down the elevator, across the hotel, then up the elevator again. Seemed like such a long walk for a quick soak in the pool. Especially in such a classy place. The pool was very nice and the whirlpool warm and relaxing. We were the only ones in it at the time so we enjoyed that relaxation. In that area of the hotel was the spa, pool, fitness room, business center, gift shop, and laundry room. Since it was on the opposite side of the hotel, we didn't visit that area much at all, except for that quick dip in the hottub. Our only other problem we had was with the noise from the fan from the heat turning on and off. The click kept waking me up that first night. Problem was easily fixed when I switched the heat from auto to always on. No more clicks and I slept great all night. We thoroughly enjoyed this place. I can't help but wonder the same thing that the previous poster said, maybe when you pay the cheaper rates from the bargain sites, you get the cheaper rooms with lesser amenities. We booked directly thru the companies website. We signed up for their rewards club before we booked our room to gain some of their perks. Whatever we did, it was TOTALLY worth it! (I took a ton more pictures but for some reason TripAdvisor will only accept these as the others aren't the right format. Oh well. Not sure why as they were all taken with the same camera)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: emagreen
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly friendly and I really enjoyed my stay. My room was clean, well-appointed and I had no issues. My favourite part was my 11th floor view of Robson and Burrard- watching the hustle and bustle below was quite entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location, traditional but still modern!”
Reviews.Author: greenpanther25
Reviews.Content: This was a romantic nights stay on our anniversary, on telling the check in staff she congratulated us and also ensured a cake and water were delivered to the room for us that day. We upgraded to a 'premium' room for $40, I'm not sure exactly what we got as extra but I don't think it is worth the upgrade to be honest. The rooms are lovely and we requested a room as high as possible, which we were given, we had some great views of the cityscape. We didn't get free internet access which was very annoying in a 5 star hotel we thought it would be included. The spa is lovely but it was closed for a refurb when there so we didn't get to try it out. Overall the hotel is great but not quite living up to some of the more modern hotels near by!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodfood56
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last year in a 2 bedroom suite (2 bathrooms) with my wife, 2 daughters, and 2 grand-daughters. Was perfect for us - other wise we would have to book two rooms. Also, having a full kitchen was great with little ones. The room itself was very good value - however, if you need internet and parking it really adds up. The valet parking was $35 per night then you have the tips to pick up and drop off your vehicle. The overall service was 100%. For those who say it was not a 5 star I am guessing they didn't pay 5 star rates. Duh!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a "5" star hotel”
Reviews.Author: froggnik
Reviews.Content: Nice but tired lobby, friendly staff, outdated and small rooms. We booked this stay through Hotwire and were promised a 5 star hotel. The room were were first assigned had mildew around the shower and a horrible view of garbage on the neighboring apartment complex's balconies. We asked for an upgrade and were offered a room with rainfall showerhead and flat screen TV for an additional $35. We asked instead for a comparable room on a higher floor at least, which they did give us. Compared to other 5 star hotels like the Shangri La and Fairmont, this was NOT a 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, just not a 5 star hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazycanada
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this place is considered a 5 star hotel. The room was not exciting at all. Everything is beige. They seem to have several of the same styles of photographs in the room. Great for location as it is close to Robson street shopping. The TV should have been upgraded a long time ago. Not even a flat screen. Most 2-3 stars have flat screens now. Looks like a Superstore special from years past. Another thing that was annoying was that the bed was hard as a rock and that we were only given 2 pillows for the bed. No robes in the room or even turn down service with a mint. You would think for a kingf size bed you have at least 4 pillows. Bathroom needs renovating badly. The exhaust fan didn’t work in the washroom either. Wouldn’t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, somewhat stately Hotel located at Burrard & Robson St. Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Jauntingabout
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over a 10 year period and recommend it for its comfort and stability. The menu at the Gerard lounge is more accessible than that of the Fleuri which has become rather too esoteric for our taste, a previously enjoyable meal in October of last year was not repeated this time round. The wines are expensive so the bill can escalate! Why, I wonder is a simple cup of tea or coffee priced at $ 4. 50, and orange juice at $ 7? Breakfast is a major expense here and could be better. Unfortunately during a recent stay, there were noisy guests who selfishly chose to ignore the common decency of being considerate at three o'clock in the morning. The call from the front desk to security was a temporary easing of the situation, but unfortunately it still continued. There should be some recourse to this kind of abuse. On our return the following week we were given a better location and there was no problem. ,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, classy with a wonderful staff in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MacTexas
Reviews.Content: Just finished 2 days in The Sutton Place Hotel and it was a great experience. I spent two days there with my wife on a business trip and loved the hotel, the hotel staff and especially their hotel bar and restaurant. Very comfortable and located near everything in downtown Vancouver, it's the best place we've stayed in Vancouver..

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF PLACE”
Reviews.Author: sara77_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel had extra taxes on top of the state tax, also extra taxes on parking. then on top of all the extra taxes there was the the state tax. very unexplainable. for room service there was an extra charge for each plate. but the same place in the hotel restaurant did not have the extra charge. so a soup and sandwich would be an extra $3.50 for each plate. then mandatory room service tax, and then marketing tax, then the HST, which is the state tax. i've never seen this anywhere ealse. we had to pay $15 a day for slower than dial up internet. the bath tub had long black hair in it. the blanket was slippery, and kept falling off the bed. the pillow was too hard and big. the ambulance was going all night due the location it was central but also very busy at night. the staff were not welcoming or friendly at all. the building is very old, it need some work, specially the elevator. the wall centre across the street, had better beds, free bottle water, 2 free coffees and tea, decaf and caffeinated. free internet. no extra charge for delivering room service. and no hidden extra taxes. just one, HST. the pool was dirty and too much smell. also, the changing rooms were one floor up, so after getting wet in the pool we had to walk in the cold hallways to the changing room. i must say this again, the ambulance and fire trucks go 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Time”
Reviews.Author: ashhhhhh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during New Years Eve and Day. The Room is small and the siren from the hospital disrupted our sleep. Called down to housekeeping to get something took forever. We called at night to get some toothbrush and paste sent up. The person who picked up the phone at housekeeping was not professional at all. We had to call again for it. The housekeeping operator probably forgot the request. Overall very disappointing for a hotel with it's past reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the location, stay for the service”
Reviews.Author: Notam
Reviews.Content: Check-in was efficient and on the way to the room, we made a stop at the concierge desk to line up the complimentary "limosine" (sedan) service to a favorite restaurant (which was booked and guaranteed even before we arrived in our room). Access to the internet in the business center is also available through the concierge desk. We found the room decor dated, but actually still classic in many ways. Room 904 was very dark and opened to a condo immediately to the right of the window, but what we didn't know was the proximity to the lifts. We heard the lifts up and down throughout the night (sounded like planes taking off), so coupled by a really hot duvet and less than great mattress we had a rough sleep. Definately I recommend requesting a room away from the lifts. The shower stall design with the corner doors and TV (not flat panel) was throwback. We liked the hotel and respect it's style of that of a grand, elegant lady. The staff are committed, attentive and deliver a solid product. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is a luxury hotel for a reason”
Reviews.Author: MrEjection
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver for two nights over New Year's on 2010 / 2011. There is really not a bad thing to say about this hotel, with the service going above and beyond. Check in was easy and quick. I got a room upgrade due to my AMEX card, which was nice. We were on floor 20 of 21, and the views were spectacular. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean, holiday decorating was superb, and the workout facility was nice. We had Sunday brunch at the hotel restaurant. While pricey, for a New Year's Day brunch, I felt it was well worth the splurge. For us, the best thing about the hotel was the service of the staff. The concierge's were terrific (nice touch on the birthday cake!!), they were thorough, personable, and remembered your name. In a hotel filled with many highlights, the concierges were the most notable. The surrounding area was great too - it is one block from the famous Robson St., 2 blocks from Pacific Center and the Art Museum, a 5-10 minute walk to Canada Place and the Lookout, a 10-15 minute walk to Gastown and Chinatown, and a 10 minute drive to the Capilano bridge (and about an hour back - traffic is brutal). The only area I would stay away from in Vancouver is Hastings Street (starting at Abbot and heading east). The only two criticisms I have of the hotel are the price of self parking ($42 CAD per day after tax) and our TV didn't work (the poor maintenance guy was overwhelmed). On a personal note, I would recommend renting a car for a day (one equipped for snow travel), leaving early in the morning, and driving to Whistler. Getting out and getting into the city are tough, as traffic is horrendous and there are only a few entrances in / out of the city. However, the drive up BC-99 to Whistler is one of the best drives I have ever done. It is about 75 miles, but take your time and enjoy some of the most picturesque scenery.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, elegant place.”
Reviews.Author: horizonbound
Reviews.Content: Arrived late Christmas Eve and was cheerfully greeted by a very friendly staff. I had an "Executive Suite", about as nice an accommodation as I've ever had. Two HD televisions with remotes that didn't work so well. Had an underwhelming breakfast in the hotel restaurant: not very imaginative but quite expensive at $21. Christmas Day was exceptionally quiet in this normally bustling part of town. The only thing open was the adjacent movie theater where a movie was $12.99 and an upstairs Burger King offered a "value" meal for $10.50. Some value! The Sutton Place is a calming, elegant home in a city that left me cold!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Christmas with the Sutton!”
Reviews.Author: Sungirl1111
Reviews.Content: Long being a fan of the exquisitiely friendly and professional staff at the Sutton (always indicative of superior management skills), as well as a big fan of their classically elegant, yet charming lounge, 'Gerard's', I was looking forward to a relaxing Christmas eve, dinner with a friend, and a swim in the Sutton's fabulously glass-encased pool. As usual, I was greeted by cheerful and gracious valets, and beaming faces at the front desk. Throughout the entire visit, I was treated like a respected, but dear friend. This is the incomparable Sutton touch. The Lobby was beautifully done with gorgeous Christmas trees (a staff member had told us were done in competition) surrounding a village scene made of chocolate. Almost on cue, there were children dancing around one of the displays, although I wonder if Sutton hadn't arranged that as well? ;) On return to my room from dinner, there was a lovely Christmas stocking left by...well, who knows...Santa?...filled with colourful chocolates, a delicious 'homemade' gingerbreadman, candy-canes and the requisite mandarin orange. It has been awhile since I've received a stocking, and I was touched and impressed by this beautiful and thoughtful sentiment at a time when Sutton might surmise people are away from home and possibly loved ones. From a delicious and prompt breakfast delivered by one of the most cheery men (hi Mel!), with an unbeatable location, in the heart of the city's best shopping and with a charming glimpse of the ocean and North Shore mountains, this is still one of my favourite hotels in the world. It had been a difficult season due to a sudden family loss, and the staff in this hotel, without knowing a thing, made it much more bearable. Thank you Sutton!!

Reviews.Title: “My home in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: It feels like a medium sized European 5star hotel. The rooms are spacious and the beds are amazing. The staff are the best in Vancouver. There is no where else to stay that compares. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous December getaway in the City”
Reviews.Author: Intheknow2
Reviews.Content: We are North Shore residents who decided to have a fun night in the city. Booked a large suite for my husband's birthday. Checked in at 3 PM, shopped Robson St. and checked out Brooks Brothers, Tiffany's, Louis Vuitton, Roots shops and more - then went back to hotel to relax and get ready for an evening on the town. Met friends for dinner at a popular nearby restaurant on Alberni Street and followed up with a birthday cake celebration in the suite. After they left we headed to the Gerard loung for a nightcap. Roaring fire, cozy and traditional bar. Fabulous Christmas decor in the hotel, large comfortable suite with lovely views of Robson, North Shore mountains through peek a boo corridor. In the AM breakfast at Le Fleuri was the perfect way to top off our holiday/celebration home town getaway. You just have to try this...it was a wonderful experience. Also the decorated trees in the lobby were amazing...we voted on our favourite...proceeds to charity.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - could use an update”
Reviews.Author: Go_Out_and_Eat
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel this past week, and were very happy to be located right in the heart of the city. The rooms were not huge, but the staff was amazing, attentive and we enjoyed our stay. The chocolate buffet was pretty crazy i must admit, but my wife enjoyed every bit of it. Thank you for a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cosworth3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a convention. The location is ideal because it is in the center of town and almost a lot of places you need to go to is walking distance. The Vancouver convention center is a 15 minute walk. Robson street is around the corner and the skytrain station is a 10 minute walk. It is an elegant old hotel. The rooms are not large compared to newer hotels Although the service is good, my only complain during my stay is the soundproofing. At night, I can hear noises on above our room and you can hear doors opening and closing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/ Outdated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteCHS
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel for a one week stay. The location is just excellent. Everything is in walking distance. Great restaurants, shopping, nightlife. The hotel itself: -great and friendly customer service at arrival -room: outdated, worn out furniture, heating did not work, paint came off the wall, cloudy carpet, very loud elevator noises -staff seems to be very selective with who to greet and who not (e.g. when we were dressed up for going out at night we got greeted more often than during the day when I had my hoody on) -expensive wifi Overall I was dissapointed and felt more like a regular outdated 3 star hotel. No glory and glamour in the rooms. Just an average hotel. If you get a good deal take it because of the location but dont expect 4 or 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Werckmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Vancouver Film Festival and found the room to worthy of the 4.5 stars it received - cozy, well-appointed and not too stuffy. It's far superior for one to the Sutton Place in Toronto, which feels 2 decades too old. Location-wise the hotel is fantastic, and the staff are generally very nice and helpful, especially with directions. Would have been better if the internet was free however - it's 2010 after all! Still, overall the hotel lives up to expectations, even if it rarely exceeds it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: chatterji
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver. Next to Robson St. Blocks away from the convention centre. Clean cosy rooms with lots of windows and bright light. The front desk staff was very nice and helpfull. Wine shop and grocery store next door are perks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent allaround experience”
Reviews.Author: yalec
Reviews.Content: Staff and facility were first rate and the location was prime for shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and location”
Reviews.Author: MSAUsa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; staff were fantastic and the food is superb. One problem is the noise in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in service”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Bonnet
Reviews.Content: This is a 4.5 star hotel. When we first got there we were doubtful of the rating. The room itself needs updating - new furniture, new artwork (our 41 inch flat panel TV was actually in front of art). However, from day one we experienced amazing customer service. Tthe staff at this hotel are always there to support you, answer guestions, give advice, whatever you need, The concierges were outstanding - especially Jennifer. Their advice was honest and always helpful. They reliably made reservations at great restaurants or tourist trips etc. And the spa is expensive but was delighful.

Reviews.Title: “great location and room”
Reviews.Author: traveler-pm
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple days in Vancouver on our way back to the States from an Alaskan land and sea cruise. Sutton Place gave us a smooth transition to the more populated areas. It was in a great location, across from a stop for the trolley. The two day pass was a bargain, and it took us everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel two room suite was elegantly furnished--two televisions, beautiful, stately furniture. The hotel was very quiet and staff helpful. Many restaurants in easy walking distance from inexpensive to four star. Rather expensive hotel, but all hotels in Vancouver are pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel located in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: jlynnef
Reviews.Content: Getting around such a big city was a real challenge, we've never been lost so many times. Do your homework. Know exactly what you want to see and decide how you want to travel. Get a comprehensive bus and sky train schedule. Better yet hire a driver for the day. The locals know the best restaurants, shopping, etc. Plan to visit each area and see as much as possible on that visit. If you don't you probably won't get back for another chance. We missed Grouse Mountain for this reason. After a week I would have loved to do it all over again knowing what I did at the end of my vacation. Perhaps another time and we would certainly stay at the Sutter Place Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre-cruise hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tim-N-Sue
Reviews.Content: Loved the bedding. Got a great sleep. The staff was very helpful. Location is great for just walking around. Very close to the cruise dock and MUCH better priced than the hotels nearer to the cruise dock. Great value for my purposes. Internet is not free and quite high priced. The hotel is right near a hospital and we heard ambulance sirens going by. We only heard them while we were awake and not while we were sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to put a dent in your bank account!”
Reviews.Author: life_is_a_journey_mj
Reviews.Content: We try to visit Vancouver once every summer, and we were looking forward to spending a few days there again. Upon our arrival in early September, we were told the price for parking was $40 a night! We were so shocked. So we tried to look for another parking spot in the area of the hotel, and unfortunately could not find one. So immediately, we lost $80 just to park our car in their lot for two nights. Check-in was a breeze, and the man who was working behind the desk was extremely polite and attentive. My spouse and I took a gamble considering we booked through Hotwire.com, and we hoped we would have at least a queen sized bed for the two of us. Sadly, we received a room with two TWIN sized beds, now you can imagine how awkward that was. We did not bother to complain or change rooms because we just wanted to enjoy our stay with no hassles. The room is Victorian styled, not modernized whatsoever, except for the flat screen TV. The fan is very loud, but works fine. I think this would be a problem for some people if they have sleeping problems, although I slept like a baby. The view from our room was decent, just a view of the streets. They do have snacks and a mini bar in the room, but it is extremely over-priced! Internet is a whole other story..they charge $15 per day! So another $30 down the drain for us. It appeared as though many of the employees were just standing around looking for something to do. We did not see the pool or the restaurant, as I'm sure those would of had overly priced items as well. We wanted to experience what the rest of Vancouver had to offer. Overall, it was a decent stay and I would only stay again if the prices (for everything) were lower!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2727_10
Reviews.Content: Visited Vancouver for the first time in late September after an Alaskan Cruise out of Seattle. Drove to Vancouver to start our Canadian Rockies extension of the holiday. Found Vancouver to be a much more attractive city than Seattle and better attuned to tourism. Our travel agent recommended Sutton Place and we were all pleased with her choice. Good quality luxury hotel in an ideal location in the City. On arrival we were put onto a complimentary breakfast package which saved us quite a bit. Suggest you avoid the orange juice at breakfast which tasted waxy. We were told this was because the hotel juices the whole orange - end result, not enjoyable. Our only moan would be the high parking charges at the hotel. With all the taxes this came to approx $40 CAD per night! A rip off when you have already paid to stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Business_TravelerFFX
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sutton Place for an academic conference and could not be more pleased. The room was spectacular with a view of the harbor and every amenity that we could want. The service was faultless. The only drawback was the incredibly high Canadian taxes. That added at least one-third more to our bill than a comparable hotel in Washington state. In fact, we flew into Seattle and rented a car to drive up to Vancouver since flying into Vancouver was twice the air fare, almost all of it due to taxes. Canada is at risk of killing its tourist income with its taxes.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the pool”
Reviews.Author: CookieM0nster
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here once before, and was lucky enough to stay again. I usually book through Hotwire, which means you don't know where you're staying until you've paid for your booking. So after choosing to stay in a 5star (at a cheap rate!), I got Sutton Place. Anyway, as before the hotel looks awesome. Very clean and the staff are always pleasant and helpful. I really do recommend it, if you're able to get a good rate. The restaurant was a bit too expensive for me, but I guess I'm not really a 5star customer...ha ha ha.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR QUALITY!”
Reviews.Author: ellenhunter76
Reviews.Content: In stayed 4 days at Sutton Place.Service was excellent. The Poeple who manage the Concierge desk was very helpful and gracious. All the restaurants that they had suggested to us were excellent ,particularly one across the street from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DinahMason
Reviews.Content: Don't miss the chocolate buffet. Great Food, Great Staff. The new rooms have kitchens and are close walking distance to great shopping (Robson St) and within blocks of wonderful restaurants. We feel right at home here and always say next time we will stay a week longer!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, pleasant, good downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: alwaysabitpicky
Reviews.Content: Very quiet and peaceful. It is an older building kept in excellent condition, room was clean, mattress was the best! and service was good. Since we need our coffee to get our eyes open in the a.m., we wished we could have gotten a cup of coffee early from the restaurant - that was inconvenient - making a walk in the rain to Starbucks necessary. The CAFE coffee was NOT good...sorry to say. We felt that since restaurant was to open in 15 minutes, they could (in the name of excellent service) have sold us 2 cups of coffee, but hostess chose not to - small issue however. We came back after showers for breakfast full buffet - which was yum, but a little pricey - $23 each plus Canadian tax, about 12%. Oops, another negative: internet was not free . I would recommend this hotel and will come again; it was on the whole a very pleasant stay. Staff quite friendly & welcoming. I might add that we paid discounted Hotwire rate ......would not have paid retail and perhaps would have rated differently if we had paid retail.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright (I've had better...)”
Reviews.Author: seattle2sf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place for four nights in late August 2010. We booked through Hotwire. Even though we read the mild reviews and saw pictures on Trip Advisor we had low expectations of the place. Here are things we liked/disliked about the hotel: Likes: -Awesome location. If the JapaDog cart was not outside the Sutton Place, I would have given a lower rating. It's right in the heart of Robson Street. You can easily walk to neighborhoods such as Yaletown and Gastown. -Gym came in handy when it rained on our last day there and could not run outside -Nice lobby area Dislikes: -The staff were pretty snooty. The maids were nice and greeted you politely when you saw them in the hallway; the lobby staff (especially concierge) was pretty selective on who they greeted. -The concierge. I asked the concierge for directions to a restaurant that a friend recommended for brunch. I accidentally referred to it as Abigail's Place when it fact it was Abigail's party (he gave me a bit of an attitude about it); the worse part was the place was closed that day. He couldn't have told us that? We drove to Kitsilano neighborhood on an empty stomach and was annoyed that we were not told it was closed. Luckily the cafe next door was open. -The room (and bathroom) was consistent with everyone's reviews and photos: bed was lumpy, bathroom was old and outdated and yes wi-fi is not free. Overall I would not recommend this place to my friends. We do appreciate a nice hotel but feel there are '5-star' hotels out there that don't make us feel like second-class citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stevie70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights on a Room Only basis for my 40th birthday. Great location on Burrard Street near Robson Street. The room was on the 18th Floor overlooking Downtown Vancouver with the bay and Grouse Mountain in the distance. The room was very comfortable and reasonably quiet though, as mentioned by others, the drinks/snacks are very expensive as is the minibar! At check in the reception was excellent - very helpful and polite. The Concierge was also excellent and the porters very helpful. This is a great place to stay as it is well located and I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel experience.........”
Reviews.Author: Munks09
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotwire as a one night stay. Planned getaway for me,wife and our 1.5 year old child. It was rated a 5 star by hotwire, this is an extreme exaggeration. The location is excellent, as robson street is right around the corner and your in the hub of downtown. It seemed initially like a great deal booking through hotwire, but noted later it would have been cheaper to book on the actual hotel website. The extra fees are a killer in the hotel, 40 dollars for overnight parking, add that to your hotel cost and this hotel does not become a great value. Internet access was also a rip off. Did not stay in the residences, stayed in a regular hotel room. Room was average, nothing great, no mini fridge or microwave, in room food was a rip off ( 6.00 for water, same brand you could get at the IGA beside the hotel for 1.50). Room felt very outdated. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Overall, if your expecting a 5 star (or even a 4 star) experience, look somewhere else. Add in the extra fees for certain amenities, this hotel was not a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: EBABWBMB
Reviews.Content: Second time I stayed here on a business trip. I recommend using the AMEX Platinum card to reserve your room here; you get a free upgrade if available, $100 dinning credit and free buffet breakfast. We used the buffet breakfast credit to order off the menu and just paid the difference. The rooms are clean and updated. Very quiet hotel. Food is pretty good. Buffet could use eggs or something else. Location is perfect. looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Value your best bet in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: oshdad
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a one bedroom suite and were upgraded to a two bedroom suite. We could have stayed for ever. Luxurious accommodations and excellent value. The location couldn't have been better. We really enjoyed our stay at the Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant European Style Hotel. Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Teacherguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for three nights in March 2010, while in Vancouver to see a couple of Canucks games. I picked this up for $100/night on Hotwire.com, which was well worth it (I found that most hotels on Expedia were going for $140 or more per night). The hotel is beautiful. It has a European charm to it (chandeliers, a grand entrance, etc). The rooms are nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. Because it is in downtown Vancouver, everything is within walking distance (the train station, GM Place, Canada Place, etc). We were there jsut a few weeks after the Olympics ended, so the buzz of the events could still be felt. The staff were great. They helped us find what we wanted and gave ideas of things to do. We went to the Capilano suspension bridge, and a tour of GM Place. The staff told us how to get to the bridge for free ( a free shuttle bus picks up and drops off at a hotel just a few blocks away - the Hyatt, I think). Overall, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in center of action”
Reviews.Author: trvdrmr
Reviews.Content: Our original reservations were for the Grand Residence section of the hotel but for some reason it was not available so they gave us a suite and adjoining room in the main hotel which was quite nice, probably better than the Grand Residence, minus the kitchenette. Restaurants are within walking distance, as are shops, museums, and the hot dog cart, "Japadog" with the Japanese influenced hot dogs, on the corner of Burrard & Smythe. The swimming pool and huge jacuzzi are in the basement of the Grand Residence, but it is a short walk through the hotel to the Grand Residence. The Vida Spa is one of the better ones that I have gone to and they do give very good treatments, although a little pricey. Wi-fi is not free in this hotel, but you can go across the street to a coffee shop where it is free. The daily price of the rooms fluctuated with the occupancy which was something I never heard of, but the price never exceeded the quoted price when reservations were made. Would recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PG1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sutton Place while vacationing in Vancouver and had a lovely time. The hotel gives the feel of a European boutique hotel. The rooms are a bit outdated and small, but we were still quite comfortable. The location of this hotel is ideal - steps to Robson Street, the Waterfront and the Sky Train station if you need it. As others have commented, I was disappointed in the high parking rate and the charge for wi-fi. However, it seems like this is common practice in the area - especially since they are right in the heart of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “No Way a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Gingerbits
Reviews.Content: Stayed in main part of hotel - service and lobby/bar are all nothing to complain about. Bar is a little dated but has character. Location is excellent. The let down comes when you reach your room. Furnishing is gloomy and needs an update. The king bed was lumpy and you could feel the springs beneath your hand. The TV was small and not even a flat screen. No wireless internet - who uses cables when everyone has PDA's! They wanted $15.00 per day for internet - a 5 star nickle & dimeing for internet. Cross the street to Starbucks for free internet. The hairdryer was like "my first hairdryer" a tiny little thing and I've seen better in a motel. It may sound trivial but when you leave your dryer at home because you expect a decent appliance at a 5 star - what a let down! Pool is in another building - awkward to get to. Would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: jane301257
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay in Le Grand Residence, Sutton PlaceHotel and there is absolutely nothing to complain about. Our 2 bedroom apartment was spacious, clean, well equiped and comfortable and daily maid service was fantastic. We used the pool regularly and the laundry occasionally! All staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially Heather the concierge who helped us with several bookings. This is not a cheap hotel but nothing is in Vancouver, but to us it was worth every penny to have a home from home in this beautiful part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: kamiahkid
Reviews.Content: Annually, I spend a week working in Vancouver. I always look forward to trying a new hotel, and it's hard to go wrong in Vancouver. This year, I had the pleasure of staying at the Sutton Place. The location is really second to none. It's within two blocks walking distance from the nearest Sky Train station, and it's proximity to other major sites in Vancouver is excellent. Robson Street is the nearest cross street, which is famous for dining and shopping. Davie street is also just a few blocks away. The services at the hotel were very nice from front-desk check-in/check-out to the concierge providing directions and restaurant recommendations. I only dined in for breakfast, which was on the expensive side, but that's common for most high-end hotels. The lounge was also enjoyable after a long work day. The guest room was nice, spacious and had an amazing view of downtown Vancouver. The bed was comfortable but didn't provide the high-end linens one would expect from a five-star hotel claiming to be "grand" and "European". In fact, one day I noticed the sheets were worn and had a small hole in them. The sound barrier between the room and the hall way was poor. I didn't use the fitness facility but did check it out on my way to the hot tub. It was nicer than most hotel gyms and seemed to have equipment that would serve many workout needs. Overall, I would recommend staying here, and I would definitely return for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Remember to mention you are on your honeymoon if you are!”
Reviews.Author: Ann51Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days even though we live in Vancouver as we got married and had a house full of out of town guests. We got the best rate by booking on-line directly with the hotel and had an amazing upgrade to a Grand Suite with complimentary bottle of wine and a chocolate desert welcome back to the hotel after the wedding. Very sound-proof, even being on the the very busy Burrard street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great location for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DanielAndRachel
Reviews.Content: We spent one day in Vancouver before going on a cruise to Alaska, and the Sutton Place was a perfect fit. The hotel is centrally located between Vancouver's West End and Downtown areas, within easy walking distance to both. There are lots of restaurants around, plus the Robson Street upscale shopping area is just a few blocks away. Granville Island and the Canada Place cruise terminal are also within walking distance, but plan on at least 10-15 minutes. The rooms are beautiful, decorated in an Old World European style, and many of the upper floors have great city views. The service was great, and the front desk/concierge staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again next time we're in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, great location, small rooms, noisy”
Reviews.Author: LLion
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sutton Place hotel was quite good. Check-in was smooth and efficient as was check-out. The service from every single staff member was excellent. There was one exception to the excellent service. Our toilet stopped working and it took two separate calls 8 hours apart to get it fixed. The rooms were somewhat small but okay. We faced the street and thus had a lot of noise. While the location of the hotel is excellent and very centrally located it is very close to a hospital and ambulances with sirens passed the hotel at all hours of the day and night. The excessive traffic noise did disturb our sleep. The restaurant was surprisingly good. Our service was indeed excellent, the food was served promptly and we were not at all rushed. The quality of the food was high and we both really enjoyed our meal. We decided to skip the all-chocolate buffet for dessert; we just did not need the calories or probably weight gain. The bar was cozy and the service and selection was again excellent. The only negative about the bar seems to be popular now but a put-off to me. The problem was the omnipresent wide screen television that caused distractions it what would have otherwise been perfect communications. The concierge service was extraordinarily helpful and they made a number of excellent reservations on our behalf. There is an elegance to the hotel that makes it a perfect place to meet friends or business associates.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel - bad stay.”
Reviews.Author: BBYA1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before my wedding and on my wedding night in the hopes that we would have a pleasant and relaxing stay - but I was sorely disappointed. When I checked-in at front desk I asked if it were at all possible to get a room with a better view as I was getting married and wanted a room with a better view than a parking lot. The front desk staff were cold, distant and completely unfriendly. I have stayed at many other hotels from 2 star to 5 star - and the service I received from their front desk would be equivalent to a 1 star. The worst part of this was that I believe I was "assisted" by their front desk manager/supervisor. The room is completely dated, worn and tired. The bed was extremely lumpy and sank inwards in the middle of the bed. My husband and I also got a RASH on our legs as we both had shorts on and I take it the sheets weren't clean. The carpets were stained and everything just looked over due for a refresh. On the morning of my wedding I was pestered by the house keeping staff about checking our mini-bar. Apparently they FAILED to check it BEFORE I checked in and after the PREVIOUS guests checked out - so I could have been charged for stuff the PREVIOUS guests took! If it weren't for my sister I'm sure they would have charged me for items I did not consume. The ONLY good service I received during my stay was from the valet and bell staff. They were friendly, accommodating and extremely helpful. If it weren't for these people I would have given this hotel a 1 rating. In hindsight I should have stayed at the Hotel Vancouver. I strongly do NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this is a very nice hotel with the nicest most helpful staff you will find anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: greg098
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at a nearby hotel in Vancouver, and discovered that a large number of attendees were staying at the Sutton Place rather than the hotel that was hosting the conference. There were several reasons why, including value. It's a very nice hotel with a great location, but is most outstanding for its staff. From front desk to doorman, concierge, maids, restaurant employees to whoever else they are the best you will find anywhere. Cannot recommend highly enough. Greg nashville

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beeben
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Sutton Place. The location is excellent really close to Robson St and within walking distance of lots of restaurants and bars. The hotel is luxurious although onsite bars, retaurants and mini bar are expensive. Their parking rates are enormous so a good tip is to park around the corner in the public ccar park for less than half the price-even cheaper on weekends. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katysmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a grand suite. The rooms were lovely - plenty of room for three of us, beautiful views, very quiet. We had wi-fi and continental breakfast included in our rate - the wi-fi worked flawlessly and the morning pastries were delicious. Service in this hotel is top rate - the concierges helped us with car rental, spa and restaurant reservations. And the location couldn't be better. We were able to walk everywhere downtown. We highly recommend Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “dump - avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: tedebear99
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from July 10 to 13. The first room we were given had defective air conditioning and we made 3 separate requests for service. Only the 3rd person acknowledged that the problem could not be fixed and we were then offered a different room on the upgraded top floor. We arrived at that room only to find it occupied and we were again transfered to a room 1 floor below but not upgraded as promised. In this room we complained that the toilet did not flush properly and the 2 different people who came up said there was no problem. Until, of course our last nite when it flooded the bathroom at midnite. When we complained to the manager on leaving the next morning he promised to investigate and get back to us that evening. He did not. The hallway carpets are dirty and stained. The comforter on our bed was stained. The restaurant was adequate but grossly overpriced even for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views, wonderful location, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HGS3
Reviews.Content: Our family took a side trip to Vancouver on our Seattle vacation. The Sutton Place was wonderful. Our stay at Sutton Place made the side trip to Vancouver perfect. Make sure you bicylce Stanley Park. And choose a room with a high view. The afternoon tea at the Sutton Place is a must. What delicious fun.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected extras delight”
Reviews.Author: breakfromtheroutine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel for a treat. Didnt expect the upgrades and little extras. Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel, or the Wedgewood, where I have stayed several times for pleasure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: keshia89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I made our FIRST trip to British Columbia, and let me tell you the Sutton Hotel in Vancouver surely made it memorable!!!! We were required to put a $300 deposit for our room (we were there for two nights), which is pretty standard regardless of where you go. We checked out on July 2nd at 10am, and had a cleaner check our room over. She then returned to say our room smelt like cigarette smoke, even though we DID NOT smoke in there whatsoever. She told me we would then be charged a $250 fee for smoking in the room. I asked to speak to the manager and the woman at the desk was extremely rude and ignorant to me when I explained to her that it was completely impossible that it could smell like some because a) we never smoked in the room at any point at time and b) the only time we spend in our hotel was to sleep because as I said, this was our first ever trip to BC and we wanted to enjoy it! I was also told by the manager that I would have to forfeit my deposit, leaving me $250.00 short of vacation money. Might I also add that we were not given the option for a smoking or NON smoking room, so I asked both the manager and the woman at the desk if they charged everyone that smoked that $250.00 fee because their rooms smelt like smoke .. he said no. Needless to say, I will never EVER waste my time with that hotel company again. My overall stay was very dissatisfying, not to mention, they will soon be dealing with the BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights to tour the city of Vancouver. The Sutton Place proved to be a perfect option with all the main sights within easy walking distance. I only had limited contact with the staff but found them helpful and friendly. My room was very comfortable, although more 4 star than 5. My only compliant was with the internet, charging for it is one thing - but they charge by device. It's hardly unusual these days for people to have a iphone and a laptop. Here the hotel charges $15/day per device. That's excessive and in my mind a bit greedy. That said said it's easy to find coffee shops offering free wi-fi within a few minutes walk. About from their outdated internet charging structure this is a sound option for central Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, great location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: dancintraveller
Reviews.Content: The title of my review says most of what I want to say. But, here's the rest: We had the unique opportunity to stay in two rooms during our stay. A deluxe room and a suite. The suite was sweet! We're not sure if the hotel is renovating or if the suite is truly a better feel. For the record, we were moved due to a maintenance fix near our first room. The first room's bed was OK - no real complaints; the suite's bed was awesome. First room: old tube TV on a stand; suite - 2 flat panel TVs with sound systems. Turn-down service in the suite; none in deluxe. (BTW - Deluxe room on 15th floor near ice machine.) Also, my husband ordered a celebratory bottle of champagne and 'cake' for my birthday - it was waiting for us when we checked into our room! Nice touches to make it look spectacular! Thank you, Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver!!! We will be back - and we'll book the suite next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pnpadventures
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for 3 nights in mid June for business and the stay was very memorable. Since my flight arrived early, the hotel was able to accommodate for an early check-in and I was given a corner room on the top floor. The view of the Burrard Street was great and the dual windows allowed for a lot of sunlight. The bed was very comfortable - perhaps one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on. The service was great. There was a small incident with a missing projector (no fault of the hotel) and the hotel staff assisted in conducting a thorough search for it. We also booked the conference room for 2 days and when we arrived on the 1st day to find the layout not what we expect, the hotel conference staff was quick to change the room layout to what we require. I would definitely recommend the Sutton Place to friends and will come back for personal trips as well.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly service in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: canncan
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights in this hotel. As everyone has noted, the location can't be beat. It is within walking distance of nearly all of the major sights in Vancouver; it is also surrounded by extensive shopping and numerous good restaurants. Our room (on the 17th floor as we upgraded to "Deluxe" for the view) was of good size with great nearly floor-to-ceiling windows, one of which even opened for fresh air. (Yes, they were hot mopping the roof next door, but we could not smell it, and it only took them 2 days.) We had a king-sized bed (very nice bed linens and a good but not great mattress), nightstand, desk and chair, two wing chairs with a mahogany drum table, six-drawer dresser with flatscreen TV on top plus another small chest which housed the mini frig and coffee pot. The bathroom was large with marble counters, separate (small) shower and bathtub and lots of good quality towels and toiletries. And yes, a scale... a good reminder not to indulge too much! Plus, they provide a hair dryer as well as big terry cloth robes. Now to sound. Remember! You are in the heart of a city, so yes, there are occasional sirens and street noise; the fire department is on the street behind the hotel. But more to the point is the elevator noise. We were 3 rooms away from the 4 elevators and could most definitely hear them; the sound was akin to the roar of a distant jet or roller coaster. We are not light sleepers, so they did not keep us awake. But if you are, you should be sure to ask for a room farther away. I must say I have never been in a hotel where the elevators could be so plainly heard, but not much the mgt. can do about the building's structure, I don't suppose. Service was prompt and friendly. Our room was checked on 3 times a day, twice by the maid and once by the mini bar attendant. The concierges (there are 2) were most helpful with dinner reservations, etc., and the bellhops land doormen were all warm and welcoming as well. Overall, we would rate this hotel as 4, not 5, stars, but we would certainly stay there again... especially if we knew to request a room farther from the elevator shafts.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A PLEASANT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: mcchrystal
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were given the option of having a handicapped accessible rooms. Since I have multiple sclerosis and had had a wonderful experience at the Fairmont in Lake Louise I accepted. The room was inferior with an incredibly hard bed and with the noise from a nearby elevator proved to be awful. The hotel did offer to move us to another room but we had unpacked and were too tired to take them up on their offer. the next morning the room had an incredibly terrible smell of asphalt which the hotel explained to us was due to a roof replacement in another building. They get comp us 40% of the dinner bill but $40 with the remaining bill of $300 left us happy in our decision to leave a day early.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sligeachman
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a central and safe location. Rooms, while a little small, were clean and well appointed. The breakfast (only meals we had there) was very good and the all the staff were pleasant and helpful. Good value for money. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TRieck
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Sutton Place Hotel. The staff service was wonderful and I felt really well treated from the moment the valet opened my taxi door all the way to my room when I had my luggage delivered. The only thing I was disappointed about was housekeeping. They were all very nice but I never felt any extra special from them and with it being listed as a 5 star hotel I was a little disappointed. I would have a glass of wine at night (wine that I bought) and they would take the used glass but not leave a new one, one day I left my towels hanging so I could reuse them (to save water) but when housekeeping came through they just left them hanging not straighting them out, they did not tidy up, so little things like that. I know that sounds picky but at a 5 star I expected more detail. My bed was very comfortable and not low to the ground like another reviewer mentioned. I used room service twice and had their Sutton burger which was excellent. I enjoyed a dirty martini in the bar and thought is was so good I got a second :) I did not have breakfast at the hotel (thought is was too pricey for what you got) and went to the IGA market on the corner and bought things to have in my room. I did not use the pool or workout room so I can not comment. The one thing they should change is charging for their wifi. I do not understand why they charge. I spoke with other people at the conference i was at about where they were staying and all of them were getting free wifi and they were also staying at high-end hotels. In this day and age 2 things a nice hotel should give their guest is free wi-fi and bottled water! Staff was very helpful. I broke my phone charger and they had one I could use throughout my stay, they recommended the Italian restaurant across the street which was excellent. Location was great, right in downtown, walking distance to just about everything. Robson St. shopping right around the corner, convention center a little over a half a mile away. I would recommend this hotel. I was able to get a 2 day trolley pass for the price of one. I recommend this, it is a great way to see the city and get around. I walked A LOT and sometimes it was nice to take a rest and listen about the history of the city. I was there for a conference and spent 2 extra days to play tourist. I will be coming back with my husband and would have no problem staying at the Sutton again.

Reviews.Title: “This is billed as a five star hotel that...”
Reviews.Author: Nahbuh
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a five star hotel that celebs use. It isn't and they don't. The rooms are much more akin to a three/four star, pretty small with a very small bathroom and no separate bath and shower. The decor in the lobby and bar is very decadent but the rest, especially the pool area is in desparate need of a spruce. The location is ideal for exploring vancouver but there must be better hotels than this for the price given the sheer number located within five minutes of the Sutton Place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brent2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sutton Place on numerous occassions and have always had a great experience. The rooms vary, if you have a single queen room, it's nice and comfortable, but seem a little outdated. Their business suites are excellent. Very spacious, well laid out and very comfortable. The apartment suites they also have are top notch as well. The staff are very impressive, everyone from the valet to the concierge are extremely professional and knowledgeable. Having stayed there numerous time, the staff always remembered who you were, greeted me by name, knew my wife and daughter. It was like a home away from home.
