One thing to expect is that parking is roughly 21 dollars a day, so that can add up on someone. It's a very classy hotel, operated in the right way and well worth treating yourself too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye56
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a 2 bedroom suite with pull-out sofa. Comfortable, but cramped kitchen/dining area. Fairly pricey for what we got. Lounge is very nice but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Even Better Location”
Reviews.Author: smithcastel
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Sutton Place post Alaskan cruise - extremely good service (front desk and concierge - restaurant/ jazz club tips) and great location from cruise port to walking around Stanley Park and Granville Island - keep your eyes peeled for celebs in gym, lobby area and lounge, as spotted 48 hrs ago.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem within a Jewelled City”
Reviews.Author: Janet McPherson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights post cruise (14th – 16th May 2010) and were extremely pleased with the cruise company’s choice. We arrived by coach but there is ample below ground car parking. The rooms are elegantly furnished with dark wood with ample wardrobe and drawer space and a king size bed with a really comfortable mattress and top quality bed linen. There is a side table with a radio alarm clock, cordless phone and light; a desk and chair with another phone and a desk lamp with inbuilt computer power points and network jack (with lead); a circular dining table with a lamp and two very comfortable upholstered armchairs (nice not to have to perch on the bed!); a large armoire with three spacious drawers and above, a large TV, DVD player (Region 1) and plenty of literature about the city. There is another cupboard containing the mini bar with another light, coffee/tea making and ice bucket (ice is along the hall), and in the built-in wardrobe there is a free safe, iron and board, plus bathrobes and umbrella for your use. Even the luggage rack is a large padded upholstered stool! The bathroom has a bath and shower, yet another phone, top quality toiletries, soft towels, hair dryer, a large mirror over the wash area and a free standing lit make-up mirror. There is also a set of scales – very handy for weighing your luggage but probably not yourself after a two week cruise! Only criticism is that someone thought it would be a good idea to put a full length mirror on the back of the door right opposite the toilet! The decor and ambience of the whole place are very pleasant and the staff all friendly and attentive. We did not use the main restaurant but had three very good meals in the adjoining Gerard Lounge, excellent and well priced. Three nights a week there is even an all-you-can-eat Chocolate Buffet. Wifi is quite expensive but if you have a laptop there is a Starbucks across the street where you can get wifi with your coffee. There is a very good food market just at the corner of the street and all the major shops including Sears and The Bay are within easy walking distance. The hotel is well situated in downtown Vancouver and if you are on a short visit there is a trolley stop opposite and a hop-on hop-off bus stop just around the corner in Robson Street. At $38 for a 24 hour ticket it is a good way to see as much of the city as possible in a short time - also recommend hopping off for the Harbour Cruise and Stanley Park. All in all we found Vancouver to be a wonderful city with great weather (68 degrees!) and our visit was enhanced by our Sutton Place experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CookieM0nster
Reviews.Content: Please be aware, I stayed here December 2008, so it's not a current view of the hotel. When I stayed here, the hotel was very clean and looks great from the street. I'm more of a 2- 3 star traveller, so felt a little uncomfortable here, mainly my insecurity about wearing very casual clothing, in a hotel that seems to attract fairly wealthy people (or people like me who use hotwire for cheap rates....) The room decor is very old, I guess thats the hotels theme........refined?.... Stayed in a standard room with queen bed, was a fair sized room and bathroom. Restaurant is very nice, but we decided to try eating out. If you can get a good deal, highly recommend. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Refined European luxury, very comfortable and very well kept.”
Reviews.Author: DaveKay40
Reviews.Content: Excellent property, great location. The staff was very accomodating and pleasant. My only isuue is that depending on your room rate you have to pay for Wi-Fi service. In 2010 in a luxury property Wi-Fi should be complimentary for all, this policy should be changed. When I mentioned to the front desk that low end hotel chains offer free Wi-Fi his response was that it's how they attract people to stay with them. Hardly an acceptable or even sensible answer. They will remove the charges from your bill if you ask but it seems like a lot to go through, just offer the free Wi-Fi to begin with and cut out the cat and mouse games. All-in-all, great property and very highly recommended. Would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this spacious and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: EMOESQ
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this hotel. I usually stay in 4star or better, and this did not disappoint. Our suite had two separate bedrooms, two bathrooms, living and dining room, it was like a modern apartment, very homey. Great walking distance to local attractions. Restaurant was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: dancer45
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for 199.00 which for downtown Vancouver is a good deal. Hotels.com, etc. were booking like hotels downtown for 269.00 and up for a weekday stay. Hotwire advertises this hotel as a 5 star but it's really more 4 star with a possible plus. The hotel has a lovely facade, elegant lobby, and 24hr concierge service which is unusual. The service was very good. We were only there for one night so we didn't have a chance to check out the fitness facilities or pool. We had a standard room with a king bed and our window faced a residential street facing the balcony side of several condos but it was very quiet. The bathroom was a pleasant surprise with a free standing tub and separate shower stall with a LOT of counter space. I felt like the amenities were fine (Gilchrist and Soames) and in line with a 4 star hotel. The decor could use a face-lift but really wasn't as bad as I thought it would be having read some of the previous reviews. I will agree however, the bed was old, low to the ground (it almost looks like the box spring is missing!) and hard. In this era of 'pillow menus' etc, even at Hampton Inns, it's strange to just have two standard pillows on the bed. If the bed and bedding had been more plush I would have then said this was a 5 star. The air-conditioning is a bit noisy but my husband likes white noise to sleep so it wasn't really an issue for us. The real reason to stay here is for the location which is Fabulous. Right on the corner of Burard and Robson which has some of the best shopping and restaruants in the area and Gas Town is just a short walk down the hill toward the water. Some reviews complained of being nickled and dimed in regards to valet, etc. Staying at a 4+ hotel involves tipping, taxes, sometimes a 'facility fee' (not here however) and valet parking so just know going in that you're getting a good rate on the room but the hotel stay is still going to cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - Great classic hotel - Central location”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of the decor but the professional & efficient service of the hotel makes up for the lack of personality of the hotel. The rooms tend to be a bit small but very well maintained. The fitness centre needs a major facelift. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: somelo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but would not say it is a 5 star. The staff service is excellent, no doubt. However, the amenities of the rooms are mediocre - the bathrooms are quite dated. You also hear noises through the walls (water/pipes/AC). And the windows are quite thin, preventing us from a good night's sleep as you hear all ambulances and cops, honking through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and upscale”
Reviews.Author: Trevelling_Macs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business. Very comfortable and elegant rooms. Excellent room service and housekeeping. Very knowledgeable staff. One of the few pricey hotels with free Wi-Fi. Can't beat that. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - stay in the Grand Residence Suites”
Reviews.Author: PatrickDevitt
Reviews.Content: This place was a perfect base for us to explore Vancouver. Daughter loved the pool and the staff were super friendly The Grand Residence Suites were idea for us - good size lounge with sofa bed and huge TV, the bed was very comfortable and the kitchen, while a little on the small size, worked well Watch out for their local telephone charges $1,50 Only real critisim is the lack of free wifi - charging $15 per day is excessive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in the heart of vancouver”
Reviews.Author: travellinalbertan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the residence tower for a long weekend and we were really happy with the hotel. Our apartment had a seperate living room from the bedroom and it also had a full kitchen which was great. The beds were super comfortable and we had wonderful sleeps. We also really liked the amenities at the hotel-the pool, steam room and spa. The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Well located but overrated as five star”
Reviews.Author: Pentwater--summerjoy
Reviews.Content: PROS: available on Hotwire well located near city center some nice amenities, including nice pool and views of city scads of doormen and other stand around staff to make you feel important CONS: small rooms with two double beds will try to nickel and dime you to death, even on the exchange rate especially ridiculous is $35/night parking charge but this CAN BE AVOIDED by feeding the meters on side streets during the day and then, after 7 p.m,, moving your car to the two spots RIGHT IN FRONT of the hotel, where parking is free from 10 p.m. to 9 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room for free. luxury hotel, close to shopping/concerts”
Reviews.Author: canadahotstuff
Reviews.Content: hotel staff upgraded our room for free to a suite upon check-in. room was really nice (always is) quiet, nice restaurant for breakfast. within walking distance (10 mins) to all attractions-gm and bc place, one block from shopping on robson st and really close to the orpheum theater.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in an EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: EARWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Hotwire and got it for something like $125 a night, a really good deal. Unlike others who have booked with Hotwire, we had no problems. It was a basic room, no flat screen, but otherwise a standard hotel room that was generally well appointed. The best thing about this hotel is its stellar location. You can walk to just about anywhere in downtown Vancouver and are close to many great restaurants on Robson Street. There are several excellent restaurants right out the back door. Also multiple Starbucks and a supermarket within almost throwing distance (plus Japadog right out front). I would note that I did not use the business center or mini-bar, but the price for internet access at the business center was something like $6 for twenty minutes. A little steep but in my experience par for the course unless you are staying at a lower end property catering to business travel like Homewood Suites or Holiday Inn Express. Anyway, for the money an excellent value and as they say, location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel, central location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Harmiclir
Reviews.Content: Very nicely appointed hotel with comfortable, elegant rooms and quite wonderfully friendly service. Very convenient downtown with close access to public transit and within walking distance to most sights and neighborhoods. Rate was very good for the service provided and the quality of the rooms. Excellent supermarket right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: QuinteGrp
Reviews.Content: Could not have picked a better location in the heart of Vancouver. Check-in was quick and courteous and the suite was well appointed with an excellent view. Weather was unseasonably cool but can't blame the hotel for that. The restaurant was a little pricey but the food and service was excellent. We had a suite on the 12th floor as was a nice size (700 Sq Ft). Definitely one of the more expensive hotels in the area but worth it in my opinion. All of the staff were very helpful with any questions or needs we had. I high recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to be nickled and dimed to death!”
Reviews.Author: world-is-my-osyter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with reservations made through Hot Wire. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff are friendly and courteous. The room was nice, but in our opinion not as highly rated as we were led to believe. Draperies were dirty, furniture was dusty. There was a jumble of electrical cords hanging down behind the desk. Windows and some fixtures were dirty with splatters of paint. No fan in the bathroom! There was a large array of snacks and liqueur offered at an exorbitant price. While there is a coffee pot with complementary tea and coffee, There is no Microwave, so we had to first heat water for my wife's tea, pour it into some cups, then make coffee. by the time she started to drink her second cup of tea, it was cold, but she was out of luck because as I said, no Microwave. Only a very small fridge, crammed to the brim with items for sale. Absolutely no room for anything you may have brought along with you. Some of the "included" amenities were only included at a price. If you want Internet, you'll have to pay, if you want to use the business center, you'll pay there also. At $30 per night, the Valet Parking is the most expensive of any hotel I've stayed at in Vancouver. (Hotwire never informed us of the parking charge) The hotel politely offers self parking, but at the same rate, so you might as well use the Valet's! It seems to me, the hotel gave us an older, dirty, unmaintained room, at a HotWire Price, which makes it not so much of a deal. In summery, there are other hotels in Vancouver that have larger, cleaner rooms, more included amenities and low cost or even Free Parking! Don't get me wrong, We Love Vancouver, and of course we'll be back, but we most likely won't be using Hotwire, or staying at the Sutton Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again and again...”
Reviews.Author: JessicaL7
Reviews.Content: Fabulous views, clean room, great bathtub and bathroom in general, hot water, great and friendly service. Staff was accomidating to my jet lag, being 3 hours ahead of their time and no restaurants open for breakfast at 5 am---staff opened newspaper stand so that I could purchase a muffin and juice--thank goodness because I was starving. Local to all attractions. Give you an umbrella if needed, great parking garage and valet employees. Go 1 block south to grocery store and cinema, short bike ride to beautiful Stanley Park, close to public transportation. Celebrity spotting. Lots of fab shopping, outdoor activities and walking/jogging.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: TrishQ_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton place just before christmas on an extended vacation to Canada and the united states. The hotel staff were fantastic and really helpful, the concierges went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. The hotel was decorated with different christmas trees in the reception and it was beautiful. The Gerard lounge is a great place to relax after sightseeing and shopping, really cosy and welcoming and again, the service is first class. The room was spacious and comfortable and had a kitchen, a must when travelling with a family of 4, and the marketplace supermarket was just across the street. The location was unbeatable, right in the heart of the city and we found that we were able to walk to most places due to the convenient location. We have stayed in many hotels, and this was, by far the best hotel that we have ever stayed in both for the wonderful staff and location, we would thoroughly recommend this hotel, and cant wait to stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - central to everything”
Reviews.Author: bigbaglady
Reviews.Content: Great location - it was pretty convenient to just step outside and be within walking distance to restaurants, stores, etc. If you want something quite central, this is it. The hotel itself was well maintained - clean, spacious rooms, which were serviced daily. The lobby and conference room were pretty nice as well. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating - I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kkl2856
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for almost a week in total over two seperate visits. The hotel is very elegant, clean, and staff were wonderful. After couple days, the bellman recognized us and started to greet us with "welcome home" each time as soon as he opened the taxi door for us! How wonderful is that! The hotel is around the corner from Robson street, with lots of shops and wonderful restaurant to choose from. Vancouver downtown is not very big, you can walk to pretty much everywhere and this hotel is very centally located. Vancouver is our favoirate city and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Sydney85
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver for the 4th time (twice on this trip). This is the best place to stay in Vancouver. It is in an excellent location and there is a really grocery store just across the road. I always stay in Le Grande Residence so I can have the use of a very big apartment. The staff are so good. I will be staying there again on my next trip to Vancouver at the end of the year, in fact I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristtorn
Reviews.Content: Great location combinde with good service! The hotel offers luxury at a nice rate, service is god. Training faccility is quite good, and apparently there is a SPA(not tried).

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Donnieart
Reviews.Content: Booked airfare/hotel deal through Travelocity. The STAFF was friendly and helpful. We were given a King bed with a great view of the city. The ROOM was clean and comfortable. Even though the DECOR wasn't my taste, the room was perfect. The POOL and GYM were clean as well. The CONCIERGE services were helpful but I would recommend doing your own research. JAPA DOG cart was right out front of the hotel! Perfect LOCATION to travel all over Vancouver. We walked almost everywhere but transit was insanely clean and safe. (Most areas we found safe as well so I guess it's up to what you've been exposed to.) All in all if I visit again, I would stay at this hotel. PLACES TO GO: Chambar, Cafe Medina, The Templeton Diner, Six Acres

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: baprice
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is in a prefect location for access to shopping and entertainment districts located in the downtown area. The service was great and the staff was very friendly. The lobby and the building is very well decorated and clean. The room showed the age of the hotel. The shower fixtures were basically falling off of the wall, and it squealed loudly when the water was turned on. Some of the wallpaper was peeling off the bathroom wall and there had obviously been a repair to the plumbing and the wall was not patched back very well. The TV was old and dated. The noise from Burrard St only was a factor when a fire truck went by. (three times) The bed was very comfortable. Although none of these items diminished our stay, there are some expectations that come with staying in a hotel of this caliber. I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but Valet parking wrecked my car”
Reviews.Author: anonymousKelowna
Reviews.Content: Had an opportunity to stay in the hotel which was spectacular, but when I went to check out, my car had been damaged in the 'secure underground parkade'. In talking to both the valet and hotel, neither accepts responsibility for the $700 damage done to my bumper, or had any idea why the licence plate was found a few feet away. I guess the $35 service only gets you so far with Sutton!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: myfavemartin
Reviews.Content: We were here for the holidays and could not have been more pleased with our stay. Our rooms were well-appointed, although one bed was definitely lumpy and old (our toddler didn't mind). The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and the staff was really wonderful. Everyone we encountered was friendly and eager to help. The location is a definite plus -- everything we wanted was just a stone's throw away. It's too bad they charge extra for internet access (both in-room and in the business center), but we got an amazing deal, so it was a fantastic value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, some charme”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for sleek and modern stay away. This is not where you will find it. If, on the other hand, you are fascinated by a little bit of old European charm, this is definitely the right place. Unfortunately, there are signs of aging even though the cleaning and the public premises are impeccable. The room had a lovely view and was comfortable. The bathroom had upscale amenities of a 5 star luxury hotel, including great comfy robes. The bed itself was comfortable but the duvet was not of the kind that is washable (at least that is my impression). It had a big ink stain...and it also was of a material that did not stay on the bed. Plus, I have become accustomed to places that launder the bedding including duvet covers etc--I think they are much more clean. The blanket in the closet was average at best. If you are paying full 5 star price, these are not satisfactory items. At a deep discount, they are fine. We stayed on the hotel side, not the residence side--the service was first class. Breakfast was ok--no buffet, and rather expensive (7CAN Dollars for one glass of juice, 4.50 for a cup of tea and so on!). The good news is that on the same block there are pastry shops, cafes' and everything you need. The pool looked great as did the exercise room. The business centre was laughable--you had to get a card to pay for internet access...please! Travellers should be able to print a boarding pass without that much trouble! Really. The best part of this hotel was the concierge staff--truly first rate...and very very helpful. I would recommend asking them any questions you might have. The location is fantastic--I would highly recommend the hotel for people who want to be in the middle of shopping and activities. A taxi stand right in front makes the place even more convenient--we had a taxi at the door at 5am to go the airport...no need to book ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Tower Apartments Huge, Service a bit spotty”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sutton over Thanksgiving weekend. Friends had rooms in the hotel, while my SO and I shared a "2 bedroom suite" in the tower. The 2 bdrm is a full-size apartment with 2 separate rooms; 1 has a 1/2 bath, and there is a shared full bath. Tons of storage, full kitchen, dining room, balcony, flat screen TV, desk, etc. This is a great deal for sharing couples, friends or family. The decor isn't exactly the W, but that's not the flavor of the Sutton, and we thought the traditional decor suited the place. However, we did have a bit of trouble getting attention from the housekeeping staff. I think the apartments are serviced less attentively than the hotel rooms. Our friends commented how they had people checking on them regularly--we had to call to get replacement coffee service, etc. The location is great, with a market just across the street for stocking the fridge (although we chose to take the water taxi to Granville for yummy snacks!), and there is a lovely wine shop onsite--the kitchen was equipped with everything we needed to store and serve food, coffee and wine. The coffee maker, in fact, was full size, a nice touch. The full bath was stocked with towels and a hair dryer; the front closet had an iron and ironing board, and there were robes, but only 2, which I thought odd--surely they'd let everyone in the room have one? The hotel premises are lovely, although I thought this year's Christmas trees were a bit understated compared to previous years...the economy, perhaps? The bar was a nice cozy place for fireside drinks on a cold winter evening, and the hotel staff that we interacted with were all very professional and helpful. We didn't dine onsite, but I've taken my mother to the Sunday brunch there before, which was quite good. I would recommend this hotel to people who like a quiet, understated place to stay, especially if looking for a large 2 bedroom suite in the heart of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: anirban72
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, off Robson Street, walking distance from the city centre and downtown. Overall nice experience, clean and efficient. The breakfast spread is great, but the place is gloomy, for breakfast. Better hotels available in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime but decent value for downtown location”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at hotel. Rooms are fairly quiet--but Burrard St. noise can be a factor--especially with emergency equipment driving by. The rooms are decorated with traditional finishes, moderate in size and you cannot hear others guests from your room. Large flat screen TV and speakers in room for iPod. Bed and bedding are comfortable. The room is is good shape and clean. Bathrooms had adequate counter space and make-up mirror. Overall the rooms are okay in terms of appearance, wear and tear & lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service/people made the difference”
Reviews.Author: PYtips
Reviews.Content: This is a good standard hotel, where we benefited from an upgrade to a large flat like suite which had 2 bedrooms, a kitchenette and living room + 2 bathrooms, with small balcony to sit on. Good location and facilities, including a pool you can swim in, rather than pose by. What made it for us was the quality of the people - very friendly and knowledgeable. Nothing was too much and everything done with a small. It would have been a safe 4* otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: travelalotWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I had occasion to stay recently and was disappointed for three reasons. The room we were initially given was noisy because of its proximity to the elevator. The front desk insisted it was the wind and only when we insisted did they offer to move us. The bellman they sent up was pushy, unprofessional and clearly only interested in helping us move rooms to receive a tip. Second they charge $15 / day for wireless internet when its free across the street at a corner coffee shop and everywhere else I went in Vancouver. When I discussed this with their business manager he said they charge because they are the only 5 star hotel in Vancouver. The illogic was astounding. Finally in the move between room a valuable document I had was misplaced and they did very little to help me recover it even though I implored their assistance. This is a mediocre hotel at best. I've had better service at a Super 8. Oh ... they have clean rooms and are well located. Just don't expect much service.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: clara50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place for 3 nights when attending a conference at the nearby Sheraton Walll Center. This is a really god otion to stay the Hotel is a 5 star but you paid a reasonable price and it deserves all the money you spend: confortable and cosy rooms, high standards of quality in service. Excelent location in downtown Vancouver with all nice spots around. Try the Crocodile a french restaurant just beside the Hotel and the Market Place to buy fruit and yogur for breakfast or for a light meal. Excelent option!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value downtown Vancouver, especially for families”
Reviews.Author: MontrealMichelle13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sutton Place residence for 4 days and really enjoyed it, although I would not give it 5 stars but 4 1/2. The people at the reception were very nice, even if we reserved on Hotwire (and got a great deal). The location is perfect, at the corner of Robson with stores and restaurants open late. We had a one bedroom apartment and the size was just perfect for 3 people. We had a kitchen with a fridge, a microwave, a range, a toaster, a coffee machine, and a dishwashing machine. Plus dishes, glasses, pots and pan, coffee, dishwashing liquid... The only thing missing is the food and there's a grocery store (IGA) on the other side of the street! We only used the kitchen for breakfast but you could cook entire meals if you wished to. There is a table with 4 chairs in one corner of the living room plus a sofa bed and a big chair and a HUGE flat screen TV and a DVD player, plus a desk. The bedroom also has a (small) flatscreen TV and a DVD player. We had a complimentary newspaper every morning and the housekeepers were very nice, even starting the dishwasher when most of the dished were soiled. I only have a few negative comments: The (King) bed was not very confortable, the temperature at the pool and in the corridors was very cold and access to Internet is expensive . Speaking of Internet, make sure that your antivirus is up to date as there was almost 900 intruder attempts when we were connected to the hotel network... I would go back to the Sutton Place without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Lumpy mattress.”
Reviews.Author: bigdog1008
Reviews.Content: This hotels location is fantastic for seeing shows or shopping in Vancouver. The service was excellent and friendly. Hotel room was very clean and offered a great view of the city. However the mattress was about the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on. I expect a high quality bed and bedding when staying in a 5 star hotel, (even the Raddison has sleep number beds) As with other reviews I agree that this was a bit of a stretch on the 5 star rating. If the bed was better I would not hesitate to rate it a high 4. Parking is very expensive but parking anywhere in downtown Vancouver is. Would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “great stay - great day”
Reviews.Author: kellyclayt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place for one day following an Alaskan cruise. We had never been in Vancouver before and were excited to spend a day in the city. Sutton Place came highly recommended and did not disappoint. We took a taxi over very early in the morning and were greeted warmly. They took our luggage, provided us with maps and recommendations for the day, and told us that our room would be ready early afternoon. We bought a day pass on one of the hop-on-hop-off busses and took off. After spending a few hours at Granville Island and then lunch in Stanley Park we went back to our lovely, comfortable room for a late afternoon nap before dinner. After a refreshing nap, we simply walked out from our hotel and found a fun, trendy restaurant for dinner - Cactus Club Cafe - within walking distance. The room was not overly large but lovely and very comfortable. What really set the place apart was the exquisite level of service. Every single employee we dealt with went above and beyond our expectations in not only meeting our needs, but doing so in a friendly, helpful, professional way. Taxi's were readily available when we, sadly, had to leave for a 6 a.m. flight the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location..........but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: ILUV2TRAVEL007
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed one night at this Hotel. We chose this hotel based on the location. The room looks like it needs to be updated. We will probably try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: kinsela
Reviews.Content: The lobby was fancy, but the hallways and the rooms had a Vegas feel to it. The hotel is a little dated but still had all the amenities you can imagine. Doesn't quite measure up to a 5 star but definitely in the 4's. Be aware that daily parking is CDN $30 per day. Ouch. There is a market across the street to the right of the hotel so very convenient. And a Japadog stand on the corner. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, from the valet, to the doorman and conceirge. Also the hotel tends to attract the more older adult guests, so you won't see a lot of young backpacker types. The older guests tend to dress better either in suits or dinner jackets or evening gowns so being in jeans and a t-shirt, we felt quite under dressed most of the time. We got a great rate through hotwire and was placed on the 11th floor and we never felt like we were looked down upon for being a hotwire customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: caycay_can
Reviews.Content: Couldn't say enough about this hotel - fantastic rooms and great service. As a solo business traveller, they made sure I was well accomodated, from the complimentary borrowed umbrella to the paper at breakfast in the morning. I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, not just for the price!”
Reviews.Author: serenitytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Residence hotel in August of 2009. After reading some of the reviews we weren't sure what to expect. However, much to our surprise it was lovely. The room was as it looked on-line, the one bedroom with the balcony was perfect for my husband and I for a week. It is not a huge one bedroom condo but certainly much nicer than a hotel room. The location is perfect and the staff are wonderful (even the gym is pretty nice)! we would stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TahoeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Sutton Place Hotel in downtown Vancouver prior to an Alaskan cruise. This is a 5 Diamond (AAA) rated hotel that we reserved through Priceline at $130 per night including all taxes and fees. Several people on our cruise who contribute to online message boards had recommended this hotel and we were very pleased with the room, service, and price. The hotel is located a half block from Robson Street, the main shopping street in downtown Vancouver. We asked at the front desk if there was a Thai restaurant nearby and were told that there is one right across the street from the hotel. We had a very pleasant dinner at this place. The next day, we took a cab to the Ballantyne Pier. The cost was about $15.00 American including tip.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a car be ready to pay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BillHadley
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay at this hotel through Expedia. The hotel is clean neat and well run. What we were not told when we booked either by Expedia or the hotel was they charged us an extra $30.00 per night to park our car! It's one thing to have a parking charge, it's another not to disclose it UP FRONT. This reservation was prepaid a couple months in advance in full, then they stuck us for $30.00 a night when we arrived. As far as I'm concerned, these parking charges and add ons by many high end hotels are nothing more than a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my daughter's honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: pantoleonk
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation by phone for my daughter's wedding night. We live just across the border in Washington State. I was faxed a form which I filled out and faxed back to the hotel. My daughter and her husband were checked in as if everything was fine. Then when they went to check out the following day, they were told they could not leave and were held by the security staff and "treated like garbage". Why? Because the hotel decided they needed a copy of the front and back of the charge card I used to make the reservation plus a copy of my picture ID! Nothing about needing this was mentioned when the reservation was made, and nothing was said when the couple checked in. Honestly, how long does it take to run a charge card to see if it is good? And how long could it possibly take to confirm the reservation by phone? Why not do this before the honeymooning couple goes to check out? My daughter insisted they call and speak with me to see that everything was legit. When the hotel reached me at work, the manager demanded the same set of copies, which I was unable to produce on the spot. The hotel had been told this was a couple on their honeymoon. They were not treated with courtesy and asked politely to wait until the charge could be confirmed. They were treated like criminals.

Reviews.Title: “Another instance of erroneous charge for minibar”
Reviews.Author: mongocaver
Reviews.Content: We should have listened to the others that had problems with the Sutton Place charging for something we didn't use...We stayed one night at the Sutton Place and had no problems with our stay, but the next morning the desk clerk would not give us a final bill. Sure enough when our credit card statment came, there was a 13.47 charge.We contacted the Sutton Place and were told that it was from minibar usage. We never touched the minibar. We have pictures with time and date on them, showing a full minibar, but the Sutton Place still wouldn't take the charge off. We should have listened to the others that had problems with the Sutton Place charging for something we didn't use...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: maidenvoyager
Reviews.Content: We were on honeymoon and staying in another hotel in Vancouver, which turned out to be awful. We called the Sutton Place at short notice as we wanted to move, and they were very accommodating. We took a suite, which had a balcony with a great view out to the bay. The room was very spacious, with a living and dining area, separate kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. There was a large television and it was very comfortable. One evening we took room service and watched a film on the couch, and it really was a home away from home. The kitchen was fairly well equipped, and you could have cooked a meal with ease. The bathroom was large and very clean, and the bedroom was peaceful and the bed was very comfortable. One evening we went for drinks in the Gerard Lounge, and decided to stay in there for dinner. It was so cosy in there, with a real fire crackling away. It was fairly busy, but the staff were still attentive and the food was excellent, as were the cocktails. The location is great, as you are not too far from the waterfront, and also you have everything on your doorstep. We were able to walk to most places that we wanted to see. We will definitely return to the Sutton Place when we are back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not sure what makes it 5*”
Reviews.Author: BalSingh
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place in Vancouver is an excellent hotel with all the facilites you expect. Decent rooms (though a bit dated in decor), comfortable and good service. The rooms had a safe, minibar, flat TV etc. However, I cant understand what makes this a 5*. To me it had the same sort of facilites as mosyt of the 4* hotels I have visited. The location is excellent. Perfect for great restaurants and shops. Also a good place to start a nice downtown sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Treated rudely”
Reviews.Author: Yellowrose52
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire for pre-cruise night. Honeymoon for son. Called the hotel direct(twice) and told them it was his honeymoon and was assured that this had been notated and that a kingsized bed would be reserved. Upon their arrival, they were treated rudely and told that there would be a large upgrade fee if they did not want a room with two single beds. He paid the fee and they got a very standard room, not at all what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Breakfast the next morning was expensive and not enjoyed. The post-cruise night was booked through Hotwire also. It was a 4 star, the Metropolitan, and everything about it was much nicer than Sutton Place. The room with a kingsized be was very nice and the people were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel September 7 & 8, 2009 for a pre-cruise visit to Vancouver, B.C. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, just a couple blocks from Robson St. and you can easily walk down to Canada Place and back. The Thai restaurant across the street was very good as well. The restaurant in the hotel itself served an excellent breakfast with attentive and friendly service. We used the Vancouver Trolley Company "Hop On Hop Off" Trolley which we found expensive and not very accesable. You would wait at the Trolley stop and when it arrived it would be full so you had to wait another 15-20 minutes hoping that the next trolley had room. This wasted a lot of time. A taxi to Stanley Park and/or Grandville Island would have been faster. The Sutton Place however, is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: Hazley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver. We actually had an excellent experience. We booked through the hotel's website and selected an Executive Suite, rather than the regular room, as the price difference was negligible. The suite consisted of 2 rooms, with the bedroom separated from the main area. Each room featured an enormous flatscreen TV, and nice appointments. The bathroom had lots of room, a separate tub and shower. We were there to meet with friends attending a conference at the hotel. They were staying in the Residence side, in a two bedroom unit. They found that our room was actually nicer than theirs. They had stayed previously at the hotel in a regular room, and pronounced ours to be a substantial step upwards. The location of the hotel is ideal, we were able to walk anywhere in the downtown area with little effort. We had breakfast there as well, and it was the typical hotel buffet, not bad, though fairly expensive for what we got. The service from the desk and concierge was very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel, provided you can get an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant decor and good service”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night having taken a gamble with Hotwire. I could not have been happier with the outcome. I had a nice room on the 20th floor with a king sized bed and flat screen TV. The bath wasn't very comfortable as it has a vertical back. Bathroom amenities were by Gilcrest and Soames and were all packaged in sensible bottles with wide brims- not the usual hotel offerings where you have to squeeze for ages to get out a small blob and so much is wasted. There were also bath bombs and salts on offer for sale. Check in was efficient and courteous- no mention of the fact that I was paying a low rate. I stayed in five different hotels that week and the Sutton Place was the only which offered turn down service (and the chamber maid was very friendly as well). It was also the only one which did not offer free internet but I didn't really mind paying the access fee. If I had paid the rack rate I would probably have felt differently. I didn't try out any of the restaurants or the spa which is located on the mezzanine floor of the residence block so a bit of a trek for hotel guests. The decor is elegant. I am told that the hotel is a bit of a haunt for celebrities but the clientele was more cruise ship during my visit. The location near Robson Street is great and there is a supermarket across the road from the hotel. It was a nice conclusion to my BC trip and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rockytoo2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sutton Place "post cruise". We arrived very early in the morning and were greeted by a friendly doorman and equally friendly and gracious reception clerk...who had no trouble locating our reservation (also via Hotwire). We did not experience any degradation in service or attitude due to the nature of our reservation. The reception clerk was friendly, knowlegeable, and did her best to accomodate our early arrival. We left for a day-long self-tour of Vancouver and returned mid-afternoon to find our room ready and our luggage in our room. I found the decor to be clean, pleasing, and soothing (maybe because I like beige, brown and maroon tones!) I used the business center and found it well equipped and reasonable (though not free). The area surrounding the hotel was very pleasant to walk around and there were many restaurant options. I read many reviews deriding the "$300 rack rate" and how this hotel was not a $300-a-night hotel---yet none of those reviewers paid $300. I felt very pleased with the service, decor, amenities and ambiance--for what I paid. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster123
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place is in a great convenient location and has the charm of a European hotel. The service was friendly, and all of our needs were attended to in an efficient manner, whether if it was express pressing at midnight or otherwise. During our stay, the valet dented the bumper of our rental car one night and they switched the car for us very efficiently, and assumed the damages. I liked how they reacted quickly to this matter. I cant stress the benefit of the location-- just two blocks from Robson, and a Japadog hot dog stand outside of the hotel which is delicious. You have a great supermarket and a movie theater across the street from the hotel as well. The rooms, while comfortable and clean, are on the older side. We switched to a suite midway through, which seemed to have a bit of wear and tear as well. The lighting in the bathroom definitely leaves much to be desired. The premium rooms, which are supposed to be a higher category, are just alittle bigger than a regular room, but not much different. Note that early check in is hardly accomodated so arrive after check in time if possible.

Reviews.Title: “They may advertise on Hotwire BUT...”
Reviews.Author: TrulyCanadian786
Reviews.Content: We live in vancouver and decided to do a weekend getaway in our own city for Labour Day. We also HAD the intention of having a reception party here. We thought this would be a great way for us to have a mini vacay, while checking out the hotel for our reception. I definitely have seconds thoughts. As soon as we checked the lady at the front desk pulled up our reservation and in a condescending tone said "oh, this is a hotwire reservation", she then proceed to refer to our reservation as the "lowest" type. It wasn't until we brought it to her attention that she realized she was being offensive. If you considered a hotwire reservation low-rate then why does your company advertise there? The room costed $175 on hotwire but when I checked the sutton place rate it was not much different,...but the initial service we received was terrible. What is it with front desk staff having a chip on their shoulder?...I highly doubt any of them would book a suite for the Hotwire rate and much less the rack rate. Sutton Place- I would not go again. And I will be checking out Hotel Van and Pan Pacific for the reception. In addition, the hotel needs a re-vamp especially if they want to call themselves a 5 star. The decor is very 90s...beige and brown walls. I'd say this hotel is worth $150/night only because of the condo style - full kitchen. Tiny Pool!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service Sets it Apart”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure why this is a five star hotel, versus some of the other good hotels in Vancouver, unless it is the friendly service. From the valet's greeting to a cheerful desk clerk who gave us a very early check in to the helpful concierge, everyone was happy to help out. The room was very clean, quiet and well appointed. The wifi (not free) worked well in the room and in the business center. The hotel is a bit farther from the waterfront than we expected. For the price we paid through Hotwire, this was a very good bargain. It goes on the "recommend" list. Oh, and don't pass up the bakery on the ground floor. Killer sweets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but cramped and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Bellinghammers
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place sits at a great spot on Burrard, a block off Robson, with nice amenities nearby. But unless you can get a significant discount, I wouldn't recommend it. Rack rate at my stay was more than 300 a night; got it discounted at 173 online. But at this hotel, like many others in downtown Van, you can add to that as much as 75 bucks in other fees (taxes, plus $30 a day for parking, plus $16 a day for very unreliable wi-fi access.) Rooms are pleasant and clean, but very cramped, and the entire hotel, with its tiny lobby, feels a bit claustrophobic. Pleasant staff was very helpful with early check-in and bag stowage. But overall, given the normal rates here, I wouldn't recommend the hotel. For 300 a night, you expect, and can get, much more in Vancouver. Note: When I lodged a complaint about the pricey wifi access and other costs, and told the front-desk person they would make me strongly wary about staying here again, she smiled and said: "That's OK!" Interesting customer-service philosophy there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Triper_07
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights (of the 4 planned) in the La Grande Residence Tower. It was after our first contact with the canadian society through the rude and incompetent staff of Air Canada in Toronto Airport which lead to miss our connecting flight on the 10th August. An inconceivable behavior with each person of the seven I asked telling us a different thing to do. And which, except a few exceptions, accompanied us during all the flights we unfortunately had booked with such an airline (never again). At Sutton Place we loved the apartment. It was very confortable with a big living room and a kitchen very well equipped. The location of the hotel is perfect, with a supermarket across the street and it is possible to get everywhere one wants very easily. The apartment was confortable with a balcony. The rooms are really spacious. The only two small drawback are that the heating and AC system is quite old and noisy and that internet access is too expensive (more than 14 C$ a day). But I would highly recommend Sutton Place in Vancouver at the price we enjoy it (around 230 C$ per night). We were, and still are, especially impressed by the reservation staff of Sutton who helped us friendly and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: indiestace
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five days/four nights at the Sutton Place in Vancouver with a girlfriend. We live in Northern CA & made the choice to drive, so the one big caveat to this hotel was having to pay $30 daily to park! It's located downtown, though, so a lot of times you can just leave your car & take a cab or walk where you want to go. Otherwise, it's nice to have your car, and the cost for self-park is the same as valet, so you might as well have them park it for you - their service is FANTASTIC, especially Matt. The valets, doormen, front desk clerks, and concierges ALL were absolutely wonderful. We couldn't have asked for a single thing more than what we received - perfect service in every aspect, a beautiful, clean, safe & quiet hotel in a great location - we'll be back! Future travelers need tips? Obviously, Robson is right around the corner for shopping & people watching. My biggest recommendations for food are Cactus Club Cafe (one right on Robson, one on Burrard, too), the Thai place right across from the hotel, and the Winking Judge (next door to the Thai place) - great beer and GREAT burgers! One last tip? Skip the hotel bar unless you're over 50. A hotspot it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay! Old World Service!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergoalie
Reviews.Content: I've travelled through Europe and Asia, and this is one of the best if not THE best! I lived in Vancouver my whole life, and never appreciated this place until I came home for a visit. I stayed here for a week, and I found the service the BEST in the world. Other places, I find the service is phony as they expect a big tip or can be fired (like in Asia). But here, the service staff seemed geniunely pleased to help us. I always travel with my two kids, wife, and nanny. So we need lots of help. The service staff was awesome! It is a 5 star in every sense of the word! If you're going to stay in a pricey hotel, indulge yourself with the Sutton! It's right in the heart of d/t and Robson Street is one blk over. Theatres, etc galore are down below, so you can't get a better place!! The only knock is that it's more Victorian looking than was I like. I prefer something more comtemporary. but they still had flat screen LCDs in my room. Note: if it wasn't for the company paying for my stay, I couldn't afford to stay here ;)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT APARTMENTS”
Reviews.Author: YasminaJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place for three nights prior to an Alaska cruise and loved it. The apartments are newly renovated and have lovely modern finishes with a balcony. The rooms are spacious with a TV in the main bedroom also. The only small drawback is that a two-bedroomed has only one full bathroom. The main bedroom has only a basin and toilet. The kitchens are new and hardly used. Shopping heaven as Robson Street is just a stone's throw away! I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay, worth it if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: johnnietravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights during August Long Weekend. My room was a basic 'sutton room'.. while a bit dated it was very comfortable, and quiet. The pool while a bit of a maze to get to, is very nice.. Staff at this property are very professional and helpful. I know at one time this place was 5 Star, I think it still deserves it's current 4 star rating. The location is wonderful near so many attractions.. I look forward to another stay here in September...

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Sinful60
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel needs regroup itself with its employees...I also think it needs to settle that its only a three star hotel not a five star and not even close to a four star. The proximity to the center is very good but that is all it has going for itself. When I saw a bit of mold in my tub, nobody came to take care of it. My sheets were dirty when I arrived had food or something on them, nobody came. I wanted to leave and they did not even care about what i told them about the mold about my sheets..I paid for my room and went to a three star that was like a 6 star..now go figure. I am sure with alot of bad reviews somebody has got to star noticing how sloppy they are getting.. VERY BAD

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place from which to explore Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: GerryMal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights having driven through the Rockies to Vancouver. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which was very well equipped with a sofa bed in the living room which was very comfortable and allowed the 2 children their own space at night. the kitchen in the apartment was well equipped and there are supermarkets nearby. This allowed us to cater for ourselves for breakfast. The locastion is very central being on Burrard Street and it is possible to get everywhere one wants to - Stanley Park, Gas town , chinatown etc - very easily indeed. all the shops on Robson are 2 minutes away. this was a perfect set up for us and despite being in an apartment not the main hotel we had full use of all the hotel's facilities - gym, swimming pool, laundry etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Room was Wonderful...Service Perfect”
Reviews.Author: knotenuftime
Reviews.Content: We had a suite with 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchen, and 1.5 baths. The room was wonderful. Our room was always made up promptly. We were just a block away from Robson St. and just a couple of blocks away from the Vancouver Art Gallery. The food in Vancouver was amazing. We ate at CinCin...delicious Italian, but the most innovative and fun was Salt Tasting Room. As the guide books say, don't be put off by the location. It was a culinary delight!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: perryb6
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading reviews here and Amex fine hotels and resorts .Check in went very well ,great staff .The hotel had recommended a 1 bedroom deluxe residence . We went to our room .Talk about tired looking .The room smelt of cigarette smoke .The bathroom is one of the smallest we had ever seen .Everything looked cheap and was no way a 4 star Hotel .The toilet backed up ,The sink faucet handle came off in my hand .The Air conditioner unit is on the deck and is very noisy .The elevators were not working well and I had to walk up to my 10th floor room .The exercise room is good but it is hard to get to equipment as they are so close together .We checked out the following day and moved to the Shangri La .The staff are excellent and understood why we were leaving .They could have charged us a 1 night penalty but they did not .True professionals .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pharvey47
Reviews.Content: Mixed review for The Sutton Place. The location is excellent, and the staff were friendly and professional. As others have commented on, the rooms look dated and are definitely in need of a facelift. Unfortunately, the bed was sheer torture to sleep in. I could feel the coils when I ran my hands over the mattress, and at night, every single one of them dug into my body. The first morning I could barely move--after an hour of popping pain killers and moving around slowly I was actually able to walk again. The 2nd night I took painkillers before I went to bed and was sore in the morning, but the pain was manageable. The linens were not the quality I have come to expect from a 5 star hotel--the sheets were rough and the duvet didn't seem to sit properly on the bed. The hotel literature boasted soft feathery pillows, however, our pillows felt like they were filled with sawdust. We generally stay at Westin's and are used to the "Heavenly Bed" treatment at night. Bottom line--great location, nice staff, but if you need need a good night's sleep you just won't be happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancisLHouston
Reviews.Content: Sutton is a gorgeous hotel. The service is without reproach. People are very kind. The location is excellent. The best hotel of our holidays in BC. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Mum you booked a really nice hotel - for a change!”
Reviews.Author: HB1964
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, wonderful staff. The lady in the bar is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MABorntotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sutton Place for one week while visiting Vancouver. The hotel's staff is very pleasant , polite, and helpful. The hotel is very clean and in a great location. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. There are also many great shops as Robson St. is about 1/2 a block from the hotel. There is also an IGA grocery store right next door. We went there every morning and picked up a freshly backed pastry. There is a Starbucks across the street, but we went there the first morning and the pastries were not only stale, but they appeared to be thawed out. One thing that would be great would be a fridge in the room. We bought a small cooler but it leaked all over the place. If your travel plans bring you to Vancouver in the near future I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing given its official rating”
Reviews.Author: MBR075
Reviews.Content: The hotel would like to give the impression that it is a high-class hotel, but seems to have higher ambitions than they can fulfill - a more modest self-image would be more adequate. On the positive side, good location and good deals can be found online. But don't expect too much. The rooms and facilities seemes somewhat worn down, the service was not impressive, and the cost of parking was too high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - expensive breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Riddo
Reviews.Content: The Sutton place is a great base for visiting Vancouver,the room was comfy and the service was good - the Concierge was extremely helpful and polite, with a brilliant "can do" attitude. We were disappointed with the breakfast, we thought it was expensive and limited, we went out to a diner on Hornby st. on the last day - much better value! The pool was disappointing, overrun with kids, very cold, and the spa was out of order!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FWPGMB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything one could wish for on a vacation. The location is perfect - half a block from Robson Street, three blocks from the Art Gallery, five to the Pacific Centre, and the nightlife of Granville is only a couple of streets over. The staff at the hotel are knowledgable, accomodating (our flight got in early in the am and they did not make us wait for our check-in time), and friendly (definitely five-star service). Our room had a gorgeous view of the Vancouver skyline and was very quiet, clean and comfortable. After a long day of sightseeing, this was a great place to go home to. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a hassle-free vacation as the staff here go out of their way to ensure that your stay is as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great People”
Reviews.Author: GalFromWyoming
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights before our Alaska cruise. We got a great rate on Hotwire, but we were treated the same as those who paid 3 times as much as we did. Every staff member we came in contact with was very helpful, and they always spoke when they saw you. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: lashjack
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to a cruise and stayed for 2 nghts. We chose this hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews and booked far in advance, opting to pay more for this property than was available closeby. The location is great; walking distance to shopping, etc. We were originally booked in the Residences with a kitchen. Not 5 star, but nicely appointed. When we got there, we were told that the electric and airconditioning was to be turned off at 9am on the next day in the Grand residences to fix a problem; They had known about this for a while, but chose not to notify guests until they checked in and had been charged the non cancellable first night fee. I was astounded that the hotel thought that it was acceptable and not a big deal because, we were checking out and it was only a 3 hour inconvenience. on a work day. After having to get the general manager on the phone, they agreed to move us to a suite in the hotel part of the property, but we lost the kitchen facilities and the groceries that I had bought. I heard other guests grumble as well. They got the same attitude from the front desk staff. The concierge sent us the wrong direction twice to find restaurants even though we repeated back his directions to him. Also, if you book directly with the hotel, check the hotel's web site at least weekly; the prices kept changing; you could rebook directly with the hotel and save a quite a bit. Should you stay here? If you get it at the right price; just remember you may have to go the extra steps to get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: dpenta
Reviews.Content: After a middling stay at another hotel in town, were looking forward to a "real" hotel. The Sutton Place hotel is full-service; while our stay was not perfect (nothing ever is in life), the professional staff helped make our stay really great. The front desk staff and bell staff were great at check-in; the housekeeping staff quickly brought extra towels and found a rollaway bed late at night. Great recommendations from Miguel the concierge who was just fantastic. Rooms are very comfortable albeit not to my personal taste, and could use a refurbish. Furniture is vaguely French Provincial and colors are pleasing; beds were very comfortable as were the bathrobes. Bathroom was clean with lots of marble and a good selection of Gilchrist & Soames toiletries. Nice pool, sundeck, and changing rooms with steam room. The fitness center had a very complete range of equipment. All in all I would definitely come back here just for the level of service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown option”
Reviews.Author: flex_nc
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here for three nights thanks to Hotwire. It was perfectly nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Great location. We were glad we didn't pay full price though; if you're looking for super luxury or a very special experience I don't think this is the right place. If you can get a room at a good price, it's a very good choice and I'd recommend it. Vancouver is a fabulous city and this made a great base for exploring. Parking is expensive but probably comparable to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: Whitehorsecombat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in 2006... Took this long to organize my feelings for this hotel. Simply... Concierge was useless - directed us to wrong locations two different occasions. View of back ally overlooking half filled dumpster did nothing for my romantic life. Rooms needed sever upgrading. Not sound proofed at all either from hallway or street. Pass on this one - highly overrated. Met Barry Bostwick (Spin City / Rocky Horror) in elevator - that was the only interesting thing about this place… should have asked him why he chose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nevertoolate75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our trip to Canada and were not disappointed. The location is great,right in the middle of downtown and as Vancouver is a relatively small city it was great for walking around or handy for getting buses if you are tired or its raining (again!). When we booked this hotel, we were surprised at how expensive hotels in this city are and how there doesnt seem to be many budget options. This hotel was much cheaper than others so I was afraid it would be a bit of a dive but in fact it was the opposite. This is a beautiful and elegant hotel, our bedroom was extremely spacious,well maintained and beautifully decorated. I loved the fact that it was in the middle of the city but that noise wasnt an issue. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - hard to fault - even Elton John was staying!!”
Reviews.Author: ENGLANDMAN13
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the rather plain exterior - the staff and the rooms more than make up for it. The Bell Boy could not have done more for us and the suite of rooms were really brilliant for my family of 5. We had our own kitchenette so we didnt have to eat in but there is a really great supermarket right next door. We simply couldnt fault the hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not the first time and not the last.”
Reviews.Author: Trustingtraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sutton on a few times over the past number of years. We made our reservations through Hotwire but don't know if we got any better deal than dealing directly with the hotel. As we were in Vancouver for a week we had one of thier 1 bedroom apartments, furnished with kitchen and all the equipment necessary. There is an IGA nextdoor to the hotel that made shopping for meals quick. The hotel is in an excellent location in the center of the down town so walking is easy. The hotel is tha only 5 star in Cancouver that I know about and lives up to its rating.

Reviews.Title: “Location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMovingman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights following a cruise and can agree with most other reviews. Its location is perfect for shops/bar/restaurants - great pub opposite -The Winking Judge. Robson Street just around the corner - not too far to walk even down to the waterfront but it's uphill coming back. My only gripe was the buffet breakfast which we tried one morning - $23 each I seem to recall and not worth it when you consider what's available within 100 yards. We stayed in Le Grand Residence in an enormous luxury suite on the 16th floor - seating for 8 round the dining table - even had a balcony. Some folk might be disturbed by the sirens - the hotel is close to the hospital and fire station - but they didn't bother us. Very helpful on reception etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, gracious service...”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelnow
Reviews.Content: When the hotel we wanted was booked for our dates, we booked the Sutton Place through Hotwire for a very resonable price. The bell staff came right out on to the street to collect our luggage when our shuttle from Whistler stopped there. Quick check in. Our bags delivered immediately by a helpful and informative houseman. The decor was traditional but light. Every space we encountered including our room was fresh, clean and comfortable. Wonderful view. Good mini bar. The pool was rather awkwardly located through some weird convoluted maze of stairwells. Otherwise, the gift store, coffee stand were handy. Nice bar. Overall very nice,no real negatives, but not a five star. The best part was -the location in the heart of everything you want to do, see, eat , drink in downtown Vancouver -gracious and unobtrusive service.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, smart, and very convenient if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: kakapo
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastic rate online, so at this rate was not surprised to be given an older (ie not yet renovated) room with a view of the rear laneway. HOWEVER the room was surprisingly large and still luxuriously appointed. Most important for me, it was QUIET - I was not disturbed by noise from inside or outside the hotel at any time during my three night stay. Late checkout (noon) a bonus and blackout curtains allowed a nice sleep in. The bed was wonderful and room temperature could be adjusted for perfect comfort. Quality toiletries were provided, plus fluffy big towells and a well-stocked minibar. The bathroom was slightly tired but still clean and overall the room was very pleasant and definitely worth more than I paid for my stay. The checkin staff were friendly and efficient and despite arriving with a backpack I was treated with genuine respect and felt welcome. Location is perfect for Robson street shops, and there are plenty of nearby dining options. Short stroll to Canada Place (Visitor information centre and cruise terminal) and easy walk to public transport to Kitsilano, Stanley Park and Metrotown Mall. I will certainly stay here again if I can get a comparable rate in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: travelling_pandas
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Sutton Place at the beginning of our honeymoon for three nights in vancouver. We arrived after a longhaul flight from Scotland and found the staff very welcoming and friendly. The bell staff saw us struggling across the forecourt with our luggage and they immediately came over to help take our luggage. Our room was an adequate size with a large king size bed, desk, small table and chairs, drawers, cupboard and bathroom. We had a quiet room with a good view of downtown vancouver. The hotel itself is ideally located in the centre of the city with several good cafes, restaurants and shops neearby. There is a food store across the road from the hotel which has a wonderful selection of fresh breads, cakes and fruit. The main shopping street is around the corner as are bus/train links. Breakfast was first class and it had the largest breakfast menu we've ever seen! We had food in the bar one night and enjoyed a burger and a pizza. Over all I would say this is a very good hotel for tourists wishing to see the sights of vancouver as its location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great for a family / young kids”
Reviews.Author: sydsfmum
Reviews.Content: Came to Vancouver to get my US Visa renewed and was so delighted with the accommodation we chose - Grande Residence at Sutton Place. Location is terrific - very central to everything - shops, grocery store, restaurants , and easy to get to attractions such as Granville island ferries and Stanley Park oh and the US embassy ;) The Grande Residence room we booked has been terrific - spacious rooms, large bathroom, a small but perfectly fitted out kitchen (full oven, microwave, large fridge, dishwasher). Staff have been over and above helpful and friendly - and great with my 3.5 yr old son. I definitely recommend it. TIPS for anyone going to the US embassy : take NOTHING with you .. ie: no handbag, no phone, no food/ drink .. anything. The security is strict and we were sent back to the hotel to leave all our belongings as their are no lockers or places you can leave items such as phone while you are waiting for your appointment.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelerGirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay but were a bit disappointed. The rooms were becoming worn and dated. The lobby area was beautiful and staff extremely helpful. The hotel appeared to cater to the incoming cruise ship customers. The location, however, makes up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent food, lovely weather”
Reviews.Author: psychobeef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton towards the end of our holiday and only had two days in Vancouver, so the location of the hotel was perfect. We ate in the restaurant on our first night - expensive but delicious - and the service was impeccable, both there and in the bar. Our room, on the 7th floor, was adequate (nothing special) and the bed comfortable, which just about made up for the less-than-inspiring view! Another bugbear was the cost of parking ($30 per night - gulp!) as we weren't actually told how much it would be until we checked out. The Sutton has a very attractive lobby area with checking in/out quick and efficient, and the staff with whom we had contact were warm and friendly. On balance, I think we would stay here again, although definitely not at the full price, and we were grateful not to need the umbrella provided - the weather was glorious!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: BigTex_9
Reviews.Content: Great location one block from most downtown dining and shopping. Lovely common areas and rooms. Very nice restaraunt and health club. Modern French style decor. Great service and well staffed. Seems very popular with high end business travelers. The package including breakfast and parking is a good value, as breakfast runs $10-25/person and parking is $36/day valet.

Reviews.Title: “Looks alright from the outside, worn on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: When the immigration officer at the airport asked me where I was staying and I told him the Sutton Place Hotel, he seemed impressed. So I thought this would be a very nice hotel. When we arrived by taxi ($25 ride), the building looked plain. The lobby was nice and the staff seemed professional enough. But the room looked tired. There were dents and markings all over the furniture. This was obviously an upscale hotel that is now discounted because it needs a renovation. The furnishings were maybe Victorian style, I'm not sure. But it just looked kinda old to me. The heating was old-fashioned and made quite a bit of noise. Breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel was about $30 per person. The restaurant looked quite elegant, but it was also mostly empty. We did not eat there. Denny's across the street was about $10 per person, so I guess Vancouver is just plain expensive. SUMMARY: The hotel is in a pretty good location near the shops and stuff, but I think there are probably better places to stay in Vancouver. Honestly, I would give this place three and a half stars. So it's alright, if you get a good deal. LOCAL RECOMMENDATION: If you like great seafood and piano music, go to Joe Forte's a few blocks away. This is a very nice North American-style seafood restaurant with bar. The staff are very professional and the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Catching Sight of a few Stars”
Reviews.Author: wwwangels
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is very elegant, but the rooms are about as fancy as a Best Western. We stayed a week at the residence side of the hotel and enjoyed ourselves, but the part that is really 5 star is the service. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the cleaning ladies were very sweet. They made our beds up everyday and put up our dishes- all the expected things, I suppose. But they were always so nice. Now, the thing about Sutton Place is the stars like to stay there. The first day we saw Corbin Bernsen of LA Law fame- he is also currently on the T.V. show Psych. The 6th day of our visit I talked with James Roday, the star of Psych, in the elevator at the Sutton. Wow! He was really nice. Corbin was not so nice, but what can you do? If you decide to stay at the Sutton here are some hints. 1) Hang out at the bar and nurse a drink or two, you might see a star shine your way. 2) Be prepared for $30 a day for parking. Yikes! 3) Ask if your room rate comes with free Internet, ours did. Otherwise you will pay about $15 to get it. HOWEVER- there is a package for $16 a day where you get the Internet AND unlimited free long distance in North America and local calls. To get just the calls and no Internet it is $10 a day. Be warned the Internet is about 1-5 Mbps. It is soooo slow I could snag some of the unsecured signals that were floating around and get the same "dial-up" slow speed. 4) The indoor pool is NOT heated. Be prepared to freeze your booty off if you are not use to swimming in 73 degree weather. 5) There is a grocery store called Market Place IGA. It is great for all the little things you might have forgotten. There may be some sticker shock- the groceries are about double to triple to what we pay in the US, at least in the South. 4) The laundry area is on the same floor as the spa.
