They close at 9:45, but if you still have cloths in a machine at that time you can call the front desk and they will let you back on the floor. Don't forget to buy detergent at Market Place across the street. Alot of times the forgot to close the floor off and I did laundry well past midnight. 5) In the summer the sun comes up at 5:00 AM! We are use to 7:00 AM. Bring eye an eye mask with you. They have blackout curtains, but it still was not enough for me. 6) There is a fire station right behind the hotel on the residence side. Bring a loud fan to block out the sirens that go off at least a couple of times a night.. 7) Bring lots of DVDs for the kids. The channels leave something to be desired for young kids. 8) Try the steam room if you get the chance. It was great, but I could not stand to have it on for more than 5 minutes. I turned it off and just sat in the room once it was all steamed up. It steamed so much I could not even see a foot in front of me and I had to stick my head out the door because I couldn't breathe. Once I figured to turn it off, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a five star property”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: I am perplexed that this place manages to score a five star rating. We stayed in the Grande Residences which are like small apartments. They were fine. The furniture was a bit worn, the decorating was extremely plain. Nothing was terrible but it certainly wasn't luxurious. I would rate this on par with an older Residence Inn or Homewood Suites. When I think of "five star" I would assume amenities like granite countertops, high thread count sheets, fluffy towels, etc. My room had formica countertops, scratchy towels and a lumpy mattress. The lobby is very pretty and the location is fabulous. Becuase of the great location, and becuase having a small apartment is extremely nice, I would probably stay here again if presented a good deal. However, I certainly wouldn't arrive expecting a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place Hotel is superb”
Reviews.Author: gopalmilap
Reviews.Content: Hotwire booked this hotel for us but we did not know the name until we made the payment. It was a pleasant surprise as anything and everything regarding SUTTON PLACE was outstanding. Located close to Stanley park, the harbour, downtown shops and restaurants. The welcome mat was spread by friendly staff from valet attendant, doorman, bellman, concierge, front desk, HK, spa, restaurant and others. Unbelievable flower arrangements in main and floor lobbies, well laid out seating areas, spotless clean thruout. Mr. John Sandor, the GM is accessible just like his staff. I highly recommend SUTTON PLACE HOTEL to fellow travellers to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lazy Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkiesDT
Reviews.Content: We had planned on taking a taxi to our hotel from the airport but a limo driver approached us and offered to take us downtown to our hotel for the same fare as a taxi - and he had champagne. True to his word we found ourselves on our way downtown sipping Champagne in the back of this limo, Vancouver was making a good first impression. After taking us on a detour to see some magnificent houses in the wealthier neighbourhoods we were eventually dropped off at The Sutton Place Hotel – our home for the next few days. Centrally located the Sutton is right in the heart of downtown Vancouver (Burrard St.) and right on Robson St. – the main shopping thoroughfare. Peter our porter took us to the 14th floor and to our room which was at the end of the corridor away from the lifts etc.facing toward the harbour (I requested this room specifically from reading other reviews and they obliged).The room was big, clean and tastefully decorated and had all the usual mod cons and facilities any 5 star hotel should have – in fact my wife would have taken the bed with us for the rest of our trip it was that comfortable.. Our bedroom had a seating area & table which we used for breakfast - most mornings I would go to the market at the corner of the next block where I could get almost everything you could possibly want for breakfast be it hot or cold food, fresh fruit and tea & coffee and the morning paper. We would then have our breakfast gazing out toward the harbour from my 14th floor window. The room was made up daily and a chocolate sweet left on the pillow each night. I could not fault the hotel in anyway from the Fleuri restaurant to Gerard’s bar which has an “old English” country pub feel to it. They also have a nice bar menu and do table service. The hotel had a pool and an extremely well stocked gym. I also used their self service laundry room which was quite handy. There is a beautiful Old Italian restaurant nearby we would never have found on our own only for the concierge who arranged dinner there for us in Café de Medeci .It was a little pricy but boy was it worth it and top service also. It’s just off a little side street on Robson St. If you plan on doing some shopping you’ll be spoilt for choice, Robson St is responsible for our luggage to double from 2 to 4 pieces. All the usual brands are there and I’ve never seen so many shoe stores on one street. Lovely bars/cafes/restaurants dot along this busy shopping strip. Now that we were all shopped out it was time to explore and first on our list was Grosse Mountain. It took a ferry and a bus ride to get there and the scenery was spectacular especially from the cable car which brings you to the top. Once there you are surrounded by incredible wooden carvings, everything from native wildlife to 20 ft statues of the guys that sowed the seeds of the trees that were all around us, I must have photographed them all. We watched the birds of prey demonstration which was quite interesting and amusing, one of the eagles involved landed on the head of the guy standing next to me, I have it all on DVD,. We saw one of the bears also but he was sound asleep and the lumberjacks show was also very good. Going back down the mountain in the cable car we were joined by some people who had just ran up it – we were to have our own mountain experience in a few weeks! On the bus journey back watch out for the stop for Capillano Suspension Bridge, and get off. You’ll get $2 off the entry price by using the Gross Mt ticket stub This is a really nice place to visit and the views form the bridge of the river below it are stunning (it’s the tallest suspension bridge in the world). Make sure to cross the bridge as there is a walkway high up in the trees on the other side and also there are some “giants” there too. What a day, you would actually forget that all this wonderful scenery is right on Vancouver’s doorstep. Stanley Park is a must do. I would recommend getting bikes from Denman St. which is nearby and make sure you have a photo I.D. and some only accepted cash. Stanley Park is huge and we spent the day cycling around it and there are too many photo ops to mention, totem poles, and the bridge etc.Youll probably see some wildlife too especially black squirrels. A great place to just maybe sit and watch the sea planes coming and going out of the harbour. The aquarium in Stanley Park known as Vanquarium was excellent too with some of the most unusual and stunning creature’s ive ever seen and well worth a visit Well that’s Vancouver covered I think. We spent 6 nights there in total and had something to do everyday, a lovely laid back relaxing city and one we said we will visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not 5 star or 5 diamond”
Reviews.Author: PatnJenCaveCreek_AZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sutton and while it was a very nice hotel, it certainly did not live up to the quality of other 5 star hotels I have stayed at. The rooms were smallish and the amenities were just so-so. I also was surprised by the lack of turn down service and lumpy too -soft mattresses and pillows. The location was great as we were able to walk practically anywhere we wanted to in the city. Also just as a heads up the cost for valet is the same as self-park. While we did not eat at the restaurant, we did have drinks in the lounge which was nice, but again, for a 5 diamond hotel I would expect a better selection of wine and certainly expect the drinks to be served in nice glassware, not the freebies they get from the distributer. We did consder getting the dessert buffet, however, for $25 per head I would expect more than 4-5 selections of pie, etc. So if you get a great rate you can't beat the location, but if you are looking for and willing to pay for 5 star service and amenities I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SecretShppr
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sutton Place Hotel cannot be beat when it comes to proximity of great restaurants and shopping. Each member of the concierge staff was helpful, friendly and able to provide us with great dining and tour reservations. Every time we ate in the hotel restaurant, the wait staff was attentive and the food was good. Room service was also quick, the food was good and the delivery presentation was nice. The staff member who delivered our room service was also pleasant. I was surprised that the only AAA 5 Diamond property in Vancouver does not provide turn down service. Our guest room had a strong smell as if someone who had stayed prior to us had spent days upon days smoking in the room. Housekeeping really should not have released the room in such a manner. We had a limited time in the city and chose to spend our time exploring, rather than complaining to the staff and switching rooms because the front desk staff had made it quite clear at check-in that the hotel was sold-out.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: FutureExpatriates
Reviews.Content: The only negative I can see with this hotel is the mushy bed. They really need to upgrade their mattresses (and maybe change out that flat screen tv in the armoire to a flat panel, but not that big of a deal). Other than that, the concierge, restaurant, location, cleanliness, housekeeping, amenities are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sascha11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice while on a tour. Friendly staff, nice size rooms and close to Robson Street. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate if the price is in your budget”
Reviews.Author: Chafman
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Vancouver and I've always been satisfied with my stay at The Sutton. First and foremost, you can't get a better downtown location with restaurants, coffee shops, movie theater, shopping, etc... within steps of the hotel. The room service is impeccable, the rooms are spacious enough to accommodate a business traveler or a couple traveling for pleasure, and the walls are thick enough to isolate sound. The only downfall is a mooshy bed and soft pillows, and a king size bed which looks more like a queen bed. If the rate is within your budget, consider adding the extra charges for Internet ($20 per day) and parking ($30 per day) which are very expensive and can add up quickly if you're also planning on ordering breakfast. If the price is within your budget, you won't be disappointed with your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plodders
Reviews.Content: After spending many days looking for our ideal hotel in Vancouver we chose the Sutton Place and were not disappointed. The Hotel is in the perfect location, has a very inviting lobby area, especially magical with all the christmas trees and lights! The restaurant was first class and we particularly loved the bar where you can also order lighter meals. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. My only tip would be not to have a grand suite room on a lower floor. As it was our honeymoon we treated ourselves to a grand suite. The rooms are stunning but the first room we were shown on the 5th floor overlooks a filthy side street and roof tops of shops. Choose one on the 17th floor or higher, the views from these are absolutely stunning as you can see both lovely city buildings and mountains beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the center of everything and walking distance from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September. I wanted a nice hotel that was centrally located within walking distance of everything and that is exactly what I got. The hotel itself is a solid five star. I think it is all suites. My suite had a whole wall of floor to ceiling windows that gave me fabulous views of Vancouver day and night. It was so picturesque just to sit in my room and look at the city. The staff in the hotel was very courteous and helpful. Everything was commensurate with a five star hotel except the one breakfast I ate there which was more of a three star presentation. But I do not penalize this hotel for the restaurant because there were Starbucks galore and a plethora of other restaurants within 200 meters of the hotel. It is located just off the most popular street in Vancouver so everything is within a short walk including the waterfront which is a must see. One of the highlights of my stay was eating in a Chinese restaurant which sat hundreds of people and had about 20 cooks in the open kitchen manning woks and cooking up a storm. The place is Hon's Wun Ton House on Robson, near Stanley Park. Sit in the back facing the cooks and watch them go to town preparing food for hundreds of people. The food was good and very cheap. I think it is one of the best and most entertaining restaurants I have ever been in. A second must “see and eat” place is Mink Chocolate Café near the waterfront. They make their chocolates there and have a chocolate drink which is richer than Bill Gates. If you love chocolate than this is a place to go. The other must do thing in Vancouver is take the one day trip to Victoria, the capital of BC. Then have tea at the Fairmont Princess Hotel. I cost $60 but it is well worth it. And Victoria in mind numbingly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justlogic
Reviews.Content: Overall a great Hotel, very nice, great downtown location for my meetings with almost everything within walking distance. Great for Business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: love2travel040
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights on Hotwire ($86USD/night) for our honeymoon. The first room we were given was small and dated with a hard bed that sloped into the center with a view of a run-down apartment building (room 1008). We requested another room and were immediately moved to a larger room with feather top mattress, large flat screen tv and a view of the city (room 2012). Staff is very curtious and helpful. Hotel is close enough to walk to many destintions and shopping. IGA market across the street is a great place to stop for snacks and drinks. We usually stay at Fairmont Hotel Vancouver a block a way and for the price difference, this was worth trying out. No visible recycling program was an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the City”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseIllinois
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place is a centrally located, high end ( but not over-priced ) , top drawer hotel that takes care of your needs without making you feel smothered or the victim of "stuffyness". We were surprised by being upgraded upon check-in. We had booked a room in the Grande Residence side & were moved to a larger suite on the top floor. The staff is excellant & happily takes care of any need -from sight-seeing to dining. If you book a residence & want to escape the restaurant rush some evenings there is a great fully stocked market ( including fresh seafood) out the front and 1 block to the right. The kitchen is fully stocked with utensils, pans etc etc..The city sight seeing trolly picks up across the street and most of what you want to see is within walking distance. The pool and hot tub are a little small & they have had issues for some time in regulating the hot tub -this was called out in a review we read prior to booking - & I was sure it'd be resolved by the time we go there. Not-so-much -still causing problems - but this is not a hotel if you're looking for the pool scene anyway. All in all -its a great place with a great staff in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Played catch-up throughout our stay, due to booking error”
Reviews.Author: macnac67
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here a year ago (in the hotel), this year I booked a suite in La Grande Residence for two nights. Having just arrived after a very long inter continental journey which involved 2 delayed flights, you can imagine my disappointment and frustration when told that they did not have a suite available, and could only provide me with 2 interconnected hotel rooms instead. Although the staff at reception were extremely apologetic, this did not make up for the fact that I did not get the accommodation I had booked, despite booking and paying for it more than 2 weeks previously. Because the booking had been made and paid for through a travel website, no compensation could be offered, apparently. Instead, they offered complimentary parking (we had no car), free wi fi (we had no laptop with us). They also offered us complimentary breakfast, which we accepted. It was very good, but on the second morning we found ourselves getting into an animated discussion with the waiter who tried to charge us for 'extras' at breakfast, in spite showing him the voucher the staff at reception had given us. All that said, other than the restaurant staff (who were inconsistant), all the other staff we encountered provided exceptional customer service, and were attentive, friendly and polite. The overall standard of the hotel was high. Furniture and decor was of a high quality and generally classic in style. We used the business centre and the pool and spa, which we well equipped. We would have preferred not to have to walk through the foyer in our robes in order to access the pool, but found the facilities to be pleasant and clean. The location of the hotel is superb. It is set in the heart of the city with Vancouver's famous shopping Robson Street, a stone's throw away. For a delicious dinner in pleasant surroundings, you could do worse than visit Joey's (grill and bar) directly across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay, wonderful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MellynNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old son and myself just returned from a nine night stay in a one bedroom with full kitchen in the Residence side of the Sutton Place in Vancouver. It is a wonderful, clean place to stay. There is an IGA supermarket right across the street, next to a fantastic french restaurant (Le Crocodile). We were visiting family and having the wine store on the ground floor was extremely convenient for buying the hostess gifts. I had a massage in the spa while there and it was wonderful too. It is right in the middle of downtown, so for people looking for quiet, this might not be it. We live in NYC and are used to traffic noises, but it could be disturbing to someone who likes the windows open. My only two dings against it would be the parking and the safe. The parking lot is not large, with very small hard to find spaces. After the first time parking, we used the valet. That was wonderful like the rest of the hotel. Our room safe was located in the closet near the ceiling. I am 5'4". My 6'1" husband had to work the safe because I could not reach it without a chair. In fact, it was up so high I could walk under it. Two small nit picks for a hotel we will return to when we go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: flipfloptrekker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip and it was great. The location is right downtown and close to everything. The staff have amazing attention to detail and seem very well trained. Always quick to open the door for you and smiles were genuine. Rooms are great and comfortable with a minibar and free coffee (I know these are pretty standard), bathrobes, and your choice of paper confirmed at registration.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Wannabe_GlobeTrekker
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel. The decor, reception and rooms are beautifully done.... makes u feel like you've been transported back in time. However, u have to pay a price to enjoy this ambience. My wife and I throughly enjoyed it, especially the location was a short walk to anywhere, but I dont think i'd be willing to pay the same price again...... There's much better value out there. Great hotel if you want that special moment, and are prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, but Vancouver has better”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at Sutton Place for the first time this month. I'll head back to Four Seasons. Sutton Place is a great choice: good service (door, concierge, housekeeping and front desk), quality room furnishings, great location. But it could be better. The rooms are hardly 'fresh', the server in the back corner buffet breakfast is 'over the top' chatty, and the fitness/pool area isn't especially nice. GUEST ROOM Decor is muted; the room needs a fresher look now. Huge bay window - it's the full wall. There is one corner of the window that opens up top. There's both sheers and blackout drapes. My window faced Burrard St. I found the sirens and street noise loud, especially at rush hour. It's either King bed or 2 twins. My king bed was comfy, and you can store flat stuff underneath. Straightforward clock radio. Two pillows on the king bed; a 3rd in the closet that has iron, board, wood hangers, and safe. Work desk is okay, but the chair is a simple dining room type chair. I found the Internet sluggish a couple of times. There's 2 highback upholstered chairs with sizeable end table. There's a filled bar fridge, junk food, pricey water bottles, free coffeemaker. TV has a DVD player. Bathroom has a typical large mirror and tub/shower but the shower rod is not curved. Sizeable stone vanity includes hairdryer. Toilet often required a 2nd flush. Bathroom decor is okay, but not a wow. SPA You must walk through the lobby to the next building. Then take a separate elevator one level up to the Spa. Walk through a series of narrow hallways. Fitness room - no access card required - has 3 treadmills jammed together, next to 2 elipticals. There's 2 TVs there, with a bit of window to look out when on those 5 machines. Since the view includes a dull rooftop, they've installed some fake ferns (unfortunately, victims of spilled white paint). Behind those treadmills are some stationery bikes. In the room are various free weights and some other machines. You have to avoid a machine to get to the water cooler and towels. You will need your room card to access the changerooms. The men's changeroom includes a great steamroom, 4 showers, and lockers that I never did figure out the lock feature (there are no instructions); the concierge was no help. To get to the pool, you must walk down a full flight of stairs. The pool is okay, but the only time I went: no towels. One unusual feature of the pool is that there's a metal rail around it. AREA Full grocery store across the street is handy. If you are a Denny's fan, the one across the street closes Feb 15 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Sutton Plcae, La Grande Residence”
Reviews.Author: us3andthedogchester
Reviews.Content: After many weeks of choosing a place to stay in Vancouver I was more than happy with La Grande Residence at Sutton Place Vancouver. I am a fussy traveller and like luxury at affordable prices and this hotel ticked all the boxes. There is a supermarket across the road and the hotel has a great pool, spa and laundry facilities. It was a stones throw away from all the shops, the sraff we fantastic and all couldnt do enough for us. Our room over looked the main road and we were on the 7th floor, we expected some noise but it wasnt that noticeable. The room was great, very big for 2 adults and a 11 year old, he especially loved the big tv in the lounge area. All the staff we very polite and always had a smile what ever the time of day. If I were to ever stay in Vancouver there would be only 1 place I would stay. I would highly reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, service and position”
Reviews.Author: Enfant_teribl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Residence part of the hotel, which contains suites. My suite was very large, and even though the bedroom overlooked Burrard St - a busy thoroughfare - it was very quiet. The room was well equipped - there was a big flat-panel display, and all the furnishings were good quality. Downsides? The wi-fi signal was very weak, and it is $15/day, which is irritating. Also, the lobby was freezing cold, with very big drafts ripping trough it (it was very cold when I was there - especially for Vancouver). Also, some of the fittings, such in the bathroom, looked a little dated. I stayed for about $170/night, which is good value I think. Staff werre friendly and helpful, and the hotel is right near the major shopping areas of Vancouver. This was a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RuthieSeattle
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Sutton Place. We go to Vancouver at least once a year and stay in a different place every time - we'll definately go back here next time! I found a great internet rate (room, valet parking, and breakfast) and it proved to be a great experience. The room was beautiful, and the staff was extermely helpful with dinner recommendations and ferry schedules. The hotel is about a block from Robson street and some of the best people watching (and shopping) around. Definately a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Treat!”
Reviews.Author: me2Ladybug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton Place hotel in downton Vancover between Boxing Day and New Years. Everything was outstanding and first class. The attention to detail in everything from the turndown service each night with chocolates to the doorman's attentiveness in obtaining a cab for my 4am departure! I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “AC DC weekend”
Reviews.Author: jimbits
Reviews.Content: A group of eight of us went to Vancouver for the hockey game and the AC DC concert. None of us had ever stayed in a hotel downtown so after research on Trip Advisor we selected The Sutton Place and we were not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and they had alot of decorated Christmas trees in the lobby. Check in for four couples was very fast and they even moved us around so we could be close to one another. The rooms are regular sized rooms with king size beds. The rooms were very clean and stocked with everything we needed. The elevators are really fast with very little waiting time. We ate once in the Gerard Lounge and had cocktails every night we were there. The lounge is small and getting a table for eight was difficult but people either made room for us or were kind enough to give up their tables. The food was okay being pub food and the service was pretty good considering our large group. Every employee was great and helpful whenever we needed to find something, whether it was directions or Advil for the morning after the concert. Across the street is a Denny's which was good for late night snacks and Joey's, great food and fantastic service! Check out was really fast and we got a cab right away. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - nothing fabulous”
Reviews.Author: apedoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel can fool you when you first step out of the cab! You think it is grand and luxurious but it really isn't. They try to pull it off with the all the bells and whistles that they offer but when you get down to the nitty gritty you are better to stay somewhere else - like the Best Western. This hotel makes too many mistakes, causes discomfort, isn't consistent, is located next to a BUSY NOISY fire station (yes 2-6 am loud sirens), and located between loud busy streets. The location is centrally located downtown and the spa is about all they have going for them. It is not a sparkling clean place. Hallways are banged up, walls in the rooms are nicked and furniture scratched. They allow animals of all shapes and sizes, which is wonderful for the pet traveler, however they need to invest in heavy duty cleaning machines to rid the rooms and hallways of dog stench. Maybe not all rooms have it, but I had a variety of rooms over several months for my stay and they all smelled. The fire alarm is constantly going off, and they can't fix problems very efficiently. Truly don't stay here if it is for a long period. This is a hotel that Vegas would have knocked down a long time ago to put up a new and modern one.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Tiny&Emily
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mom in this hotel from Nov. 11 - 16. Booked thru hotel's own website and got a package including: lodging, daily breakfast and parking. What a wonderful experience! Staff in the hotel is always polite and eager to help. Especially Heather at the Concigere. I got upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment at no extra cost. I had a better time staying in this hotel than my other experiences with Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. Just can't say one thing bad about my stay. Book this hotel and you will not regret!!!

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in Vancouver, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed the second time at the Sutton. Love the place! Bar is excellent. All staff extremely curteous. Just outside the hotel is a great coffee and croissant place for a quick breakfast. Also had breakfast at the hotel, which was very tasty. Ate Dinner at the bar, food is very good. Rooms are very nice and stylish. Always feel so at home there. Would love to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of an educational trip to Canada. Nice hotel, fabulous location and wonderful staff. If you can't afford the Fairmont up the road,stay here. Good luxury option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but the service was a terrible”
Reviews.Author: superkb
Reviews.Content: We picked the Sutton Place for a two night stay in Vancouver based on the reviews we found on tripadvisor and the location in the city. The photos seemed great so we booked two nights at a great rate. We found ourselves heading to Vancouver a night earlier than expected and called the hotel while on the road to see if they had any vacancy for that evening. They did, but at $100 more than what we paid. We noted to the front desk that we saw a 24hr. deal on their website for $70 cheaper and they told us we needed to book the room online—they would not reserve the room for us by phone at that rate. When we explained that we were on the road and this was difficult, and we were already booked for two evenings with them, they didn't seem to care. Their site reservation system turned out to not work on our mobile phones and we ended up staying at the Fairmont two blocks away instead. It didn't seem very courteous to not extend the web fare for already booked and expected guests, especially as this was mid-week (I could maybe understand if it was a busy weekend). Once we arrived at Sutton Place, the valet and front door folks were very polite and helpful. However, on the few occasions during our brief stay in which we asked the front desk or concierge a questions, we found we got very short and circuitous answers. i.e. when we asked if we could check in early since we were in town earlier in the morning than expected, they said "Check in is at 3." When we asked if we could simply store our bags at their hotel while we were out in the afternoon, then they said "yes." I don't understand why they wouldn't offer this option from the first question. That said, the room was clean and pleasant enough and the hotel location is central to fun city spots. The bed was sort of uncomfortable and the pricey internet connection was on and off. The valet guy was super helpful and the housekeeping staff friendly. However, I would not recommend the Sutton Place considering all the other hotel options in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Darn Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BLBL
Reviews.Content: 'Just wanted to let you all know ... those who helped us choose a hotel ... that we really liked Sutton Place. Excellent staff - we really relied onthe concierge quite a bit. There were usually 2 of them available. No hanging on hold forever. The registration desk called us on my cell when our room was ready. Easy access to cabs. Great location, although our room had no view - but other hotels. The room was large and comfy. Large bathroom with excellent bath products. The price had gone down since our original booking, and we called ... no sweat! They gave us the lower price - always courteous. What would I change? The bed spread/comforter was a pretty gold fabric, but very slippery. Liked to creep off the bed in the middle of the night. Brr! Also - no hand-held nozzle in the shower. We're really hooked on them. We highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: cunuck
Reviews.Content: We selected the Sutton Place Hotel for our 4-day stay after researching various hotels through their own websites and after reading reviews on the tripadvisor website. This hotel is centrally located in Vancouver's downtown core, on Burrard Street, just one block from Robson Street's shopping area. It is also within a 25-minute taxi ride to Grouse Mountain for a spectacular view of Vancouver and the harbour area. We were also able to visit the Capilano Suspension Bridge which is a bit closer along the same route. In addition, we visited the Aquarium at Stanley Park, just 10 minutes from the hotel and well worth every penny just to watch the otters playing. Another interesting place to visit is Granville Island filled with small shops, art galleries and restaurants, all within a short walk from the hotel, followed by an even shorter aquabus ride (a must do again). Check-in went smoothly after a very late arrival. (We called ahead to make sure they knew about the delay.) The two-room suite was well appointed with a very comfortable sofa that was also a fold-out bed, soft chairs, two flat screen TVs, a king bed, desk area, a large bathroom and two closets. There were also two in-room safes. Two newspapers were delivered to our door every morning. The entire hotel was kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff. The consierge service was excellent and offered many suggestions and advice as to how one would best get around Vancouver and see as much as possible within the limited amount of time we would be spending there. The dining room offered excellent meals with beautiful presentations. The wait staff was extremely flexible in providing substitutes, saying, "As long as the item is in the kitchen, the chef will cook it." In fact, we were also able to order from the Gerard Lounge menu. The lounge is located beside the main dining room and offers a warm spot by the fire to sip a glass of wine while relaxing after a full day of sight-seeing. You might even see a few "celebs" around this hotel since there are so many movies being shot in the Vancouver area, but please allow them their private time to unwind (as we did). We can't wait to stay at this wonderful hotel again in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice whilst on our trip in September. We stayed 2 nights before our cruise to Alaska and two nights at the end of our Rocky Mountaineer Tour. Both times the hotel was excellent. The rooms are delightful and the beds are comfortable. The bathroom is a good size and the hotel and rooms are spotless. We had a good breakfast each day and one night we had dinner in the dining room. The food was excellent. If and when we return to Vancouver, we would stay at this lovely hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Traditional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willbad79
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for 4 nights, whilst on a business trip to Vancouver LOCATION The hotel is located in a central part of downtown Vancouver. The financial district, Stanley Park, the Cruise Ship terminal and Gastown are all within a reasonable walk of the hotel. For those of you planning to shop in Vancouver, importantly, the hotel is located less than a block away from Robson Street, the main shopping strip. HOTEL - RECEPTION & LOBBY The reception area and lobby are clean and comfortable with a number of sofas and chairs whilst you wait for someone or even for a short meeting. All are of a good standard. I would say the lobby is a little small for a hotel of this size, so it can get quite busy and crowded at certain points in the day. Reception staff are efficient and polite, and I was on my way to the room in minutes. ROOMS I stayed in a standard room. These contain a King Size Bed, writing desk and two chairs. Television is approximately 24 inches and is a CRT style. Bathrooms are marble counters, combined bath and shower unit, and electric point. All decor and furnishings had a somewhat dated feel to them, although importantly, the bed and chairs were very comfortable, and I did not struggle to sleep. Also, very little outdoor noise made its way into the room. All in all, a hotel that is suitable for both the business and leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: silvertresses
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through Celebrity Cruises. We spent 2 nights here pre-cruise. We stayed in a suite (kitchen, dining area, living area, seperate bedroom w/king bed, bath). The room was very clean and quiet. The hotel staff was responsive to needs, and the concierge was right on the mark with restaurant recommendations. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: sbond
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic one night stay at the Sutton Place Hotel (La Grande Residence) for our anniversary. We arrived after a long flight from Australia with our baby and checked in smoothly. Our room was beautifully decorated and HUGE with balcony overlooking Burrard St downtown. There was a congratulations note from the manager and a plate with two desserts and "Happy Anniversary" and a complimentary bottle of Voss water waiting us in our suite. We found the hotel to be in a great location downtown, and it was very convenient to have a gourmet IGA market right across the street. Also the funky gourmet hotdog stand "Japadog" right on the street corner, and lovely wine store downstairs. We felt the suite was very good value for the price (we booked in advance on the hotel's website) and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajg16
Reviews.Content: Booked this through the sutton website, and by becoming members got a cheaper rate. We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 6 nights. The suite was a good size, with a decent kitchen, and the biggest TV you have ever seen!! The hotel has probably one the best locations in downtown, in that it is right on robson street, and a very easy walk everywhere, plus there is a supermarket right next door, bus stops right outside and the vancouver trolly company also stops right over the road (though I wouldn't rate them very highly, quite often we waited easily 30-45 mins!). The swimming pool is a good size and never really busy, and there is a nice deck with ping pong. The staff were very helpful, and offered all sorts of advice about what to see and do (also told us that the museum of anthropology is closed until next march, which saved us trecking down to the university), and booked things for us - they also give money off coupons, which is very handy! Overall a very pleasant stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bprawn
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous before our stay due to some of the less that complimentary reviews on the website but from the second we arrived we loved the Sutton Place. The hotel’s biggest asset is undoubtedly the staff, who are all friendly, helpful and efficient at all levels – from the front desk staff to the concierge to housekeeping. In particular a mention to the ladies and gent in the Gerard bar, who provide excellent discreet service and have great memories – we visited on Saturday and then again late on Monday night and they remembered that I have mayonnaise with my fries and my husband likes malt vinegar. It really is the little touches like this that make the difference. Another example of good service and what I can only describe as “a little bit of thought” came on leaving the hotel. We had a late flight and I wanted to get changed after a days touring and shopping. Upon realising this was what I wanted to do the gentleman who brought our bags out of storage ushered me to the front desk where I was given a key card for the spa, where I was able to have a shower as well as get changed. This was a very welcome gesture – I have simply been pointed at rest rooms in the past. Given that we got a good rate on the hotel website I was expecting a “room with issues”, but we had a great room on the 14th floor with pretty much floor to ceiling windows, with views of the city. There was very little traffic noise despite the location on Burrard Street. The room was immaculately clean and nicely decorated. The hotel is well located – right by Robson Street and a few minutes walk from the waterfront. A final mention to the bakery next door which serves great coffee and top notch pastries. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a prepaid reservation at the Sutton Place for 3 nights starting August 19, 2008, before we left on a cruise in the Inside Passage. We had booked a reservation months before our trip and had prepaid for our stay with a request that the hotel hold our rooms for late arrival as we planned to arrive around 10 pm on the first night. Our flight was delayed and when we arrived at midnight, the doorman said, "I hope you have a reservation because we are sold out." The desk clerk told us we had no room and we would have to take a taxi and use another hotel. They gave us a voucher for the taxi, another room and breakfast for 3 days. They promised to refund the first night's charges, but we never received the refund. We were upgraded to a suite, but we had to change hotels and when we attempted to check in at noon the second day, we were told to come back later. The taxi driver who took us to the other hotel said he had done the same for another guest an hour earlier. It's obvious that the Sutton place overbooks its rooms even for prepaid guests. While the rooms are nice, their reservations are a disaster. While they attempted to make up for their mistake, we lost almost a day changing hotels. My advice if you insist on staying at the Sutton Place, to either make sure you arrive in the afternoon, after check in or stay at the Sheraton up the street. Arriving at midnight to find your room has been given away shows an indifference to customers that is beyond contempt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kekeScotland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good sized room and bathroom. Quiet and clean. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm”
Reviews.Author: mygirlscats
Reviews.Content: I stay in Vancouver frequently on business but had never stayed in the Sutton Place before. It is everything it is billed to be: good location for shopping, not bad location for business, although it is closer to the hospital and courthouse than to the downtown business core. Not particularly close to the cruise terminal, either; it will be a taxi ride away. The opportunity for views is not the best in town, but the hotel itself does have exceptional service and the decor is old world elegant -- botanical prints, fleur de lys motifs, furniture that looks like it has some history behind it. Yes, the bed is quite soft and may not be to everyone's taste because of that. I was upgraded to an executive suite, which was quite nice. However, the bedroom was windowless --- not my favourite, but some folks may find that adds to the ability to sleep outside the local time zone. There is loads of room for clothing storage (in the suite, anyway). Some things are "hidden"...the laundry bag is in a drawer rather than hanging in the closet, and the coffee maker is well hidden in the bottom of the mini-bar. Wasn't particularly happy to have to search, find, pull it out and plug it in myself, although I guess it did maintain the look of the room, not having a coffeemaker front and centre in the foyer! The bathroom is okay, but a bit worn looking. Grout was stained in the shower, the bathtub does not slope much at the back so leaning back is ... well, let's say the tubs are original to the property...I think about 20 years. The stall shower is rather small...I'd guess less than 36" across. However, the bathroom scales lied beautifully when I stepped on them, so I can at least fool myself into thinking I've lost weight on this trip! The living room did have one small window that really opened; I like to get a bit of fresh air in a hotel room so that was good. The heating/cooling system worked quietly and well. You can sign on to join the frequent stay club at the property's website; you can even indicate your preferred paper: national (Globe & Mail) or local (Vancouver Sun). I didn't actually receive a paper this morning ... hmmm... but others on my floor did and I did see both papers out so I presume the system works most of the time. Given a choice, if I wanted a suite downtown, I would return to the Westin Grand instead; the property is new and just as elegant in a contemporary chic way, rather than old world elegant; the rooms more spacious, better natural light and views and a kitchenette to boot. However, I would certainly stay at the Sutton Place again without complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: 4states
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy as it was GP weekend, however the staff were extemely helpful / friendly and our suite both luxurious and spacious. The hotel is well located near great shopping and good restaurants. The only downside was they couldn't find the car when we needed it, but it was down to communication amongst the valets and resolved within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “elegance in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ilasik
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night before departing for a cruise. Even though we arrived at 4:30am after a delayed flight we immediately were made to feel comfortable and taken care of. The public areas are beautiful. Loved the bedding and all the little touches in the room. Kids enjoyed the pool the next morning. Location is great Great choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms for two nights on vacation. The hotel is very nicely done and conveniently located downtown. Everything seemed fresh and updated. (Unlike some reviews here which complained about worn furnishings etc.) The rooms were tastefully decorated and very comfortable and quiet. We had rooms with single king size beds; a pre-requested rollaway bed was in the room at check in. My teenagers enjoyed the small indoor pool. The lobby and restaurant are also beautifully done. The only meal we ate in the hotel was a breakfast buffet which had a nice selection of well prepared breakfast foods. Wifi was available for $15 per day. Parking was about $26 per day. There are a large number of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance; in the morning, a 5 minute walk took us to Canada Place. The hotel faced a major problem while we were there - pipes broke flooding one floor and shutting down all the elevators. It took the hotel about 30 hours to get the elevators running again. As a result all guests were required to use the stairwells. We were on the 10th floor - not a major problem as we are in shape; but clearly this was a problem for older guests. The hotel staff worked very hard to help everyone, and handed out free water at the bottom of the stairwell and gave free breakfast buffets to guests. All levels of management and staff (maids to managers) apologized for the problem and worked hard to alleviate the problem as best they could. Shortly after the elevators went out, they were able to route some guests through a service elevator (a chance to see behind the scenes...) Although inconvenient, the level of concern and effort shown by the staff showed they cared for their guests. This incident would not stop me from highly recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray2061
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night, before taking a cruise, for our 2nd honeymoon. The whole experience was unforgettably excellent :)

Reviews.Title: “5+++++ Stars in every area”
Reviews.Author: grandmommyof4
Reviews.Content: One of the finest establishments we have ever stayed in! From the superb desk staff, to the Immaculate room situated just where we requested, this hotel has every amenity possible. A Happy Anniversary treat was waiting for us in the large room, compliments of the management. This room was so quiet, we heard no noise all night--a rare treat for the light sleeper. In the heart of Vancouver, and near shopping, there is also a wine shop next door, with a large collection of vino, also owned by Sutton Place. The hotel restaurant, Fleuri, is exquisite. Again, the staff is friendly and helpful. The food is wonderful; the portions are not gigantic , so we could finish everything, and have room for the desert buffet ( with a lovely chocolate fountain) that is offered once a week. The Sutton Place is truly deserving of a 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but I was expecting better”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sutton Place during our summer vacation. The hotel is well located and the staff are great. While comfortable, our room was a bit small and could do with some refurbishment. The hotel is quiet expensive considering the room quality. I also recommend avoiding the 'reduced price breakfast option' on the hotel website as this actually works out more expensive then if you pay the restaurant directly. When I pointed this out to the reception, they were very apologetic and accommodating and provided us with free breakfasts for half of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gjb_7
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this hotel which we booked for the last couple of days on our honeymoon. On arrival having booked a non-smoking room we were advised that they only had smoking rooms available. At this point we considered moving to another hotel as due to the hotel being full they were unable to move us to another room. However, with the promise of an ioniser to clear the smell we took the room and headed out for the evening. The room despite the strong smell of smoke appeared of a very high quality, as did the hotel itself which is centrally located. Upon our return we entered the room and the smell of smoke was even stronger and the ioniser clearly hadn't touched the room, and being two non-smokers this was a little more than annoying. Upon contacting the reception they could not have been more helpful. A fan was immediately brought to the room and lessened the smell during the night. We were informed to have our bags ready in the morning and would be moved to a non-smoking room. In the morning we were moved, and also upgraded into a Grand Suite. The room was unbelievable. The hotel also provided us with a complimentary meal in the restaurant. The restaurant meal was fantastic, with food and service of the highest quality. We have still graded this hotel as excellent as we strongly believe it is. Its focus is clearly customer centric, and despite an initial issue with the room we are sure they would have moved us at they earliest opportunity had they been able. Their response was refreshing, and most welcome in the circumstances. High hopes for this hotel were maintained by their professional and responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seattlekate_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and fantastic service. The hotel room was a little small but for a city hotel where you basically just sleep, it was large enough for my husband and I. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ariannaCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sutton Place after our trip to Alaska which ended in Vancouver. The room was lovely, the view was fine, and the location was wonderful. The concierge gave us great restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners512
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was just OK. The view was mostly blocked by the other surrounding buildings. The location was convieniently near restaurants on Robson st. Lots of high end shopping if you like that (we didn't). Front desk and houskeeping were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jjstrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Grande Residence at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver in a 700 square apartment for 4 nights. There was a master bedroom, with a king bed, full kitchen, dining area and living room which had a pull out sleeper sofa. This contained a 40" flat screen TV, DVD player, plus another smaller one in the bedroom. Service was excellent. in all areas, with daily housekeeping and toiletries. We were fortunate to find a deal on the Internet the enabled us to stay here for about the price of a Hotel. Very clean apartment. This is part of the Sutton Place Hotel which is gorgeous and has all the ammenities of a first class hotel- business center, spa, indoor pool, restaurant. The location was perfect. in the heart of the city and an upscale Marketplace was just across the street. The Hotel Conciege was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: trtzw
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place is a excellent hotel. My room was very comfortable, and well appointed. Daily service is top notch. The restaurant and room service menus are quite tasty. For instance, there is a chocolate buffet that can't be resisted. The staff is attentive and always happy to assist you. This hotel caters to the movie and television industry. So make sure you visit the hotel bar, often. Besides a lengthy list of single malts, chances are you'll see a celebrity or two. If you are an early riser, spend a few minutes in the hotel lobby area. Production crews gather to pick-up clients and celebrities, before motoring off to various film locations. Great people watching! The Sutton Place is within easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Taxi service is always waiting right outside the front door. The Sutton Place is my favorite hotel in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCleanfreak
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean, upscale hotel. We had a view of the city from our room (1212). The concierge downstairs was very helpful. The only drawback was the breakfast. The buffet was $23 per person which is absolutely ridiculous. But, I would definitely stay there again and just eat breakfast at the Crepe Cafe right around the corner instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Electra11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Grand Residence in the Sutton Place Hotel on two occasions last month and loved it. We got a two bedroom apartment (for 2 couples) and thought the place, cleanliness, location and service were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Central for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Catwomanr
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room here for a 2 night stay at the end of our holiday. Upgraded to a quiet room on the 19th floor, well above the city. Strange that our double room had 2 large single beds, but we did not query this as it was just 2 nights. Wonderful beds with additional feather mattressess (are they called toppers?) Slept really well. Helpful staff on reception and concierge, friendly and gave good advice. Good location in the middle of Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but a little old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: drbsfm
Reviews.Content: Nice location, but the rooms, while clean and well maintained, are dated. Hotel takes lots of big groups, so the lobby can be a madhouse. Breakfast buffet is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: Dougger1977
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Sutton and loved every minute of it! From the minute we walked in till the minute we left, they treated us like we were royalty. The positives include evening turn down service complete with chocolates and a card with the next day's weather forecast. It's a little touch, but it just shows how guest focused they are. The concierge desk came in very helpful as we decided to venture outside the city on a couple occasions. They even knew where the new H&M was located in the mall even though it had only been open a week. He gave us very detailed directions, including which escalator to take and which way to turn once we got off of it. I can't say enough about the excellent level of service. The hotel is also one block away from Robson street, which has all sorts of shops. The only negative was the cost to park ($28/day), but I'm from the cornfields of the mid-west where parking is always free. Overall, I'd stay at the Sutton Place again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “SHower/tub too old and small (shower stall)”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Pan Pacific but I had a credit with Hotwire and I was able to get this for $129 a night. The employees were awesome! Super nice and efficient. The room was large and decorated nicely. The bath items were my favorite, BUT the stand alone SMA LL shower was so little that when I turned around my body would catch the adjuster and make the water boiling! It was at least 30 years old as was the tub (They were seperate) I HATED that shower! I give this hotel no more than 4 stars because of this. ALso, I had the A/C on and the A/C vent smelled like old maple syrup!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Joshdent
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. It is an easy walk to Robson St, Canada Place/ Convention Center, Davie St. Stanley Park and Gastown are longer but doable walks. My room was tastefully appointed. The service here is top notch- from the doormen to the housekeeping staff everyone is there to make your stay as enjoyable and as comfortable as possible. The concierge staff is very knowledgeable and accessible as well. I could not have been more satisfied with my stay here. The only downside is that the business center has a stiff charge for internet usage, so I would walk a few blocks to Kinko's and use the computers there. I felt pampered at the Sutton Place Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Soni181
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for a weekend. We have visited Vancouver several times, and knew we wanted to be close to the main downtown area restaurants and shops. This hotel is in a prime location with many great restaurants and stores within walking distance. (only half a block away from Robson!) It was in a better location than even the downtown Hyatt! (where we stayed last time) The service from the concierge was amazing and considerate. I've never had hotel staff bend over backwards as they did, in booking restaurant reservations, give passes to clubs, and being so knowledgeable with local restaurants. (and we had very specific criteria) The only thing I could find that wasn't 'perfect' were the beds. The beds were just ok. I understand that everyone has their own preferences with beds, but I think the Hyatt's beds were more comfortable. However, since the service and location were great (and better), I'd rather stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lamj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights while on business. Great location as it is right downtown and close to Robson street where there are tons of decent restaurant. The room is spacious with nice decor. The staff are just always there to help, was very impressed by the wonderful staff there. The gym was nice with some old but decent equipment. Internet access was very slow while I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family-friendly option in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: richsf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over spring break with the grandparents and kids in a two-bedroom suite. Many positives, few cons. Pros: (1) Very good-sized two-bedroom suites in the La Grande Residence. (2) Modern, clean decor (3) LCD TV with DVD player in living room, LCD in main bedroom (4) 1.5 bathrooms (5) Kitchenette (6) Pastry treat on arrival (7) In the middle over everything (close to Yaletown, etc.) (8) Spa in hotel (9) Wine shop with decent selection attached to hotel Cons: (1) "High-speed internet" not always high-speed -- and expensive at $15/day (2) One of three elevators broken for entire stay, causing delays (3) Maid service forgot to set up sofa bed for kids during entire stay Overall, an excellent value in an excellent location for those traveling with kids

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontarioannie
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Sutton Place in Vancouver and it was once again an enjoyable experience. Valet parking and check-in were quick, very professional and friendly. The location is ideal for those who want to shop as all the designer stores and the Pacific Centre are within a short walking distance. We were there for a family event and the consierge pointed me to a florist - the arrangement that arrived was spectacular for what we spent. We ate in the restaurant for appetizers one evening and for lunch in the pub one afternoon and both meals and service were good experiences. The room was clean, bed was a tad soft (personal preference) but bedding was nice and the bathroom had some nice amenities although we didn't use them. So, you may be wondering why I didn't give this hotel an over all experience of 'excellent' - well, it was because of the heating. When we arrived in our room it was hot - and actually it was the young man who brought up our luggage that mentioned the heat. He turned the heat down but an hour later we were still sweltering. I called housekeeping and within 10 minutes a fellow was there to look at the problem. Obviously, they had had this complaint before because he brought along a new air filter and installed it (the one he pulled out was disgusting but that may be part of a hotel heating problem). After this installation, with the heat still turned down, we went out for about three hours but when we returned the room was still sweltering. What we finally did was turn the heat off and open the window. If we became too cold then we turned on the heat for a bit - not what I expect of a hotel of this class!

Reviews.Title: “I love Sutton Place!”
Reviews.Author: LindySeattle
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel experience I've had in years! I booked a luxury suite, premium 1-bedroom, through their website. It was less than $250 a night. I just can't say enough about what a great place this was to spend my downtime while in town. It was an absolutely wonderful 4 day stay at the hotel, from check-in to check-out. The location is central, and the room was actually a small apartment. It came with a fully stocked kitchen, dining room, big living room, bedroom, bathroom, and a deck. The decor was tasteful, the furniture was comfortable and attractive, everything was spotlessly clean, the bed was comfortable, the towels were big and fluffy, and there were so many amenities and nice little features. The service at this hotel is just impeccable. I used to stay at the Hyatt when I was in Vancouver, but never again. For the same price you can get so much more at the Sutton Place. My mouth doesn't usually hang open in amazement at customer service but I had so many "How wonderful!" moments while staying here. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tipping made easy”
Reviews.Author: alranson
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Sutton Place in Vancouver was a novel experience. It's probably the only place I've ever actively run round trying to tip all and sundry. The staff seem genuinely friendly and helpful, and it's not the slick insincere "friendliness" that you so often get in good hotels. I don't know Vancouver that well, and didn't spend much time walking round the near neighbourhood of the hotel, but it seemed to me that the location was fairly central but not exactly over-exciting or interesting. It's not like staying on Knightsbridge or Fifth Avenue, for example. If you are feeling ill it's quite good though, because there's a massive hospital two blocks away... Like everything in Vancouver, the hotel is a newish building, in two blocks: the main bit and then La Grande Residence which consists of extended stay suites. The spa and pool are in the basement of La Grande Residence, but you can reach them without having to go outside. Inside, though, it's another story. Very traditional public areas, lots of marble, moulded ceiling decorations, rugs etc, but still quite light and airy. I had my bags carried in by a very polite and well spoken doorman, and then was escorted to a standard room on the 19th floor by a very polite and well spoken bellman who was almost desperate to show me the room's facilities. The room was perhaps on the slightly small side, but not inconveniently so. One whole wall was floor to ceiling window, and the others were covered in regency striped wallpaper in muted cafe latte tones, and tasteful prints. The king sized bed had a carved wooden headboard, and a very nice old-gold silky bedspread (on which I later managed to splash maple syrup... oops). Just about everything one could want was in there without my having to ask: iron, ironing board, dressing gown, umbrella, hairdryer, DVD player and loads of extra pillows and blankets. Only thing obviously missing was a pen or pencil by the phone. The hairdryer was also hopelessly ancient and tiny, and the guest service directory rather tatty and needed to be replaced. They should also keep the minibar chocolate in the actual minibar to keep cool! Noise wise, although the hotel is on a busy street, it was pretty quiet in the evening from up on the 19th floor where I was. Things got a bit noisier in the morning rush hour though: I did wonder how the lower floors were with noise. I'd definitely ask for a higher level room if you can. The ivory marble bathroom was fine and reasonably sized, with soft white towels and lots of amenities including a sewing kit, lip balm, loofah, cotton wool and two kinds of soap. Also there were scales in the bathroom, which I've never seen before in a hotel, but was not tempted to use given the pancakes and maple syrup I packed away for breakfast. I could have done without the Lush-type bath goodies laid out in the bathroom, though, costing an astronomical $12.95 plus tax for a small bubble bath bombe. Food Didn't eat in the restaurant (which looked a bit hotel-formal and stuffy to me). Did order room service breakfast, which was delivered bang on time and beautifully presented by a waiter who addressed me by name. Cost $33, but it was excellent... and the water which came for the tea was properly hot. Other facilities There's a fitness room on the mezzanine of La Grande Residence, which seemed rather cramped... a combination of being a smallish room and being absolutely crammed with equipment. In the basement, there's a small but light and airy pool and jacuzzi and full length windows looking out to a rather grey looking concrete sun deck. The snag is that you have to walk down 2-3 flights of stairs from the changing rooms to the pool. On the mezzanine level is also located the Vida spa which offers all the usual massage and beauty treatments plus some I'd never heard of. Service in general I should explain that I had a bit of a long running saga going on that would test the most patient of concierges. I'd been trying to get a UPS parcel from the US delivered to the hotel so I could pick it up when I arrived - and to make matters worse there would be an unknown amount of import duty to be paid on delivery. The concierges I spoke to before arrival couldn't have been more accommodating, offering to receive the parcel and pay the courier if it arrived before I did. In the end, it turned out even more complicated, but they took it all in their stride without any eyeball rolling and sighing, which one sometimes does get with concierges elsewhere who think they are rock stars....(not naming any names, W Hotel in San Francisco....) The other thing I'd mention is that everyone calls you by your name all the time, whether concierge or bellman or room service. It was a little disconcerting at first, but quite soon it has the effect of making you feel like you are almost at home, because it's obviously genuine. Will definitely be going back. It's going to be a hard act to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Gracious”
Reviews.Author: sophiasgirl
Reviews.Content: service at a time when service was paramount. friendliness/willingness never faltered. recognition at every post.in every moment. all areas performed with expertise and training in "hospitality" a two week stay without complaint. wireless internet needs a boost/but that's technology+repairable. perfect location .... perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luxury”
Reviews.Author: flaxie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the holiday weekend. We booked our stay on Expedia which helped us to save on the local taxes. Our stay was wonderful, the rooms were very nice with a soaking tub. The pool was a little difficult to get to but everything else was convenient. The lobby was small but beautiful with marble floors and fresh flowers. If you stay on a weekend you have to try the chocolate buffet in their restaurant, it seriously is a grand experience. Overall we had a relaxing trip and felt like we picked a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family for a weekend at the the La Grande residence. The 2 bedroom unit was very large and clean. The hotel is in a great location and service was amazing. The problem we faced was that heat/air conditioning would not work. We did switch rooms but still no better. The rooms maintained a 75 degree temperature. The beds are somewhat hard and pillows very uncomfortable. We felt the bedding should have been much better in a 5 star hotel. Overall a great value for the terrific price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Please_Louise
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, friendly, expert service and beautiful rooms. We booked online and think we must have been given an upgrade because the room we stayed in was far superior to rooms we have paid much more for. The hotel desk staff was accommodating and friendly, they made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. We ate lunch in the Gerard Lounge and I wanted to stay there all day, it was so pleasant and relaxed. It is reminiscent of an English pub and the fish and chips were of the style we had enjoyed in London, they also have a vegetarian menu. Shannon was our server and just as charming as she was efficient. This hotel definitely deserves its stars; the décor is splendid and tasteful. The guest rooms are well laid-out and generously sized. Furnishings are discerning and the beds are comfortable and cozy. All of the staff we interacted with were wonderful and obliging. The website states that the hotel has had some renovations; so I think any of the water troubles that previous reviewers have mentioned are no longer a problem.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very well-run, professional hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: superdork21
Reviews.Content: I could sum up my stay in all but one word: fantastic. By all means this isn't the newest hotel on the street, and the most jaw dropping, but this has probably the nicest and most courteous staff in any establishment I have ever seen, period. From the people that open doors, to the valet, to the concierge, to the front desk, to the housekeepers; they are definitely the best group of people I have ever seen at one place for one time. We stayed in a king suite, and it was amazing, all except for the shower, it was POSSESSED! But they fixed that for us. Also, they took my wife's night gown by accident with the linens, but the linen company they were associated with cleaned it, returned it to them, and they shipped it right back to us in Toronto. I would like to live at the Sutton Place Vancouver, would definitely go for another visit, hopefully sometime in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RealEstateDiva
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 2 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday weekend (we live in Seattle) and had a wonderful time. Positives: Beautiful hotel, great service, very attractive rooms, and very good location. Conceirge was terrific in efficiently arranging and recommending dinner reservations around town. We also seemed to impress everyone when asked where we were staying and we replied "The Sutton". Apparently it has a reputation of prestige. They also provided a complimentary "birthday treat" in our room, complete with 5-6 specialty dessert samplings. Very nice touch. Negatives: Only three.... no bell service promptly available to take our luggage cart up. After waiting about 10 mins we were anxious to get to our room and decided to manuever the cart ourselves. This was quite a feat in the narrow halls w/corners and strangely the cart was still in the hallway outside our room 2 days later so we re-used it to take our luggage back down. Second negative: The view from our room was lovely if you didn't look down. There was an alley way below with views of numerous dumpsters with garbage strewn about. However, it did provide an interesting display of Vancouver's more "interesting persons." Third negative: Internet service is not complimentary, but apparently this is very much the case in 99% of hotels in Vancouver. We would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time here over Christmas with the kids”
Reviews.Author: halbers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 days over Christmas and had a wonderful time. We had an apartment like suite with a kitchen and big plasma TV and the room was clean and very comnfortable. The staff was very attentive and helpful, the roomservice great, fast and efficient and overall had no complaints at all. Hotel also has a very convenient parking under the hotel so parking was no issue either. Good place to stay with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rafismom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Residence portion over a very snowy weekend. The accomodations were very comfortable and up to date. There is a super market right across the street and a wine shop next door - with the full kitchen we did up our own breakfast every day and enjoyed a late afternoon glass of wine and snack. The location could not be more convenient - a block off of Robson, close to the Pacific Center, a short walk to the ferry to Granville Island, on the bus routes - we were so centrally located that the bad weather didn't put a dent in the trip. All in all a great experience and wonderful relaxing long weekend. The only downer was a glitch in our reservation - booked on their website and the rate charged was much higher then the confirmed rate. They fixed this very quickly and graciously - but check - the check in paperwork didn't show the rate!

Reviews.Title: “The Sutton was a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Oxsomio
Reviews.Content: Everything went well until we got to the room. As we got there late in the evening, we were planning on heading to bed. First problem: no sheets/pillows for the fold out and the added pillows requested with our reservation weren't there either. As we waited for our bedding, my wife decided to shower and found that we only had (1) bath towel - another call to the front desk. Finally ready for bed and, as we like to sleep cold, we turned down the Heat. At 1am, it was still 75 degrees in the room so we opened a window - allowing all the wonderful siren noise (4 different occasions during the night) into the room. 77 degrees when I got up. After 3 trips by maintenance for the Heat, to no avail, and 1 trip to "fix" the t.v. remote, we we're ready to go home. Not all was bad (the concierge was great as were the front desk and doorman/valet), but for the price we paid it was very disappointing. They have offered us a free upgrade on our next stay, however.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Compare ... Great!!”
Reviews.Author: burkeohio
Reviews.Content: Easy check in and a great 11th floor room. Maybe the worst weather to hit Vancouver all year, with snow then blowy rain. But Sutton Place served us well. A close walk to Robson shops and Pacific Place Mall, and had the weather been better, it would have made an ideal weekend stay. Plenty of places to eat nearby. We learned to try the good review places (e.g., Cin Cin, a very overpriced mediterranian place on Robson), and enjoyed the economical (Salathai Thai across the street). Had some mechanical problems with a noise a/c and drippy toilet at check in. The maintenance staff promptly repaired problem. The room/facility is "near-Ritz Carlton" in appointments, and tries hard to be exquisite. Even a couple of the Posh Girls stayed here for their kick off concert tour at the GM Center in town. But what made it 5 stars for us was David, one of the valet staff. Late Sunday afternoon, we wanted to take a taxi in the rain just to tour and get a feel for the city. David checked with concierge, and after 20 minutes they were unable to get a taxi they trusted to provide a tour. David grabbed the keys to the hotel car and took us to Stanley Park, Lion's Gate, Granville Island, Chinatown, Gastown, and the rest of the sights, and no cost from the hotel to us. We did treat David well, but he was exceptional, and I am sure represented the entire staff well. On top of a great deal through Priceline, we had a fine stay at a fine establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere! Not Worth the Money, Possibly Dangerous.”
Reviews.Author: jeaniebeanie74
Reviews.Content: We booked a 750 sq. ft. residence at the Sutton Place Hotel and wished we had payed a few dollars more for the Sheraton down the street. Immediately after checking into our room, I discovered a yellow waterfall-sized leak coming from the ceiling fan in the bathroom--looked and smelled like urine--flooding the entire bathroom floor and seeping into the hallway carpet. The gal at the front desk said it happened periodically when the guest in the upper floor apartment takes a shower and forgets to put the shower curtain inside the tub.
