I highly doubt that would cause a leak of that magnitude. We were afraid that the entire ceiling might cave in. There was obviously some construction engineering issues that the hotel has failed to address properly. We were switched rooms, but we were unimpressed. The layout of the apartment was really bizarre--maze-like. The one bathroom that had a shower in it was so small that if one was to use the toilet or sink, you couldn't open the bathroom door without crushing the other person, and it wasn't even connected to the master bedroom. Overall, the bedrooms were small and tough to walk around the bed comfortably, and one of the bureaus was missing a big chunk of wood underneath the glass. Some of the furniture was outdated and flimsy. The surround sound speaker system wasn't hooked up properly to the TV so that it only worked in DVD mode, which the hotel engineer didn't know how to fix. The hotel provided only enough coffee in the room to serve one cup of coffee, even though the coffee maker was for 10 cups. One of the two elevators on our floor didn't work properly--it only lit up when you wanted to go down, not up, and sometimes you waited 5 to 10 minutes for it to light up at all. Even the bellhop was embarrassed about it since there were so many people waiting for the elevator. There were drunks in front of the hotel taking leaks in the planters--that was about 8pm on a Friday night. The only positive thing about the hotel was its location--close to shopping, restaurants. They do have 24 hr room service, but the prices are atrocious for a mediocre menu.I was really surprised that AAA rated this hotel five diamonds. It was certainly very expensive, but I have stayed at classier hotels with better amenities & better service for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight! No hesitation in recommending”
Reviews.Author: montelparo_minnie
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend on my own between business travel in this hotel and was made to feel very welcome - what a beautiful place - superbly located in what appears to be a safe area, lots of shops, restaurants & entertainment right on the doorstep. For such a high standard of a hotel, the staff were exceptionally enthusiastic & friendly consistently - what a pleasure! The bed is just dreamy (go there & you'll know what I mean:)) Don Francesco's does great italian food across the road. I did order room service one evening & I'd probably rate it 3/5 for food quality - apart from that I couldn't fault the place & would definitely return. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: options2go
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was a 2 night pre-cruise treat. Received a very fair rate thru the hotel desk, and upon arrival was upgraded to a 1 bedrm suite. Location is great for restaurants (favorite was the Italian Kitchen at 1037 Alberni St), shopping, and sightseeing. The suite was delightful---good space, upscale decor, spacious bath with separate shower and tub, plasma TV's---all the luxury goodies were there, and the view was breathtaking. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly, efficient and helpful. The pool and spa were sparkling clean, though located in a connected building, so a bit of a stroll, but worth it. For city tours, the Hop On/Hop off Red Trolley bus stops across the street from the hotel for convenient access. I'd highly recommend this hotel to friends, and look forward to staying there again on the next visit to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huckle
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit and there will be a third. Vancouver is a great town and this hotel is perfect as far as location, amenities, staff, food, bar/lounge (a favorite). The concierge staff is excellent and is there 24 hours. See Shannon at the Gerard lounge, she is terrific. The food in the restaurant (Fleuri) s always good and served hot. There are no flaws as far as the staff is concerned in any position in the hotel. The rooms aren't spectacular but they are roomy with good linens and good amenities. The location is perfect, near shopping, restaurants, ferries but you don't have the feeling you are in the middle of anything. Two suggestions for improvement: -flat screen TV -free internet service for say, 20 minutes, you have to pay$6 for that now and it can get costly. Overall one of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place is The Best!”
Reviews.Author: prettybaby30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place hotel in Vancouver from September 15th-19th. And I have nothing but praises for this hotel. We stayed in a grand suite and from the moment our cab pulled into the hotel the outstanding service began. our luggage was taken care of and the check in was easy and quick the front desk was amazing. Our room was so beautiful HUGE like an apartment with a seperate living room and a huge LCD TV we had amazing views of the mountains and the city, Room service was just so YUMMY the food was amazing and the portions huge!. the conseage were friendly and helped us a lot when we needed directions to get places. The whole staff at the sutton were so friendly and they made you feel so important and special. I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this hotel if you want a plesent stay in Vancouver they will NOT let you down!! Next time we go back the Sutton will be our choice!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mama's cat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vancouver and spent 3 nights at Sutton Place after a land/cruise with Princess Cruises. It more than met our expectations, especially after reading some of the reviews on this site. We were upgraded from a twin room to a 2 bedroom apartment in La Grande Residence. It was huge and so comfortable. Exceptionally clean, well-maintained with nice furnishings and amenities. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world, and this compares to some of the best! I would not hesitate to stay again. Very pleasant and accomodating staff. Sorry that many have had unpleasant experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Best!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMom17
Reviews.Content: We finished up an Alaskan Land/Cruise tour with three wonderful nights in Vancouver and our second visit to the Sutton Place Hotel. Our King Suite was beautifully decorated with a large bedroom with king bed, triple dresser, large armoir with fat panel TV and lovely French Doors separating it from the living room. The living room featured wall to wall windows with a magnificent vista of the city as well as comfortable sofa and lounge chairs and a credenza with another large flat panel TV. There was a newly decorated marble bathroom with large soaking tub, glass enclosed stand alone shower and all the amenities one would expect in a hotel of this caliber...lighted magnifying make-up mirror, scales, hair dryer, high end toiletries in large sizes for the four of us to enjoy, and twice daily turn down service. The mattress and bed linens were wonderful with a deliciously warm and fluffy silk duvet to settle into on chilly Vancouver nights. The entire hotel staff was friendly and eager to please with no need too small for them to accommodate! You enter into a welcoming lobby with it's European luxury and ambience which sets the tone for your entire visit and finds you, at the end of your trip, hating to leave. An added feature is the convenient location, close to all the high end stores on Burrard and Robson, and last but not least, an incredible gourmet marketplace across the street. Don't leave without sampling some of their delicious pastries and coffee! And one last note,,,try to squeeze in a trip to the aquarium at Stanley Park, if at all possible. It's well worth your while!

Reviews.Title: “This is the one, a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DrShol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Grande Residence part of he hotel which is like an all suit (or more like flats), It has everything good size closed bedrooms, fully equipped kitchen, sitting room, good closet space, a balcony, and 2 flat LCD TV’s (one in the sitting room was huge). The staff are great and very professional, specially the concierge. The location is right in the middle of downtown 1 block from Robson street (where all the shopping, restaurants, and cafes are), there is a good supermarket next door ant a great cinema across the street. Believe it or not you get full room service of the hotel if you are staying less than a week. The only negative point is that you pay $26 for parking (Valet or self parking). When I was in Vancouver I stayed in the Marriott Pinnacle prior to an Alaskan cruise and then at the Sutton for 5 days I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: LesIllinois
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff attentive to every detail. Centrally located. Nice room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, It's expensive. Yes, it's worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Ryanthecubfan
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights here as the end to a picture perfect honeymoon. We had a romance package for one night, and a couples spa package for the next. I booked through Tourism Vancouver and found prices to be close to $100 cheaper than the published rate. Overall, the stay was great - the romance package consisted of a bottle of champagne on ice (ok, it was cheap sparkling wine, but wasn't horrible), some tasty chocolates, and in-room breakfast... The spa package was awesome - side by side couples massage, time in the steam room, and some sort of "Sugar Exfolation" - I'm sure the women reading this will understand, even if I don't.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Price is 5 Stars!!”
Reviews.Author: mytwobuckaroos
Reviews.Content: The only check mark I give Sutton Place five stars for is the price. The rest of the hotel is maybe 3 stars and that could be pushing it. DON'T come to this hotel expecting anything ultra nice or you will be disappointed. We stayed at this hotel through my husband's work. We were booked at the la Grande Residence which is part of the hotel but has two rooms, living area, full kitchen, etc. The price was about 350.00 per night. The sinks are made of parch board and laminate. It is not real marble or wood. It is the FAKE stuff. There is no counter space.The shower curtain looks like it is from the 99 cent store and it is hanging from cheap PLASTIC hooks. The towels are ragged and rough. My gym passes out towels of a higher quality. The beds are not comfy. For our air conditioning we have a plastic maytag unit placed by the desk. It runs all day to keep only the front room cool. The bedroom is hot. There is not central air or heat in the room. I just can't believe a 5 star hotel would think this is acceptable. To get to the pool you have to walk down two flights of metal stairs!!!! No access for the elderly or people with children. It was a real challenge. The pool has areas where the walls are rusting and the tile is dirty. We ate ate at the Fleuri Restaurant onsite the first night for a welcome dinner. The only thing good at the meal was the wine and dessert. The concierge was not helpful. They really had no clue about what kids would like to do in the city. The hotel gift shop is so small only 3 people can fit in it and the selection is limited. Overall, I would advise anyone considering this hotel to go elsewhere. The price and 5 star rating are not realistic. I will post some pictures!!

Reviews.Title: “Canada Day 2007”
Reviews.Author: azgilberttraveler
Reviews.Content: We are writing this review as we are currently staying here on Canada Day 2007. Just prior to our arrival at the Sutton Place, we stayed at the Sheraton Wall Center on the 29th floor so our review is based on a comparison of the two. The Sheraton Wall Center has new, clean, and modern furniture and bathroom facilities. The Sutton Place has older furniture which include a tub/shower combination and wallpaper that is bubbled in numerous places, obvious signs of age. Where the Sheraton Wall Center has a large open area for buses and taxis, the Sutton Place is tight and crowded. The staff in both are very friendly and helpful. The big difference between these two places is not in the helpful staff but the material furnishings and view. Although the Sheraton Wall Center is not rated a five star hotel they have a more comfortable bed, a separate tub/shower, a microwave, a mini fridge (not mini bar), a spacious bathroom, a spectacular view. The two hotels are about a block apart and the Sheraton was slighly less expensive. When we return to Vancouver we will definitely stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, facility needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: Came to Vancouver for 4 day business trip. The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier, all very professional. The problem is the hotel itself. Every element of decor and hardware from the shower handle to the (often inoperable) key system needs an upgrade. The staff does such a good job, it is difficult to be too negative but the Sutton Place has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer32
Reviews.Content: Although expensive this hotel has excellent rooms and staff and it's location is superb. The hotel is supposed to have a really good Jazz Brunch each Sunday, but make sure you book in advance since it's really popular.

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the best hotel experience I've had”
Reviews.Author: flu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sutton Place hotel in Vancouver, for 4 nights. We were amazed by the experience. First, people should know that is not a cheap hotel, and the service you get is first class. I've stayed at hotels in Xiamen, China where service is world renowned as some of the best if not the best (presumably, at least partly due to the labor being so cheap) and the service at the Sutton place closely matched, if not exceeded it. We heard that the owner of the Sutton place hotels was from Singapore so perhaps he had high expectations for his hotels, wherever they were. We had a ~40 inch flat panel TV with surround sound setup in our living area and another ~25 inch TV in the bedroom. The location was also very nice, there was a grocery store and bakery next to the hotel, and was within walking distance of many stores (tourist as well as department and boutique) and restaurants. Robson St and Davie St we're 2-4 blocks away and Denman St was probably a 20 minute walk. We also went to Victoria's chinese restaurant about 4 blocks away (in the basement of the Hyatt hotel) which had good, authentic chinese food. We heard that the Singaporean owner likes to come here for meals when he's in town. The parking was somewhat expensive at $28/day but you had valet service (which I think was free unless you included the tip) at the front door. It was very nice not having to look for a parking spot, and being able to call down to the valet from your room to bring out your car. The concierge and front desk staff were *extremely* helpful, friendly, efficient and knowledgeable at all hours of the day. There was an indoor pool (which I did not use) as well as what looked like a relatively large gym area with free weights and machines, as well as a spa service. There was internet access (wireless and wired) for a $14.95/day fee as well as a business center.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: dbrallmann
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the hotel June 15 and 16. We checked in very late on a Friday night, about 9pm , which may be why the staff was a delayed on greeting us for bags and valet. The agent who checked us in was very nice and helpful and sent our bags up after us. The bellman was very young and basically dropped the bags and left with his tip. At a 5 star, we are use to them showing us the room and pointing out important aspects of the hotel. We had room service very late. Great that they serve at this time, because we weren't familiar with the area and didn't feel like going out. Excellent food and friendly service. Very expensive though. The concierge was helpful with ideas about Victoria for the next day. I wish we would have known about paying additional to reserve a space on the ferry. One was full and since they didn't have a departure at 12 noon, we spent a very long time waiting to get on the island. Had breakfast in the restaurant and my son loved the crepes and I had the porridge. All very good. We went to the Vancouver aquarium on Sunday and would highly recommend it. The Beluga whales and otters were a hit for my son. Had afternoon tea that day and would highly recommend it. $21 per person and was very tasty. Excellent selections of tea to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Its seen better days”
Reviews.Author: clambake33
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went away for a quick weekend getaway to Vancouver and booked the Sutton for 3 nights. It is advertised as a 4-5 Star hotel. It is more like a 3 Star hotel. The hotel is showing its age, the furniture looks old, the bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. This is probably the reason why it was about $100 a night cheaper than similar hotels in the area. On the other hand, the service was good and it is in a convenient downtown area. We are not likely to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for missed connecting flight”
Reviews.Author: American500
Reviews.Content: My Princess Cruise ship arrived in Vancouver late which resulted in a missed airline departure back to the Texas. The cruise line booked me in for one night at the Sutton Place Hotel. Since there were 75+ more passengers all waiting in line to check -in for their rooms. Small bistro places and markets were closeby. I decided to walk around the neighborhood and get a bite to eat. Returning a couple of hours later, the front desk immediately checked me in. My room was top quality and had a great full-size picture window with a flat screen TV and a nice little sitting area. I think this hotel is used alot by the cruise lines, but I found it to be very nice and pleasant. Robson Street is close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Droushia
Reviews.Content: Perfection: beautiful, quiet rooms with amazing views plus attentive, courteous, helpful staff, and a fabulous location. Our group decided we will return next year same time. We loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: vision4bg
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Wotif.ca, very last minute (after deciding the night before that the Delta was too expensive). We turned up early, and were told we couldn't get the room requested, let alone check in early. That was fair enough, and we were able to leave bags there. On our return we asked if any of the king rooms were now available and were promptly upgraded to a grand suite (from the basic room) by the manager. Now that's service! The room was immaculate, and very impressively furnished. The attention from staff was fantastic, and the room service was delicious and timely. The location was very central to downtown, and the neighbourhood was great. All up I had a fantastic trip to the Sutton Place Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “What A Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: MrMichaelMonteforte
Reviews.Content: Oh Boy Here We Go! I was very very disapointed for the one night I stayed at The Sutton Place Hotel. This hotel is suppose to have a 5 Star rating, lets face it if you have a 5 Star rating, you better be able to back it up. Let's see, where do I begin? First we checked in and the lobby was very pretty, the room we got was small and hot, the air conditioning was not working. Be aware of Parking they charge $25.00 a night Wow! The furniture in the room was nothing like what it looked like on the website, the furniture was all scratched up and old looking. Construction going on at the residences brings the whole feel of the place down, makes everything look run down. We decided to go to the pool just to get out of the room, no premium channels are included, only local channels which was a big disapointment considering wanted to watch one of the last episodes of the Soprano's. Got to the pool and the hot tub had a sign saying "Out Of Order", the regular pool was freezing, you couldn't even stay in it more than 2 minutes. For what they charge per night $250.00 they should be able to afford to heat the pool. No towels available at pool level, had to go all the way upstairs, the change rooms smelled like dirty feet, Yuk it was terrible. Watch out the floors around the pool are very slippery you could fall and hurt yourself. Needless to say we checked out within 2 hours of our stay and went somewhere else. This hotel is over rated, the only good thing I can say is the staff is very courteous and well mannared and prompt. Don't stay here, try other cheaper hotels in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rwctraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in many. First, the hotel website is very deceiving! The hotel rooms and interior look nothing like the website photos. The lobby is very tiny; just the check-in desk. When we checked in we were told they had upgraded us to a suite. The suite was a kitchenette and a tiny bedroom with a plain bathroom. Plus, it had just been painted so I was getting dizzy from the paint fumes. I called the front desk to change rooms and was taken to the tower with the older rooms. The tower hallways and rooms had a very musty odor and the interior was extremely dated (late70's, early 80's). The room had cheap looking furniture, the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in and the bathroom was horrendous. The shower was reminiscent of a locker room and unusually small. If that weren't enough....the valet stole luggage out of our car. This included my husbads laptop, traveling identification, and sentimental fly fishing gear. It was convenient for the hotel when they told us the garage did not have any video cameras, and that they were not liable because they had outsourced the valet company to a third party. We have now learned to never ever leave anything in the rental car when using valet.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the construction out front!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimus
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel however I was really dissappointed to see they have construction going on right in front of the hotel which really took away from the experience...also seemed to be quite a few tour guests who were all over the hotel...if I was coming back to Vancouver for another relaxing trip I would find another place to stay...down by the water is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice staff, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: susan.nyc
Reviews.Content: We recently stay here on a business trip. I would no longer rate it as a five star. The staff is very friendly & helpful, the hotel itself is old. Athough it is a very beautiful hotel, I must say with the outdated tvs, older carpet, and horrible mattresses, I would not stay here again. I could actually feel the coils. Its a shame because the staff is 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CanadianSara
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and have stayed in hotels in Europe, US and across Canada. My boyfriend and I had just come from a difficult hotel experience in Whistler, so we may have been difficult to impress for our stay at the Sutton Place. We visited from March 14-16th and were extremely impressed with the hotel. We booked on Hotwire and received a deep discount. The hotel was luxury and 3 star prices for our costs. This didn't stop the hotel staff from treating us as if we'd paid full price. Check in was quick and friendly. Everytime we arrived at the front doors, the doormen were smiling and helpful. The valet staff were courteous and able to offer us suggestions to local clubs and restaurants. The concierge was helpful in booking us a reservation at Tojo's (side note: if you love sushi, go to Tojos - I am now retired from eating sushi as this was the best I've ever eaten). The rooms were quaint and comfortable. We had just stayed at a Westin which had advertised their beds as "heavenly". The Sutton didn't comment on the beds, but we found them to be like sleeping on a cloud. The notecard indicating the next days weather was a nice touch. Location could not have been better. We are shoppers, diners and club goers and found the Sutton to be perfect for all the above. Cab fares to some of the further attractions (Granville Island, Gastown) were very reasonable. Robson street is a few steps away, which was perfect for shopping and frequent visits back to the hotel to unload bags. This was a great stay, especially since we were coming from a difficult experience in Whistler. Highly recommended - even at full price!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: hsnur
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it looked nice and we found a great deal online. We were very surprised when we got there because it was nicer than we expected. The rooms were nice, clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. The food was great and so was the location. It's so convenient for travellers without a car. We had no complaints when we left - and that's really rare for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: icklesarah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sutton Place for 4 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon travelling around BC, and had an amazing time. The staff were wonderful... they even brought us strawberries and chocolate sauce when we arrived "for the honeymooners"! The chap who brought up our luggage spent time pointing out all the sights and areas from our window, which was really appreciated. The windows.... we stayed on the 14th floor and had a stunning view of the intersection of Robson and Burrard, with the sea and mountains in the background. Amazing. The bed, bathroom and TV were great, and the cleaning service stunning. We were trying to keep our costs down, and had originally booked the Burrard Motor in for the start of our honeymoon... but as a bit of last minute extravagance I booked the Sutton Place. We had a basic room, with a normal price of £250... but got it for £100 a night through hotels.com. It was DEFINITELY worth it... we stayed at the Burrard for our final night in Vancouver at the end of our honeymoon, and it was not a patch on the Sutton Place. It was definitely worth splashing out a bit for a really special start to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “bit overrated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oscat
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Vancouver before and had been getting very confused the more reviews I read online which suggested that some places were in rundown location (and for a solo female traveller safety is important) and some were too far away from attractions so I selected the Sutton Place. I paid way too much for it but after getting off a 16 hour flight and then having to spend 3 hours standing in a line at the Vancouver airport to get through customs I was looking forward to getting into the hotel whatever it had cost. The hotel is centrally located in the main shopping area. My room was high up in the hotel, had a great view, the bed was comfortable, the bath was lovely to soak in and the room service food was excellent. On saturday night I could hear a lot of noise from people walking along the corridor outside my room probably because the hotel is older with larger gaps under the doorways. The business centre was easy to find and although it cost a fair bit to use the internet, it was always available for the couple of days I was there. The concierge desk didn't have selection of tour brochures to enable me to decide what I'd like to see and didn't seem particularly helpful or were always too busy to assist. I got a taxi down to the Aquarium in Stanley park and picked up lots of tour brochures there then booked my own city tour in the afternoon which I can highly recommend (make sure it includes Granville Island as the markets there were wonderful). I didn't walk around the hotel area very much but found that most of the shops were high end expensive fashion or tacky tourist souvenir type shops. I am sure I would have discovered some gems if I'd taken the time to wander around more. It was a convenient base for someone who had never been to the city before and it was certainly a nice place to stay. On the return trip I stayed at the Westin Bayshore for its superior location right next to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Well posh!”
Reviews.Author: t-badger
Reviews.Content: My first time in a 5 star hotel, and it was...ok. Got a good deal, staying 4 nights on honeymoon in October. On first impressions we were very excited with all the little extras in the room, and the beautiful bedding and decor. Our room was a little on the small side by canadian standards, but perfectly adequate for the two of us. The view is amazing, i requested and got a room near the top, and the floor to ceiling window soon got covered in fingerprints as we clambered to point out all the landmarks. The location is fantastic, right in the center and only a few minutes walk to most attractions. The only disapointment was our room being next to the lifts. At first we put the frequent rumbling noise down to the wind outside, what with being so high up, but it soon became apparent that it was the lifts. It's not a particularly loud noise, and my wife probably wouldn't have noticed if i didn't keep going on about it, but i found it quite annoying. However, being typical Brits abroad, we didn't make a fuss, but would not want the same room again. Overall an excellent hotel, and we got a great deal considering the location and quality of the hotel (deservingly 5 star, and probably half the price of the Fairmont), but avoid rooms directly next to the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: yadakings
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some Best Western that I am more happier with compared to this so called 5 diamonds hotel. So overated. Stay here if you want to spend $24 for parking, old room, bathroom with mold on white grout, noisy air duct, shower with luke warm water (water heater broke), TV with short reception from remote (won't even work if you are laying on the bed), tiny room. Go for this if all you want is some bellboy holding the door for you, and say "hello". Stay away from this hotel if you want some real substance. *** I tried to post this negative comment on Travelocity where I booked the package. Despite trying to post it twice, they wouldn't reply and post the comment. Talk about crooked website, consumers beware of their comments and feeback !! *****

Reviews.Title: “Not quite right”
Reviews.Author: picklebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sutton Place Hotel in early November 2006. We were in town for a conference and had been to vancouver before. I was disappointed with this hotel. Some things about it are great: the service is very solicitous, the lobby is comfortable, the fitness room is nice, and the room (although small) was comfortable. Now for the things that weren't so great. There are two wings of this hotel. We were staying in the wing closer to Robson St. (east wing?) which seemed to be the lesser of the two. Two of the three mornings and one afternoon we were unable to get hot water (only lukewarm) for a shower. When I called the front desk, they said that the boiler is functional but that too many people were showering. They suggested that I shower in the fitness room/spa, which I did. Luckily they provide bathrobes. But I still felt rather silly traipsing through the lobby in my bathrobe. This is not 5 star living! And the toilet in our room was running. We told housekeeping about the problem, but they did nothing to fix it in the time we were there. There was a $12/day charge for internet service. We paid for one day's worth, and there were about 3 hours when it was "down." They did not offer to refund my money. But the location is great and these were inconveniences rather than severe problems. We had previously stayed at the Wedgewood and the Sheraton, both of which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Beds are awful...”
Reviews.Author: Willie83
Reviews.Content: Went on Expedia's 5 star rating for this Hotel and how all the celebrities stay there so I thought this is a true 5 star Hotel...Wrong... First of all this is not a 5 star..maybe a 3..the beds and the linens were horrific and it was just not up to any type of luxury. The staff is terrific and I highly suggest eating at the gorgeous Gerards Bar.. great drink and food. Why don't hotels get it that you spend 7-8 hours in the bed so step it up, especially if you are calling your hotel a Luxury Collection. Have coffee a couple of blocks away called Cafe Artigiano.. outstanding.. I would stay next time at the Fairmount Hotel down the street..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights in October 2006. The plusses of the hotel are primarily the location. You are right in the heart of downtown Vancouver on Burrard Street, which puts you within walking distance of the scene on Robson Street. There are several restaurants that are worth going into around the hotel. You are also 3 blocks walking distance from the SkyTrain, the world's largest automated light rail transit system. The hotel staff was wonderful. The maids come to do a turndown on your room if you like, and fill up your ice bucket. The concierge desk is staffed with knowledable people who have answers for everything. We had a premium room on the 21st floor. The king bed was very comfortable. The room was clean (maybe not spacious, but adequate), and the washroom was stacked with higher end toiletries. Would consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service at The Sutton Place”
Reviews.Author: Lizontheroad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed three nights in the Sutton Place hotel in Vancouver. This was the kick-off for our three week journey through B.C. / Alberta, and could not have started any better with this great hotel. The rooms were spacious and well-equipped. Some previous comments remarked that the service was not five star. We found especially the service at front desk and concierge exceptional! For example, we enquired about some X-Files locations in town and the lady went out of her way to get this information for us. The pool / sauna is ok, we used it only once after our arrival. We cannot comment on the quality of the hotel restaurants as we always ate outside the hotel (there are great Sushi places nearby and other nice places). In case you are thinking about taking the Airport Bus to this hotel, please note that it was last "on route" in our case, which meant a long ride (more than 1 hour) before finally getting to this great hotel. Overall, we can recommend staying in the Sutton Place hotel due to it's central location and great service. Having walked Vancouver extensively, we did find no other hotel that we would have liked to stay in instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ayvc
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver and staying at the Sutton Place made our trip enjoyable. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful. The concierge desk was extremely helpful in recommending dining options and activities. The hotel was very clean including the room. We stayed 4 nights and thouroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. The only complaint was the business center. You have to pay to use the internet which is $6.00 for 20 minutes & $20.00 for an hour. But there was a problem with the internet connection one night and we were given a free hour card to use. The location is really good right in the heart of Vancouver & within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. Room service and the in house restaurant were pricey thus we elected to venture out and eat elsewhere. Parking is $24.00/day which includes valet parking. You can exchange your money at the front desk which was convenient. We would highly recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Service, nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: The Sutton Place Hotel is a lovely upscale hotel right next to Robson Street. The service at this hotel is very good, and the concierges are very helpful! Our room was nicely decorated, but small. Room service was very nice and very elegant! The location of the hotel couldn't be better, steps away from Robson street and a very nice movie theater. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guynextdoor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 06 for 5 nights. Was a very good hotel. As part of our 2 week holiday in Canada we stayed in a total of 7 different hotels (from Vancouver, Victoria, Banff, other Rockies area, and finally Montreal), and I'd say Sutton Place provided the highest level of service (and I'm comparing with Banff Springs and Marriott Chateau in this comparison). From the size of the room, to the gowns, the pool & steam room, check-in process, knowledge of the concierge, to the small details like the chocolates they bring each night when they turn down the beds, the newspaper outside your door (Banff Springs didn't offer that, nor the chocolates!), and of course the location which is excellent, especially for the shopping. As the price wasn't TOO expensive, I'd say it's excellent value for what you actually get. I forgot to add that it's where the 'Hollywood North' people stay which was much in evidence! Just people watch from the lobby area and you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: M90_AMT
Reviews.Content: After travelling 21 hours to get to Canada, this hotel hit the spot. Arrived with a plane load of cruisers, catching a Princess cruise the next day. They dealt with the crowd quickly and efficiently with minimum paperwork - excellent check-in. Cases delivered to and collected from room efficiently. The room was comfortable, good size, big bathroom, bathrobes, nice toiletries, stocked mini-bar, quiet at night. Staff pleasant. Hot food on breakfast buffet was not 5* but was above average although pricey at 22$ for the buffet. However you could have made-to-order dishes if preferred so excellent choice overall. Liked the location, very central but quiet at night. Could walk to shops, gastown area and to harbour. Swimming pool and changing rooms excellent. All in all a very comfortable and pleasant stay. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice (with the right expectations)”
Reviews.Author: Sheriefb
Reviews.Content: I concur with the others - this is a nice hotel, with a convenient location, but its not up to 5 star level. The facilities are 3.5 star and the staff is 4 star, IMHO. Little things that do not cause serious issues prevent it from reaching top level: i.e., during our 4 night stay the soap was never replaced so by the end we were dealing with a sliver to clean ourselves. Similarly, while the concierge staff was helpful and knowledgeable, they just did not go the extra mile (when we asked about ticket availability for a show, they gave us the information but did not offer to try to make reservations for us - we had to ask if they could do that on our own). I have no real complaints - we got a good price on line, everything was indeed very nice, our stay enjoyable and, thanks to this site, my expectations were not too high. So, a good choice at the right price and with the right expectations!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star you have to be kidding”
Reviews.Author: FXMASTER
Reviews.Content: We prebooked the Hotel and arrived early at about 1pm (check in is 3pm) our room was not ready so we went out for lunch and came back at 3pm still not ready, we eventually got into our room at 4pm ( after lining up 3 times in a very long line in a very cramped check in area) our room was clean but very tired, the bathroom door did not close and the bathroom fan did not work which made the bathroom very steamy when you took a shower. If this is a 5 star hotel you have to be joking, I usually stay at the Sheraton Wall Centre and will return there next time that I am in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: pianorlh
Reviews.Content: Absolutely not a luxury hotel, if that is what you are looking for. We stayed at the hotel for two nights on our way to Whistler and were hoping for the room quality, amenities and service typical of a 5 star hotel. We booked a suite directly throught the hotel and asked lots of questions before we arrived to insure that we would be happy with our stay. Firstly, the rooms did not meet our standards. The sheets on the beds were not the high count cotton that we had been told that they had. There was a blanket/bedspread that never got the sheets on both sides to keep it sanitary. The beds were uncomfortable and sagged a great deal in the middle. The shower stall needed to be renovated, seemed clean, but very outdated. Secondly, the service was mediocre. The woman that checked us in was patently nasty. Upon arriving in the room we waited quite some time for our luggage to follow. But it never did. We called down to the desk to request our luggage for the second time and we were assured that it was on its' way. We waited another 20 minutes or so and decided to just leave. When we returned to the room in the early evening to change before dinner, our luggage still did not arrive! At this point we called the hotel manager. He was apologetic and had our luggage (finally) sent to our room. The staff, including the concierge and bellmen, were friendly and helpful. If you go to this hotel expecting a luxury experience then you wil be disappointed. If you expect a middle of the road experience and you aren't that picky, then the hotel is fine. However, if you are the type that wants the five star experience then wait until the Four Seasons finishes their renovation and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Hotel, Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: CasperUSA
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel but not 5* like other posters have mentioned. The room is well appointed but small- either 1 king bed or 2 single beds (around 225 sqft). The indoor pool and spa are nice/clean but small- don't be fooled by the photos. The fitness center is above average but not great. The restaurants looked good but are very expensive. The 5* rating must come from the service, which is terrific, because the amenities are 3* to 4* at best. I paid around $140/night (USD) for the room but would not pay more. Considering what other hotels in the area charge during the summer months I won't complain about my rate. But I just don't understand how this establishment can be considered 5*. If you want the latter, try the Pan Pacific, Four Seasons, or Fairmont Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot such service existed”
Reviews.Author: Wilkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to an Alaskan cruise. Having spent eight days in the Rockies, arrived very hot and a little dishevelled entering the hotel at the "exit" entrance. From the moment the car door was opened for me to the moment we left the following day, thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay - just wished it had been longer. Sutton Place should be thoroughly proud of its employees, all were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Turned our car round for us and gave us detailed instructions on how to find the hire company. I would like to apologise though to housekeeping. As I said we had spend eight wonderful days in the Rockies and on our arrival at the hotel, started to re-organise our luggage for the cruise. It was such a beautiful day outside that we only half finished. To our horror, on our return to the hotel later in the evening, housekeeping had been to turn down the bed and leave a chocolate on our pillow. What they must have thought of the mess heaven only knows. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It offers the kind of courteous, almost old fashioned service, that we thought had vanished a long time ago. Well done to all.
